story:
Our new Moringa Green Energy shots are a cross between a green juice and a cup of coffee with the benefits of both. Please visit www.kulikulifoods.com or your local Whole Foods store to purchase them today!

Moringa is the most nutritious plant on the planet. Moringa leaves are more nutritious than kale and provide a complete protein, similar to meat or quinoa. Kuli Kuli was founded by a former Peace Corps Volunteer to use moringa as a tool to improve nutrition worldwide. Through our last Indiegogo campaign, we launched our Moringa Superfood Bars into over 500 stores across the US, planting 60,000 moringa trees and providing a sustainable livelihood to 500 women farmers in Ghana. Now we want to do it again, launching a Moringa Green Energy Shot that will revitalize you while revitalizing Haiti.

What's a Moringa Green Energy Shot?

Kuli Kuli’s Moringa Green Energy Shots combine vitamin-rich Haitian moringa with green tea and natural fruit flavors to provide a powerful green energy boost. Each shot is equal to a cup of coffee and half a cup of leafy greens to power you through your day. Try it as part of a healthy breakfast, before a long run, or as an afternoon pick-me-up. Every revitalizing shot you take helps to plant moringa trees and support farmers in Haiti. Nourishing you, nourishing the world!

Why Haiti Needs Moringa Trees

Haiti has the highest risk of climate disaster of any country in the world, largely due to deforestation. International development agencies have spent billions of dollars to reforest Haiti but the trees are often cut down to use as cooking fuel. 70% of Haitians live off less than $2 dollars a day. Haiti also has the highest rate of malnutrition of any country in the Western Hemisphere. Moringa thrives in Haiti's dry climate and is incredibly nutritious, making moringa trees the ideal solution to help battle deforestation and malnutrition in Haiti. By launching Moringa Green Energy Shots in the US, Kuli Kuli and the Smallholder Farmers Alliance will provide hundreds of Haitian moringa farmers with a sustainable income. This will ensure farmers will protect the trees and have access to nutritious moringa leaves. 

What's the Money for?

Starting a supply chain from scratch and creating an entirely new product are both large and expensive undertakings. The good news is that we have already raised half the funds we need through our partners. But we need $100,000 more to do our first moringa harvest in Haiti and manufacture our Moringa Green Energy Shots. Whole Foods Market has agreed to launch these shots nationwide, if only we can raise the funds to make it happen. 

Our Story

After working with moringa in the Peace Corps to reduce malnutrition, Kuli Kuli’s CEO Lisa Curtis wanted to help communities around the world  grow moringa and improve the health of their families.

Kuli Kuli and the Smallholder Farmers Alliance (SFA) began working together in early 2015 to plant moringa trees in Haiti. SFA was founded by Hugh Locke and Timote Georges to help feed and reforest a renewed Haiti by establishing farmer cooperatives, creating farm businesses, and contributing to community development.

Kuli Kuli and SFA are partnering to bring moringa trees to Haiti and Moringa Green Energy Shots to a store near you!

 

Thank you so much for your support! Please help us spread the word. For examples, see tweets below from our favorite celebrity supporters.

story:
Ongoing work is needed at the GGP Disc Golf Course

  • Brick projects for erosion control and drainage on holes 15/11/12/18
  • Erosion containment areas on hole 11/18.
  • We need tier work on #11/12.
  • Removing trash from trash cans on all holes
  • Add Drain rock to all the paths in need.
  • There are more tee sign on #16 needs to be replaced.
  • Constant maintenance due to ever-increasing foot traffic as daily new disc golfers explore their obsession.

What we need:

Support through funding to keep the workers on the course. providing for and serving the rapidly growing disc golf community in San Francisco and the greater Northern California region.

Through the tireless work and dedication, the Golden Gate Park Disc Golf Course will be the premiere free public course in the United States.

We've made great strides!

Planting grass in numerous locations to stop and control Erosion on our sand based course.

Purchased a truck to use for hauling and course maintainence, its already earned its place in the SFDGC Fam.

  • Erosion control on pathway on Hole 12
  • Drain rock placed around teepads #11 and #12 to stop flooding and mud tees.
  • The TEMPLE structure on Hole #11
  • The "Great Wall" on hole #6
  • Improved teebox area on #12

Drastically reduced play-through times on 11, 12, 14 with proper maintenance of the hill side.That is now covered in GRASS!!!

New Tee Signs!

More seating!

Erosion control tier on 18 to save main tree by the C pin.

...and last but certainly not least the course is continuing to get more GREEN!

story:
UPDATE: Wow!It's been a week and we've already surpassed our goal. I can't thank my friends & comrades enough!

 I've decided to see if we can reach $800 - it would really help to have the additional $300 to fund my travels from West Virginia to the Unist'ot'en Camp in British Columbia (and back). 

Previously, I was planning on taking a loan to travel, but if we can 'indiegogo' it, when I get back to Appalachia I can continue the work I have been doing building and supporting the resistance to extreme extraction instead of doing unrelated work to re-pay the loan. 

I would very much appreciate your help in ensuring that I can personally deliver a brand new chainsaw for the camp and support the Wet'suwet'en clan for 3 weeks  - and return to Appalachia ready to get back to work.

My name's David and I plan on traveling to the Unist'ot'en Camp in April. Members of the Wet'suwet'en clan are re-occupying their land in the forests of northern British Columbia to stop an array of oil and gas pipelines planned for that area without their permission. I hope to stay with the camp for 3 weeks and bring a brand new chainsaw for the camp, funded by my comrades and allies in Appalachia and beyond.

Why a chainsaw? First and foremost, I spoke to caravan organizers, and I was told that the camp is always in need of chainsaws. Chainsaws are important because of construction and fuel for warmth. If you watch the short film about the Unist'ot'en Camp (just google "How To Stop An Oil And Gas Pipeline"), you'll see people actively building large wooden structures in the path of invading pipelines.

Chainsaws are also an appropriate gift from Appalachia to the camp - as it is a tool that we have in common. Creating firewood and lumber from timber is an important part of the cultural fabric of rural Appalachia -- many families heat their homes this way. 

Plus, to be honest, I like chainsaws.

Chainsaws of the caliber that I think would be most useful for the camp run at around $400-500. I want to make sure we are delivering a powerful and reliable chainsaw that is worthy of fighting the oil and gas giants.

If I can make it to Canada, I will deliver this chainsaw personally. If I can't, I will send the funds to the camp. I look forward to cutting a lot of wood and doing anything else I can to support the encampment if i can make it!

I have been active in the fight to protect the mountains and people of Appalachia for 5 years. As political prisoner David Gilbert (among many others) has pointed out, it's important that our local struggles take inspiration from and lend our strength to global struggles, especially those struggles led by indigenous people and people of color. Work like this strengthens both our movements!

story:
Short Summary (last updated 1-14-14)

Jennifer Saleem needs our help now. She had her second surgery for what was first thought to be just a pilonadal cyst on 12-12-13, and is now awaiting her next surgery on January 29, because they ran tests and figured out that she actually has a birth defect called a "postsacral teratoma" (*Read Jennifer's blog post series that describes what she's going through, here: "My Tail of Woe: Everything you wanted to know about my Butt and Then Some")... The surgeons will perform an invasive surgery to remove at least 4 tumors that have spread into her lower back around and up behind her tail bone. She will be left with a 3-4 inch wide open-healing wound and 18 months minimum recovery time where she will not be able to sit, squat, bend over, kneel down, walk or stand for longer than 15 minutes, etc. She is and will continue to be in a lot of pain. As a mother to an almost 5 year old (4 1/2), and a woman who also suffers from Colitis and Celiac Disease, Jennifer has a full plate of discomfort and hardship...

She already had a golf ball size growth removed on 12-12-13, and has a 1 inch hole above her buttocks line, and is awaiting the more intense surgery which will actually remove 8-10 inches of tissue, with a 3-4 inch hole left open to heal from the inside out. They going to scrape down to her muscle and some of her bone. A Slow and PAINFUL recovery is her reality now... 

She and her family cannot afford to hire any outside help, let alone pay the already discounted cost of the surgery and the supplies she'll need monthly to care for her wound.

What We Need & What You Get

The generous surgeons understand Jennifer's financial situation and have dropped the cost of her surgery from upwards of $20,000 to a reasonable $7,000. This generous discount is still too much out-of-pocket for Jennifer's family. In addition to the initial cost of the surgery Jennifer needs Private Home Care Assistance for a minimum of 18 months.

Surgery - $7,000

Supplies like gauze, sterile soaking fluid, bandages, etc. - $600 per month

Housekeeper / Living Assistace - $15,000-22,000+

Jennifer needs more than 2-3 hours of help a day, but she is going to take what she can get. I had originally calculated a 2 hour a day plan, and then decided to calculate a 3 hours a day schedule (after I'd made the video) for her to hire care at $15 an hour (which is on the low end of what qualified people charge) because even 3 is barely enough... Basically it'd be:

$15 per hour for 3 hours a day, 7 days a week for 18 months... or

$15 per hour for 2 hours a day, 7 days a week for 18 months...

Which adds up to our TOTAL GOAL of: $30,000+

After fees to pay inidiegogo and Paypal the total raised if we meet our goal will be around $3,000 lower once it gets to Jennifer. So, our goal is not going to cover all of her costs but it will make it possible to get care for at least a year or so... We're totally being modest and understating how enormous of a financial burden this is going to be for her.

>>For every donation you will get the satisfaction of knowing you contributed to Jennifer's healing journey and well-being. She needs all the support she can get right now. Anything you can give will help her family out, and lessen the burden. With donations of $25 or more you can receive various perks including: free eBooks (written by Jennifer), a private Spiritual Aromatherapy Consultation or Tarot/Oracle card reading, a mention in one of Jennifer's blog posts for your business or organization, and/or a ad space on Jennifer's very popular blog (http://www.hybridrastamama.com)

Jennifer's Physical Limitations

No sitting, squatting, bending, lifting, etc... How does one do this and still take care of her daughter and home...? (I don't know.) She needs more than 3 hours of help a day! She needs so much help... I cannot emphasize enough how challenging this is going to be (and already is) for Jennifer. She struggles every day not having hired help. She needs your donations urgently!

The Impact

Jennifer helps other people every single day. She goes way beyond the average blogger and pours her heart into every well-researched post or valuable project she embarks upon. She has created a community of health-minded people surrounding her blog and Facebook page, and is well-loved and appreciated for her contributions that she does for free. The least we can do is give back to her now in her crisis. Your donations, positive thoughts, and help spreading this campaign will allow Jennifer to heal faster and continue to write articles that help thousands of people improve their health. You can make a huge difference in the lives of many by helping Jennifer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t donate, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Send your love, prayers, and good wishes for Jennifer and her family.
  • Contact Lauren about preparing 100% Gluten Free meals for Jennifer
  • Stay updated about Jennifer's progress on our Help Jennifer Heal FB page.

THANK YOU!!!

story:
Welcome & thank you for visiting our page!  We have created this fund in order to help raise money to provide the best possible care & assistance for our beloved mother and grandmother, Ollie Myrna.   

Ollie Myrna, or "Nanny" as her grandchildren affectionately call her, has Alzheimer's disease. Nanny is 84 years old, and has been coping with Alzheimer's for the past several years.  With the assistance of her family, Nanny was able to live a partially independent life.  However, this July, Nanny's condition progressed to the stage where she requires 24/7 care.

Nanny has always selflessly sacrificed for her family, and now in her time of need, we want nothing more than to provide her with the best possible level of care.      

We kindly ask for your help in raising money for Nanny's Alzheimer's assistance.  Your generous donation will go 100% towards her care.  No matter how small, your contribution is greatly appreciated.   

Thank you very much,

Laura Murdoch & Family 

P.S. For updates & more information, please feel free to visit our Facebook page at: 

http://www.facebook.com/nannycarefund

story:
Short Summary

Kristian is an Honor student going into the 11th grade. He is a drummer in marching band which placed first in state for their division and is in concert band. Kristian is a great kid, always studying at school and helping other kids with their school work. Kristian is always aiming for A's in all his classes especially his honor classes. Kristian hopes to become a lawyer one day and is starting his studies early. Kristian was about to begin a police academy training camp for a week when we discovered his hernia. He is supposed to attend scout camp in July and then band camp for two weeks.

Kristian has an Indirect Inguinal Hernia. The surgeon hopes to be able to stitch the problem rather than inserting mesh that will last with Kristian the rest of his life. We are hopeful too.

This surgery will put him out the rest of his summer holidays and of course put a hold on his police training camp. He has worked so hard we would hate for him to miss all the activities he works so hard to be a part of.

What We Need

The funds raised will go directly to the insurance costs (about $5,000), and after surgery care.

If we do not reach our goal, any funds we do raise will still go towards the bills.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any little bit helps, you can give $1 to $500, there's no minimum or cap. I know many of our friends and family have already sent support so thank you all so much.


If you would like to share this campaign on facebook feel free to do so.

story:
I would like to introduce myself to you. My name is Tommy Seilheimer; I am 37 years old, a father of 2 teenagers, a musician, a marketing/brand executive an avid entrepreneur and love and live life to the absolute fullest. I would ask that you read this entire story about my cousin Annie so that you can see just how much of an impact you can make on one little girl’s life and her entire family. I decided to put this donation page in the hopes of people like you could connect with Annie’s story and her fight for life…

The story I am about to tell you doesn’t evoke happiness, but rather about getting some financial relief to fight a brutal disease named Leukemia, which has started a battle of it’s own inside my cousin Annie’s body.

Annie Wagner is 17 years of age. She has Down Syndrome. Annie has a Brother named Lawrence Wagner who served in Iraq. Shortly after her brother came back from duty Annie was diagnosed with Bilineal Leukemia in February 2012.

VIDEO OF Annie

Annie’s Father Joseph works very hard to take care of his family. Annie’s Mother (Amy Wagner), takes care of Annie at home. Annie’s Leukemia is rare because of her Down Syndrome and her age as a teen. After Annie’s first round of Chemo she contracted Metapontum ( the common cold virus) that almost took Annie’s life in April 2012.

Annie has since responded to the Chemo Treatments and is now in remissionm but still has two long years of Chemo treatments to come.

What Annie has is called Bilineal Leukemia which is a rare disease with a poor outcome because she has Downs Syndrome, and on top of that, she is just a teenager. After Annie's chemo treatments, she contracted what is known as Meta Pneumo.

What is Leukemia? In simple terms, Leukemia is cancer of the blood cells. It starts in the bone marrow; the soft tissue inside most bones and bone marrow is where blood cells are made. Over time, leukemia cells can crowd out the normal blood cells. This can lead to serious problems such as anemia, bleeding, and infections. Leukemia cells can also spread to the lymph nodes or other organs and cause swelling or pain. In other words, this is something that needs to be treated on a daily basis to ease the pain of this disease.

We want Annie to experience life as all of us reading this have, and pull-through the treatment with unlimited support and determination. She has an amazing and supportive family who are by her side 24/7, and now we are looking at any size donation to put towards an amazing cause… that cause is the gift of life.

My goal is to raise just $1800 for my cousin Annie. Just something to ease the pain of high medical bills and to keep the life saving treatments going. Annie’s parents (My Uncle Joe and Aunt Amy) are some of the strongest and loving people on this planet, so just know your donations will benefit a family that has open arms and 100% of the proceeds go to Annie’s expenses.

This fundraiser is not a 501C3 Charity.
story_txt:
I would like to introduce myself to you. My name is Tommy Seilheimer; I am 37 years old, a father of 2 teenagers, a musician, a marketing/brand executive an avid entrepreneur and love and live life to the absolute fullest. I would ask that you read this entire story about my cousin Annie so that you can see just how much of an impact you can make on one little girl’s life and her entire family. I decided to put this donation page in the hopes of people like you could connect with Annie’s story and her fight for life…
The story I am about to tell you doesn’t evoke happiness, but rather about getting some financial relief to fight a brutal disease named Leukemia, which has started a battle of it’s own inside my cousin Annie’s body.
Annie Wagner is 17 years of age. She has Down Syndrome. Annie has a Brother named Lawrence Wagner who served in Iraq. Shortly after her brother came back from duty Annie was diagnosed with Bilineal Leukemia in February 2012.
VIDEO OF Annie
Annie’s Father Joseph works very hard to take care of his family. Annie’s Mother (Amy Wagner), takes care of Annie at home. Annie’s Leukemia is rare because of her Down Syndrome and her age as a teen. After Annie’s first round of Chemo she contracted Metapontum ( the common cold virus) that almost took Annie’s life in April 2012.

Annie has since responded to the Chemo Treatments and is now in remissionm but still has two long years of Chemo treatments to come.
What Annie has is called Bilineal Leukemia which is a rare disease with a poor outcome because she has Downs Syndrome, and on top of that, she is just a teenager. After Annie's chemo treatments, she contracted what is known as Meta Pneumo. 
What is Leukemia? In simple terms, Leukemia is cancer of the blood cells. It starts in the bone marrow; the soft tissue inside most bones and bone marrow is where blood cells are made. Over time, leukemia cells can crowd out the normal blood cells. This can lead to serious problems such as anemia, bleeding, and infections. Leukemia cells can also spread to the lymph nodes or other organs and cause swelling or pain. In other words, this is something that needs to be treated on a daily basis to ease the pain of this disease.
We want Annie to experience life as all of us reading this have, and pull-through the treatment with unlimited support and determination. She has an amazing and supportive family who are by her side 24/7, and now we are looking at any size donation to put towards an amazing cause… that cause is the gift of life.
My goal is to raise just $1800 for my cousin Annie. Just something to ease the pain of high medical bills and to keep the life saving treatments going. Annie’s parents (My Uncle Joe and Aunt Amy) are some of the strongest and loving people on this planet, so just know your donations will benefit a family that has open arms and 100% of the proceeds go to Annie’s expenses.
This fundraiser is not a 501C3 Charity.

story:
Thank you to all those who participated in this campaign either by contributing or by sharing our link! 

Congratulations to Brooke Tatum whose referrals brought in the most dollars to our campaign.  She wins our Grand Prize, a full set of PrettyCool bedding worth over $1000!!!

Contributors will be receiving emails shortly to acknowledge contributions and to clarify information for getting perks sent out. We're still on track to deliver tanks and tunics by Christmas!!

Our web store is now live at www.PrettyCoolWoman.com with all of our products and gift cards available!!

 


Hi.



I'm Dr. Debra Solomon. Based on my own personal experience and need, I've created an effective, fashionable, non-medical solution to hot flashes and night sweats. It's so simple, effective, and life-changing that I want to share it with the world of women--and the men who share their challenges!! 

 

 

 Having experienced hot flashes and night sweats myself, I can tell you--they are:

  • Uncomfortable

  • Unpredictable

  • Distracting

  • Distressing

  • Disruptive

  • and potentially Debilitating.

I needed to get past my temperature regulation issues to be at my best for my patients, my family, and my community and I know that there are millions of other women--and men and couples--with temperature issues who could experience life-changing benefits from our temperature regulating garments and bedding products too.  

Beyond making and selling products that work, we're looking at being game changers in the health/wellness world and in fashion.  We're done with the top down approach of the fashion industry and the medical world. We want to create a non-standard shopping experience in which our customers will be our consultants, our models, and our sales force--and share in the rewards of our success.  In addition to crowd-funding, we're looking to crowd-create as well.  We want to forge a new relationship with our customers--one where we are responsive to their input and we serve their needs.

I'm 55 years old and I just recently went through the menopausal change.  I used to suffer from hot flashes and night sweats. They are still there in the background of my day somewhere, but I found an effective way to tame them without medication. 

As a physician in psychiatric practice for 30 years, I've always seen medicines as a powerful last resort to be used when the benefits clearly outweigh the risks.   But I've watched the pharmaceutical industry "medicalize" all kinds of normal life issues.  Now they're investing heavily to develop new drugs for menopausal women. I think we need to be cautious about this. Menopause is no more a disease than childhood, adolescence, or pregnancy and many of the often-recommended hormones and medications may cause more problems than they treat. 

But the standard non-medical advice on dealing with hot flashes - carry little fans and spray bottles, wear layers we can strip off in public, avoid spicy food and hot drinks, wear clothing that wicks away sweat, etc. - wasn't good enough for me.  I wanted something safe AND effective.  Something that would reliably stop or diminish my hot flashes BEFORE the sweating and distraction and loss of sleep. 

Fortunately for me--and you--my hot flashes coincided with a solar heating project my husband was working on with "phase change technology" and I wondered whether it could be used in clothing...

Sure enough, it has been applied to fabrics in NASA space suits, in firefighter gear, and in some sports gear.  But no one before now has created garments specifically for the 15 million or more of us women who need temperature regulation 24/7, day and night. 

 

 

 

When I started working on this project, it was important to ME to have garments as stylish as they were effective, that I could wear ALL the time since hot flashes happen any time.  It was astounding to me that, not only was no one catering to our physical needs in the fashion industry, so many of the fashions for older women seem to be reworked versions of the designs created for younger women.  There are so many of us, I thought.  Doesn't anyone care what we want and need to wear?  So I figured we needed an insider to create a new paradigm in fashion and comfort for more mature women.  And that's how PrettyCoolWoman Cooling Tanks and Cooling Tunics began...

 

How it works (and why it's better than anything else out there)

Our products use microencapsulated Phase Change Materials (PCM) that are embedded in the fiber of the fabric. Under 5000x magnification, they look like this:

The patented processes for integrating PCM into fiber for textiles was originally developed for NASA for use in space suits. We license the technology from Outlast LLC, the patent-holder. "Phase Change" in this technology simply means the change from solid to liquid (melting) and liquid back to solid (freezing).

 

Here's an example of a common phase change material - water!

The graph shows what happens to the temperature of water as it absorbs heat. The flat portion of the line shows the constant temperature of 32° as it melts from ice to liquid. Water absorbs a lot of energy while it melts, but the temperature stays constant until the ice is completely melted. Of course, 32° is too cold, so we use PCM based on other materials (mostly waxes) that melt and solidify at ideal temperatures for natural skin comfort. It works without ever wearing out, for the entire life of the fabric!

Our PrettyCoolWoman phase change materials are pro-active.  They'll minimize your temperature swings so you don't have to sweat, but, just in case, we've added wicking action and antibacterial properties to the fabric too so you don't have to worry about a thing!

 

We Need Your Support, You Need Our Products

We have assembled some of the best minds and hands we could find to create a series of prototypes. 

We now have our pattern and sizing perfected for real women's bodies and the right fabric blend for maximum effectiveness, look and comfort.  

                         CoolingTunic                                              CoolingTank

 

 

Because this special fabric has to be custom made and dyed in large minimum quantities, we had to order almost a mile in black to get started!  It will be knit and dyed to our specifications right here in the United States and our production line in Albuquerque is just waiting for the material to arrive.

Here's your chance to order your CoolingTanks and CoolingTunics in black.  If we can sell a few hundred, we have a business.  When we get to a couple thousand, we'll be on our way to changing the world together!

We've already spent thousands of our own dollars getting to where we are now.  We've bought fabric, paid designers and pattern makers, and spent thousands of hours in research and development. 

Our initial goal of $25,000 will cover some of those expenses. Another $10,000 will  allow us to begin a line in soft white.

$60,000 will get us to run a third color (or style) that you get to vote on.

Check out our perks.  In addition to our PrettyCoolWoman CoolingTanks and CoolingTunics, we're offering a full line of PrettyCoolHome temperature regulating bedding that your sleeping partner will appreciate as much as you do!

And, if you can't use our products yourself, you can buy them as gifts!

Or, donate them to one of our listed non-profits or a non-profit of your choice that can accept gifts in kind.  We'll ship them there and make sure you get the receipt for your donation. 

 

IMPACT!

Let's create a movement together!  We can't do this without you!  Even if you are not a customer right now, PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD THROUGH YOUR NETWORK!!!  Every woman will eventually reach menopause and likely need this relief. We want to be there, ready to serve. And that means we need to establish a sustainable business NOW. Help us do that, so we can be there for your mothers, your sisters, your daughters, your wives, your friends and maybe even you!

You can use Indiegogo share tools or go to our website at www.PrettyCoolWoman.com

Don't forget our referral contests and know that your early involvement on any level in this Indiegogo campaign puts you in our inner circle where you get direct access to founders Debra and Stephen no matter how big we grow!

 

FAQs

1.  How do I know what size to buy?  Our tanks and tunics are professionally designed and sized to fit most real women’s bodies in all shapes and sizes from XS  to XXL. Our sizing chart shows the range of measurements that each size should fit. If you’re like me, you’ll want to also get tunics a size or two up to wear to bed!

2.  Do your tanks and tunics shrink?  They shrink just a little, maybe 3%, but then they stretch back out a little too when you wear them.

3.  What colors do you have?  Right now just black—which seems to look great on every woman who puts it on!  The special fabric is expensive with high minimums in each color, so we had to purchase nearly a mile and could only afford one color!  If our Indiegogo campaign goes well, we hope to make them in a soft white.  If it goes REALLY well, we’ll ask our customers to vote on the next style and/or color.

4.  I need it now!  How quickly can I expect to get it? The fabric should reach our production plant in Albuquerque by November 25.  Once we get some orders, we’ll get on production right away and get your tanks and tunics to you by December 11.  This should also be in time for holiday gifts! Our bedding products are available immediately!

5.  Do the colors run?  We have not had that experience, but you might want to wash the black with dark colors.  Wash in warm water and hang to dry.

6.  Will the phase change microcapsules wash out? No. We chose this particular application of PCM because it never washes out or loses its effectiveness. 

7.  Will I be able to feel the microcapsules? No, the fabric is soft and comfy—you can’t see them either.  You would never know they were there if they didn’t work so well!!

8.  What if I don’t want to take it off?  I’ve had that problem!!  I wear my prototypes day and night!  Fortunately, I don’t sweat much when I wear them most days, but when I sweat during a workout, the added wicking and antibacterial properties prevent them from getting stinky!  You’ll still want to wash them regularly so I
recommend getting at least 2 in each style.

9.  What will you do with the money you raise? We’ve gone out of pocket to produce our first line in black.  That's guaranteed delivery, which is why we opted for the flexible campaign.  We also want to make them in a soft white and, then, other colors and styles.  We can’t fund this expansion ourselves.   We'll do it with your help and your input on new colors and styles.  

10. I’ve tried wicking products before and they work a little.  How is yours different? Wicking products pull your sweat away from your body so you don’t get chilled.  Our PrettyCool technology actually pulls your HEAT away BEFORE you sweat and then gives it back to you when you chill down, within seconds--again and again.  So your temperature stays in a much narrower range and doesn’t swing wildly with hot flashes and night sweats.

11. Can I expect my hot flashes and night sweats to disappear?  I can’t promise that they’ll disappear entirely, but they might!  Some of our testers have had them disappear entirely. What I’ve found is that I’m sometimes aware of a hot flash coming on, but it never really gets going enough to distract me!  I like that my body continues to do what’s natural without making me suffer!

12. What’s the deal with your bedding?  Is it as good as the tanks and tunics?  EVERYBODY loves our bedding!  It uses the same phase change technology we’ve put in our garments and optimizes sleep temperatures for everyone whether they have night sweats or not! We have a full line of bedding, including mattress pads, sheets, pillow covers, blankets, etc.  Check out our website at  www.PrettyCoolWoman.com for details. 

13. Why should I order now if I can just wait and order on your website? The more orders we get now and the more money we raise, the more options we’ll be able to offer sooner.  Also, we’d like our early adopters to be part of our inner circle. 
If you join us now, we’ll give you closer access to us; we’ll be able to hear and respond to your needs and suggestions even as we grow!

14. What if I don’t like it? We don’t think that will happen, but we want you to be completely satisfied.  Just return your unused product to us within 30 days for a refund less the percentage that goes to Indiegogo.

15. Can I use your products even if I’m not having hot flashes or night sweats?  Definitely!  We’re targeting women with menopausal hot flashes and night sweats because the need is so obvious! But think about it--all clothing we put on is meant to help to keep us cool or warm.  Our tanks and tunics are the perfect base for both—under anything! If your work day involves going between hot and cold, say in a restaurant between stove and fridge, or between indoors and out, you’ll appreciate our tanks and tunics.  And--we’ve found that couples often sleep better with our bedding products because they optimize sleep temperature for both partners. 

We're also finding a surprising number of women who are not in menopause expressing a need for temperature regulation for all sorts of reasons including thyroid problems, food allergies, toxic exposures, cancer treatments, or even just a variable climate or changing activities. Whatever the reason, our products will help regulate temperature to the normal human comfort zone.


   


 


 

 

Team/Credits


President/CEO - Debra J. Solomon, MD
General Manager - Stephen J. Abt III
Business Advisor - Grace Brill
Fashion and Color Consultant - Ginger Burr
Color Consultant - Haleigh Palmer
Crowd-Funding Advisor - Marcia Kaplan
Graphic Artist - Alan Greco
Pattern-Maker (and mentor) - Kathleen Fasanella
Prototyping seamstress - Anne DuCoudray
Manufacturing and fulfillment - Jeff Alcalde
(with special thanks to all the eqpt. operators at Mar-Pac Inc.)
Videographer - Peter Walker/Swashbucklermedia.com

Waders owner - Carrie Leven
Biker - Jorden Medina

 

And many, many thanks to our product testers and "models" - all real, beautiful women -

Jennifer Ammann
Ginger Burr
Rachel Cohen
Anne DuCoudray
Suki Dalury
Susan Dilger
Jodi Irons
Dora McQuaid
Fran Medina
Leticia Pacheco
Jennifer Peterson
Jeri Solomon
Kim Treiber


Special thanks to Lama Foundation, Gutiz Restaurant, Shree Yoga, Taos Equestrian Center, Latir Volunteer Fire Department and Rio Grande del Norte National Monument

story:
UNIBODY FITNESS SYSTEM

"Become One With Fitness"

1ST 50 CONTRIBUTIONS GETS A FREE SET

UniBody Fitness System (U.B.Fit.), (previously Body Armor Fitness System), is a revolutionized invention that allows the user to receive the benefits of lifting weights while doing a cardio workout. People have been donning ankle weights, weighted gloves, weight vests, creating new and innovative ways to achieve a complete workout. "UNIBODY IS THE EVOLUTION OF FITNESS"

The problem with these devices is that studies show that they cause long-term injuries due to excessive force on the joints & ligaments or either short-term damage by restricting the user's movement and causing improper movement. This lightweight / stylish system has found away to achieve everything each of these product attempts to provide for its user. However, U.B.Fit. not only provides a complete workout, Unlike all these other products, it disperses the resistance throughout the entire limb, therefore eliminating the excess force on the limbs & joints. It also prevents injuries by moving in total unison with the user and not restricting the user's movement in any way, like regular weights. 

With it's patented technique, U.B.Fit. takes the workout outside of the weight room. Imagine an athlete performing their normal training routine, sparing, running the court or football obstacle course, while toning their muscles at the same time. Or imagine a fitness class doing aerobics with U.B.Fit. to give them a complete workout. We plan to create an entire fitness franchise around this product that will benefit regular fitness enthusiasts as well as underserved individuals in this genre, such the youth, elderly, and military service member abroad. 


We've worked patiently behind the scene for the past 7yrs in securing a patent and finalizing a cost effective design that will achieve the best workout for the user of the U.B.Fit.. After all our effort, and turning down several undesirable purchase and licensing offers, We have secured one US patent, another patent pending, soon to file a China patent, and have several key members onboard, including a retired 2x Superbowl Champion (Rodney Goosby) and a powerful attorney who's taken one fitness company public (Robert Herbst). U.B.Fit. has drawn interest from major players in the sports, fitness and corporate industry, including a Senior V.P. at Gold's Gym. We now feel its time to move forward with launching this phenomenal product to the world. 

The demand for U.B.Fit. has been so great, the most common responses to this invention are "How come its not out yet", and "Where do I get one". There is no other product that provides a total workout by giving the user complete mobility, strengthening during cardio workouts, reduces the possibility of injuries, and has more functionality (MP3, Download Music, Electronic Personal Trainer, etc..) as U.B.Fit..


Health Industry

Millions of individuals are injured from car wrecks, work related incidents, and other unfortunate events each year. Also, the Baby Boomer generation is the largest demographics in the U.S. For these two reasons, medical rehabilitation is on an up rise. The health / rehabilitation industries are  the secondary markets we are pursuing for U.B.Fit..

Because resistance can be applied without excessive force to the ligaments and the amount of resistance can be adjusted in increments, it could be used by Physical, Occupational and Sport therapists. Because the final design uses fluid to produce resistance, it actually gives the user the highly-desired, low impact resistance of a pool workout. That's right! U.B.Fit. takes the pool workout out of the water. We have begun discussion with one of the country's largest medical product evaluation company, SciMed Partners. With their guidance, we are certain that the U.B.Fit. could capitalize on this growing market.

From The Inventor:
This amazing invention was given to me, Freeman D. Fields I, by God as result of spending quality time in prayer. I can recall the moment the startling revolution hit me that no one has ever thought of working out in this manner. Shocked, and not yet fully convinced that such a simple concept had completely slipped thru the hands of so many professionals and fitness experts, i immediately began to do research regarding the idea. Having some experience with patents and inventions, i was blown away at what i discovered during my search; God had revealed to me a way to help the masses in a way that has never been done before. He then gave me the charge of carrying out the assignment to help His people to a means of a healthy / fit life.

The initial design of the invention was to assist individuals while working out with weights, as a self spotter. (e.g. during a bench press, after a preset number of reps, the system would kick in and aide the user with arm extension to maximize the workout / the same with squats for the legs) WE ARE CURRENTLY WORKING WITH A DOCTOR ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF USING THIS ORIGINAL CONCEPT FOR THE APPLICATION OF ASSISTING AMBULANT INDIVIDUALS TO WALK WITHOUT THE AIDE OF CRUSHES, AS WELL AS FOR THE ARM.

Shortly after this invention was revealed to me, God revealed the next phase, INVERT THE RESISTANCE AS THE PERSON BENDS THEIR ARM OR LEG, THEN NO WEIGHTS ARE REQUIRED. That's when it truly hit me what He had just given me. A weightless workout system that could be used by anyone, anywhere, anytime. Needless to say, i immediately went to work on acquiring a patent in 2007 and was just issued one patent in 2013 with another patent pending. The greatest response to this God-given idea is "I can't believe its not already out there" and "where can I get one".

My team is ready to move forward with the assignment, but need your help. There are many following this campaign, favoring my tweets, sitting back watching to see how it does. I'm asking that you please not just sit back and watch what happens, but help us "make it happen". Because its divinely given, i know anyone that sows into it will be divinely bless. Thank You

The Team:

Impact:

Because of all the unique benefits and auxiliary markets this product has, I'm certain once the development is complete, similar to what the iPod did for music, U.B.Fit. will change the fitness world forever.

Purpose of Proceeds

All proceeds will go toward the R & D of this product. Upon completing the final prototype, we have several options available, which includes securing funding to manufacturer and market the system and/or licensing a portion of the system (currently have investors and a fitness software company awaiting further development before moving forward with us on this endeavor).

Other than the pure satisfaction of bringing a product to life that will fight against childhood obesity, diabetes, high blood pressure, arthritis and make the world a more fit place, we are offering a range of perks for your support.


How Can You Help

We are asking you to help us bring this product to market by pledging whatever amount is laid on your heart. If you're not able, we ask that you please spread the word about UniBody to friends, family & social friends by simply giving them the domain www.UniBodyFitness.net. If you have any questions or inquiry about this project, please contact me at freeman@UniBodyFitness.com. But most importantly, WE REQUEST YOUR PRAYERS IN BRINGING THIS GODLY ASSIGNMENT TO PASS.

God Bless

Freeman D. Fields I

Inventor / UniBody Fitness System

story:
Carla is a very devoted single mother of seven beautiful children (ages 3-23, five boys and two girls) with only four of them still living with her at home. Since her divorce four years ago she has turned herself into an even harder working mom providing for her children. In the summer of last year, she faced a major decision which was to stay in Georgia or relocate to Charlotte, North Carolina, leaving  behind her mom, siblings, grown kids, friends and co-workers and continued to work for AT&T. She made the move and embraced the opportunity to make a fresh start and a new life with her children. After only a few months in Charlotte, things took an unexpected turn. Carla's health suddenly became an issue, as she started having seizures and bad headaches.  Many tests and a couple of hospital stays later she finally hit a major roadblock. While driving, she had a seizure and wrecked her car.  In January of this year  Carla was hospitalized and underwent spinal cord compression surgery and was out of work three months. She had not been back to work long when she was diagnosed with Chiari Malformation, which means her brain are bigger than her skull cavity and she is in constant pain from pressure and headaches.  Because the symptoms have gotten so bad, her Dr. will be doing brain surgery in less than two weeks. Carla will again be out of work and struggling to financially care for her children.  As if all that was not enough, a recent mammogram showed that she has breast cancer with no prognosis as of yet. Her family and closest friends are spread all over the southeast, unfortunately though none of them are in Charlotte. All of this is very hard on her physically, emotionally and mentally.  Carla is extremely concerned about her ability to care for her children.  She really needs some help with medical bills, housing, food and general care for four very special children. Thank you in advance for reading this and may God bless you.

 Concerned

Family & Friends

story:
Have you ever thought about how many times you change your sleeping position during the night? Or what happens if you stay in the same position for a day. For two days. For a month. For a whole year? There is a high chance that bedsores will develop.


Our Solution


We have invented a multi-functional hospital bed which, among other things, is able to turn a person on his side to prevent the formation of bedsores. 

We developed patent pending invention that can turn patient on his side without any extra efforts from nurses. This helps to ensure the prevention of deadly bedsores and improves the quality of life not only for patients, but for nurses, as well. As of today, our product has no analogues affordable to regular home users, senior houses and hospitals.


How does it work in practice?

 

Who is it for?

This bed is designed for overweight people, seniors, people with disabilities, and the most important - those who are temporary unable to move.

Our bed will ease the job of the nursing staff by reducing the number of responsibilities, at the same time increasing the physical, social and psychological comfort of the patient. 

Yes, there is a group of people who are forced to suffer sleep deprivation because of their physical disabilities. For example, disadvantaged people, (paralyzed, with muscular dystrophy, etc.), overweight people, seniors, who cannot turn, sit, or lift their legs in bed without the help of nursing staff. 

When people cannot change their position for extended periods of time, the blood circulation gets disrupted, sores emerge, and  muscular dystrophy starts. 


Why we need your help?

We already have a working prototype, however, we need your help to finish it, release it to the market and make it accessible to home users.


Product development timeline


What about safety?

We know, now it looks like that patient will be thrown out of this bed. Many of you asked how we are going to ensure safety of the person using this bed. We have finally finished and attached safety grating on both sides. The most important - they are flexible and you can move them up and down. That means if you do not need them - person can simply push them down.


What the statistics say?

         

                          


Company Alovita has enough expertise and capabilities to develop this product and make it available in market. However, we want to speed up this process and, therefore, we ask your contribution and support in order to bring 21st century solutions to solve 20th century problem.

story:
Hello, This fundraiser is for my brother William and sister in law Katie. A month ago they found out that my nephew Kellan that is Due May 2014 has Congenital diaphragmatic hernia.

Congenital diaphragmatic (dye-ah-fra-mat-ick) hernia  is an opening in the diaphragm, which is the muscle separating the chest from the abdomen (see illustration at right).  This hole allows the contents that would normally be in the abdomen to push up into the chest cavity. The lungs may be underdeveloped (hypoplastic ) because they lack the space to grow. CDH can have an effect on both lungs even though the defect is only on one side. 

If the amount of abdominal contents  pushed into the chest is significant enough, the heart will be pushed out of its normal position in the middle of the chest. This shift may also reduce the amount of space for the lung on the opposite side, leading to abnormal growth and development of that lung. 

Baby Boy Kellan liver is Completely up in his chest with his Bowel. His left lung us there but does have pushing on it. The doctors graded him in the severe category. The hole in his chest cavity is big so they will have to a patch repair on that when he is born.

Kellan will have to be delivered at Boston Hospital and once delivered he has to be transferred to Boston Children's Hospital where he will under go major surgery to fix the Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia. This is a costly surgery and the insurance don't pay for the moms stay after the delivery so that she can stay with baby Kellan Morehouse when he is there for the surgery and recovery. It a long road with this process. They have four girls at home already. They are great parents. This has been a toll on them as to what this surgery will bring for them and the baby. My brother wants to be able to also be there with my sister in law and their son but he will have to work to provide for the girls and their Bills. I figured doing this fundraiser will help them so he can be their with his wife and son during the process, also help with a place for them to stay at so they can be close to their son seeing they are 3 hours away from Boston Children Hospital so if anything was to happen they are right their, also for gas money so that dad can come to check on his girls and the cost of any medical that is not covered by the insurance. This will be a long road for them and the family. So please if you can donate it is greatly appreciated by them and the family.

Anything at this point will help this loving and caring family be their and have his medical that will not be covered taken care of and help the parents out with the cost of the stay they will have to pay 900.00 a month to stay in a medical house in Boston to be there close to Kellan.  They are looking at 3 plus months depending how Kellan will heal and that.

Knowing that their son Kellan is sick before he  has even entered this world has been a stressful and emotional process for both the parents and to prepare the four girls for the long stay that mommy, daddy and brother will have away from them and if anything seriously was to  happen to baby Kellan Morehouse. We all have been praying for the best and they have great support from family and friends.

So if you could donate anything its is greatly appreciated by the family and god bless you all. And please continue al the prayers to help heal the parents, baby Kellan Morehouse and the family.

We also understand that people just can’t contribute due to the economy , but we have a couple other fundraisers that will be taken place to help this family and would be great when we have them that you all can attend. Also, if you can share with your friends and family and  make some noise about Baby Kellan Morehouse campaign it would be greatly appreciated. You will want to use  Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Matthew Feric. I am 23 years old and will be graduating from Dalhousie University just prior to embarking on this adventure. Instead of packing up and traveling Europe, Australia, Southeast Asia and everywhere in between, I have decided to put my lungs, and legs, in jeopardy for what I believe is a great cause. I have been training since late August and have been making significant progress to get back in a body shape that will somehow facilitate a longer that usual bike ride.  Thank you for you support and wish me luck…We’re going to need it.

My name is Patrick Feric and I am 22 yo and I am living in Oakville Ontario. The final destination of our bike ride will be our house. I played AAA hockey in Oakville and junior hockey as well in high school and in the years after. I also played soccer and was very active in the past. Those day a definitely behind me but I hope the ride will go swimmingly. I will be attending Sheridan college in the fall for their athletic therapy program. I currently work at Target Mobile. I have been training since august in order to take on this country or at least the east half… baby steps. I hope everyone follows on our journey and I hope people all around contribute to the cause. This is sure to be mine and my brothers walk on the moon.

•During the summer of 2012, our family was given the unfortunate news that both our father and grandfather were diagnosed with cancer and would be completing treatment at Princess Margaret hospital in Toronto, Ontario in the coming weeks. Over the next several weeks the two completed several rounds of radiation and chemo-therapy treatments to combat the disease.

•My Father completed seven weeks and 35 treatments of radiation, and 3 cycles of chemo-therapy, The cancer in his throat and neck had not regressed to the point where the doctors felt it was safe and promptly removed the rest of the tumor via surgery in January of 2013.

•My grandfather, diagnosed with prostate cancer several years prior, reached levels that the doctors felt needed to be treated.  He completed several weeks of successful treatment.

•During this time, the staff at Princess Margaret Hospital provided the highest quality care and treatment for both of our family members.  Given this, we felt like we would like to thank the people in any way we could. We decided to embark on this great adventure and give back to the group of individuals that helped and looked after of family members at their hardest times.

We personally are not the ones that are in need of your support. We are just two young men that found ourselves on the receiving end of tough news, but due to the efforts of the numerous individuals at the Princess Margaret Cancer Centre our family member were given fantastic new post-treatments. We aren't doing this for ourselves... we are doing it for the people in the same position we were in and want the same great news we received. 

We are aiming to have every person who views at this page to donate a penny per kilometer of our trip (est. 1,750kms) we bike so we can help Princess Margaret to continue to provide the highest quality of care.

If we hit our goal or not we will be donating everything to the Princess Margaret so they can continue to deliver the news of a healthy family member to their loved ones. 

Thank you very much for your support!
story_txt:
My name is Matthew Feric. I am 23
years old and will be graduating from Dalhousie University just prior to
embarking on this adventure. Instead of packing up and traveling Europe,
Australia, Southeast Asia and everywhere in between, I have decided to put my
lungs, and legs, in jeopardy for what I believe is a great cause. I have been
training since late August and have been making significant progress to get
back in a body shape that will somehow facilitate a longer that usual bike
ride.  Thank you for you support and wish
me luck…We’re going to need it.My name is Patrick Feric and I am 22 yo and I am living in Oakville Ontario. The final destination of our bike
ride will be our house. I played AAA hockey in Oakville and junior hockey as
well in high school and in the years after. I also played soccer and was very
active in the past. Those day a definitely behind me but I hope the ride will
go swimmingly. I will be attending Sheridan college in the fall for their
athletic therapy program. I currently work at Target Mobile. I have been
training since august in order to take on this country or at least the east
half… baby steps. I hope everyone follows on our journey and I hope people all
around contribute to the cause. This is sure to be mine and my brothers walk on
the moon.•During the summer of 2012, our family was given the unfortunate news
that both our father and grandfather were diagnosed with cancer and would be
completing treatment at Princess Margaret hospital in Toronto, Ontario in the
coming weeks. Over the next several weeks the two completed several rounds of
radiation and chemo-therapy treatments to combat the disease. 
•My Father completed seven weeks and 35 treatments of radiation, and 3
cycles of chemo-therapy, The cancer in his throat and neck had not regressed to
the point where the doctors felt it was safe and promptly removed the rest of
the tumor via surgery in January of 2013.
•My grandfather, diagnosed with prostate cancer several years prior,
reached levels that the doctors felt needed to be treated.  He completed several weeks of successful
treatment.
•During this time, the staff at Princess Margaret Hospital provided the
highest quality care and treatment for both of our family members.  Given this, we felt like we would like to
thank the people in any way we could. We decided to embark on this great adventure and give back
to the group of individuals that helped and looked after of family members at their hardest times.We personally are not the ones that are in need of your support.
We are just two young men that found ourselves on the receiving end of tough
news, but due to the efforts of the numerous individuals at the Princess
Margaret Cancer Centre our family member were given fantastic new
post-treatments. We aren't doing this for ourselves... we are doing it for the
people in the same position we were in and want the same great news we
received. 
We are aiming to
have every person who views at this page to donate a penny per kilometer of our
trip (est. 1,750kms) we bike so we can help Princess Margaret to continue to
provide the highest quality of care.
If we hit our goal
or not we will be donating everything to the Princess Margaret so they can
continue to deliver the news of a healthy family member to their loved ones. 
Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Hi everyone, I'm Master Alex, a martial arts instructor specialising in a Filipino martial art called Eskrima, I'm 8 x world champion stick fighter and I've worked on movies such as Star Wars, Artemis Fowl and Fast and Furious Presents: Hobbs and Shaw.

I was born in the Philippines before moving to London at the age of eight, I have been teaching Eskrima and self-defence for over 13 years and now have students all around the world from all walks of life, such as actors, stunt performers, military personnel, police officers and security guards.

Become a ninja from home

Since the coronavirus pandemic has stopped us from leaving the house, I'm offering you the chance to join our team, get fit and learn a unique self-defence method from the comfort of your own home.

There are different courses available depending on what you want to learn, simply select the perk that you want to get started.

Once this campaign has ended, you will be sent a unique link with exclusive access to your training content.

You can learn with empty hands, or if you want to learn with training sticks or weapons, make sure you use soft training weapons so that you don't hurt yourself. Get in touch if you would like more information on what to use. Alternatively, a kitchen roll tube will work in the meantime.

You can also select a 'uniform perk' and get hold of our official uniform so you can train as a true warrior member of our martial arts family.

The benefits

Learning self defence is a great quarantine activity; instead of being glued to the news or social media, you can gain a useful skill that can benefit you for life.

Keeping active in times like these can really help to reduce stress, keep fit and healthy, and stay focused. Moving helps improve your mood by releasing endorphins, and increasing blood-flow.

Self-defence is fun, increases confidence, and can be potentially life saving. It's also something you can do solo or with your friends/family. 

Train from the comfort of your home or in your garage or garden and become part of the Hybrid-FMA team.

I have a range of additional courses available, such as Women's Self Defence, or using weapons for film such as jedi lightaber practice. Select a "perk" to get started.

What you'll need

In order to train with me, all you'll need is access to a laptop or smart phone with internet. Once this campaign has ended, keep a look out for an email from me as this will contain your unique training link.

Testimonials

Below are testimonial videos from some of my students. 

Jack Jagodka is an actor and stunt man, who doubled Tarzan, he also worked on Wonder Woman, Black Widow, Star Wars Rogue One, Ready Player One, Pokemon Detective Pikachu, American Assassin, The Hitman's Bodyguard and many more films.

Corrine Holt is an actress, performer and dancer who is currently training for the British Stunt Register, she has worked on productions such as the latest HANNA series on Prime as a stunt performer and is featured in films such as Street Dancer 3D and Step Up.
 
Chris Ryman is an actor and martial artist who is currently working towards his black belt. He has worked on productions such as Cruella, Morbius, The Barking Murders, and TV series such as Doctors and Casualty. 
 

Lightsaber Training

Eskrima is a very useful skill when it comes to using a lightsaber or weapons for film.

For anyone choosing to learn these skills, I recommend using a training weapon which is soft so that you don't hurt yourself. Alternatively, an empty tube of wrapping paper will do to get started. If you would like to get hold of safe, soft, training weapons for the lightsaber training, please get in touch. 

Remember to train with lots of space around you so that you do not damage anything in your home, also make sure that you never hit anyone.

Other Ways To Get Involved

If you know someone who could benefit from becoming a ninja, please share this campaign, or post about it on your social media channels. For more training content, follow @hybrid_fma_martial_arts on Instagram.

Warning

Please note that any training is done so at your own risk. Only train if you are fit and able to do so and go at your own pace, know your limits of strength, flexibility and speed. If using weapons, please only use soft training weapons and ensure you have a good enough amount of space so that you do not hurt yourself. Please seek the approval of your GP or medical professional if you are concerned as for whether you are fit and able to participate.

story:
Short Summary

I am a project manager for a software company who loves to help others where I can and I need to reach out to others to help a friend.  I have a friend named Debra who has always been there for me and needs my help.  She has no insurance and has had chronic pain for years with no diagnosis.  I wanted to start a fund so that my friend Debra can receive further testing, medications, and a way to have a life without pain so she can pursue the art she is so good at.   This is so important to me because she has been a blessing to me and others in her life and I want to return that blessing to her.

Deb has been through multiple tests over the years and the only diagnosis that has been given to her at this time is chronic fatigue.  Doctors coudn't find where the pain was coming from or why she has it.  She has multiple symptoms and many allergies that only hinder her way of life, and I want to help continue the fight for a diagnosis and medication/remedy for her since she now has no health insurance or is able to work due to the pain.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Having a 10,000 medical fund to finish the work Deb has started will give her a chance to receive the tests, medications, and doctors she needs. 
  • There are perks available with your contribution.  Debra is a budding artist that has amazing pictures to bless any home with.  With your contribution, you can have a signed print, or an original piece of art that will remind you how you blessed someone through your selfless donation. 
  • All funding will go towards medical testing and doctor visits to help find a way for Deb to move forward in her life and bless others through her art.  If the goal is not reached, all funds will still go towards her medical needs. 

The Impact

Donating to this campain will not only help Debra, but others that have suffered like her with no diagnosis. 

I mentioned earlier that I am a project manager.  I pride myself in leading successful projects and want to add this one to my list because it means more than any of the others.

Help me help my friend.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing financially is not the only way you can help Deb..

  • Get the word out to everyone so that others like Deb don't suffer in silence. 
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to share with everyone you know!

story:
*Gift certificates can arrive by December 23, 2013; pre-purchase a flow treatment (or a flow friendship!) as a gift for yourself or a loved one.*


Hello, I’m April.  I am a licensed Esthetician and Massage Therapist here in the mountains of WNC.  I have a bachelor’s degree in Environmental Studies, and a strong knowledge & passion of both intentional/conscious consumerism, as well as holistic healing & body care.  I have  been sharing my knowledge & working in one of the nicest spas in the area for a few years, and have been dreaming of creating my own office/studio space since the beginning of my education.  The dream has always included one thing: the option of offering services affordably, so that folks didn’t look at such wonderful self-care services as only a luxury. The pool of options that most folks would decide from (lease, own, use a room in my home) have nothing in them for me.  I’m not your average folk, of course, so I need a creative idea...

Now, meet flow.  She started as a 1970 Airstream Overlander, complete with some bad décor and ancient appliances.   She came into my life in March, after a brilliant realization that I needed an Airstream as my office studio. 

I started researching online, creeping on Airstream classifieds and Craigslist, wondering how realistic this idea actually was.  I am a very creative person, so the ideas wouldn’t stop coming…I could see it… I had a handful of immediate ideas of how exactly I would utilize this possibly-mobile-studio!

Then, my wonderful fella Harvest casually shared that friends of ours in town had an Airstream…maybe we could just go look at it to get a visual of how realistic it would be.  They asked in jest if we’d want to buy it…hmmmm.

 

And, here we are, months later.  The 1970 Airstream Overlander is parked in front of our house, gutted & in the midst of renovation!!  I know the layout, the materials, the color palette, linens, the products...  I've bought materials & supplies, & spent many an hour at tedious tasks within the AIrstream as well as preparing business plans.  I can see it: the finished studio space… 

 Where will flow be situated, you ask?  

Envision 5 acres of ‘farmland’ surrounded by The Pisgah National Forest, only a couple minutes from the heart of town.   A pond sits right outside of the door of flow; we have berry bushes & gardens & chickens on the same property, and we will be adding milking goats this spring!  We are surrounded by growing life, and my passion for self-sustainability is apparent in all that surrounds flow.  And then there's the possibility of mobility... 


The same wonderful fella as mentioned before has helped create this dream for me, donating many, many hours, leftover materials from his workshop, a discerning eye, and a lots of creativity.  We have a bit over 50% of the work for flow completed, and most of the materials purchased for the renovation.  I am an avid (okay, some would call me crazy) recycler/upcycler and have attempted at best to reuse/repurpose items without purchasing from the new market.  It makes for some really cool décor, but definitely takes more time to create what we are after (I secretly love that part).

 

 



Costs

Airstream:$2250

 

materials: $2457.13 thus far (not including cost of donated materials, worth about $500)

projected $2000 additional 

 labor: hundreds of hours have been 'donated' thus far between 2 people; i now need to pay for some labor!

projected $1500 additional

 

utility start-up fees: $1000

opening orders (products & supplies): $2000

business/licensing & Indiegogo fees: $1200

future needs: new computer (client records, treatment/product info, music, etc); new air conditioner; stage 2 bathroom renovation; electrical repair; exterior repair & beautification; solar panel (5 year plan); yet again, I'm sure I'm forgetting to list some things

                

                        TOTAL NEEDED: about $10,000

               WE ARE ASKING FOR $6000, BUT COULD RAISE & USE MORE!!



HELP SUPPORT CONSCIOUS & INTENTIONAL CONSUMERISM: As mentioned before, I am passionate about conscious consumerism.  I don’t just mean that I really like the idea; I mean that it is incredibly important to me, and I can exhaust hours researching purchases in this world of endless possibilities.  It has been my intention in renovating flow, and my intention in running flow.  I have chosen very carefully the products I will use, the retail items available, & my marketing materials.   Here are some of the companies I will be partnering with:

-Eminence Organics (check out what amazing things this company does besides creating potent, organic skin care products www.eminenceorganics.com)

-Larenim Mineral Make-up (www.larenim.com)

-Plant Power Teas (local, custom blends)

-Barefoot Press (NC marketing using 100% recycled papers with soy-based inks) 

-A Fain books (local, handmade journals)

-mugs/plates from local potters

One of the main points of conscious consumerism is: LESSEN YOUR CONSUMPTION!!  I am overly conscious about what impact businesses can have on the waste stream, & have some great ideas on how to ensure I am running a business that has concern for the world we live in as well as other creatures and humans. 


 

What’s in it for you: 

Besides the overwhelming happiness you will feel for helping out such a great project, AND the good karma you will receive… check the column to the right to choose an amount & perk combo J  Just in time as gifts for the holidays!!!  Note I dated the gifting to be December 23, 2013: I will work my fanny off to ensure you  receive a handmade ‘gift certificate’ for the perk that you chose.   You can expect to claim your perks once flow opens (projected Jan.15, 2014) , and any material objects will be presented to you around that same time. 

*expiration dates are from the date of opening flow skin care & massage*

story:
Introduction:

As a lung doctor, I have found that more and more of my patients cannot afford their medications.  It truely breaks my heart to see patients with shortness of breath because they are on a limited income.  No one should be without inhalers if they need them.  I am starting this foundation to give these patients a chance of breathing better TODAY. 

History:

Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) has an extensive, adverse effect on both patients and the healthcare system.With respect to patients, COPD causes physical impairment, debility, reduced quality of life, and death. It is the third-ranked cause of death in the United States, killing more than 120,000 individuals each year.

Diagnosis:

The diagnosis of COPD should be suspected in all patients who report any combination of the following: chronic cough, chronic sputum production, dyspnea at rest or with exertion, or a history of inhalational exposure to tobacco smoke, occupational dust, or occupational chemicals. 

Treatment:

Bronchodilators are the therapeutic mainstay for patients with COPD. They include beta agonists and anticholinergics. Bronchodilators have been consistently shown to induce long-term improvement. 

Problem:

Nearly one-third of Medicare recipients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) are not compliant with their inhaler medication due to associated costs. Researchers from Tufts Medical Center in Boston examined the relationship between inhaler usage and costs among a nationally stratified random sample of 16,072 Medicare recipients with COPD. They found that 31 percent of the recipients were not compliant with inhaler medications due to out-of-pocket costs. Furthermore, patients paying more than $20 per month for inhalers were at significantly higher risk for noncompliance compared with those who had no out-of-pocket costs. Researchers conclude that physicians should be aware of the relationship between inhaler compliance and costs for patients receiving Medicare.

 

 

AIM:

The aim of our foundation is to directly assist patient with the economic burden related to out-of-pocket cost of inhaler.  Once funding is complete, we will enroll patient in our area who cannot afford their inhalers and give them a voucher to offset cost.

 

 

THANK YOU!

story:
Jaxson' Journey

On May 27, 2011 a miracle happened!  Jaxson, my son, was born!  Jaxson was born with a multitude of diagnosis and has endured 19 surgeries.  He has battled liver cancer (hepatoblastoma) and 42 days of chemotherapy. I have watched him struggle, fight and persevere.  I have done chest compressions when his heart has stopped and made life altering decisions. 
My miracle is a fighter. He has endured more in his 2 1/2 years than most will in a lifetime. He has a Trach, ventilator and a feeding tube that assist in keeping him alive.   He loves listening to music, looking at books and being with his family! He has taught me what life is all about and about love...unconditional love!  He is the epitome of happiness and makes me so proud!  Jaxson will continue to have surgeries and we will continue to fight!!  GOD will see us through!
I hope that you can help us reach our goal. All money raised will go toward medical bills, a new suction bag and a new feeding pump bag! 
Thank you for all of your love and dedication to Jaxson and our family! We are eternally blessed and grateful!  "Believe"
