story:
What am I doing?

For years I was intrigued with the understanding of the cancer mechanism and ways to increase chances of a cancer patient’s survival.  Since I have no medical degree, and modern medicine is getting better and better results in cancer treatment every day, my main area of interest and research was very early cancer prevention; before cancer is possible to detect with any existing instrument.  To be more precise, the cancer life cycle period between a single cancer cell and a cancer of the size detectable by medical instruments in any way.

My opinion is that cancer is a common name for various diseases.  The cancer mechanism is simple: a single cell in our body mutates and if the immune system doesn’t destroy it, in time it becomes cancer.  Today medicine can cure many cancer patients, especially if they are lucky to have their cancer discovered in an early stages.  Generally, curing cancer is a long process and a chances game.  But, at the time when cancer is diagnosed, no matter how early it was, it is already a well developed cancer, lethal if not treated.

Everyone has cancer cells in their body.  A healthy immune system constantly keeps these cells under control.  It is known that stress may influence our immune system in negative ways.  There are some theories that stress also may reduce the ability of the immune system to keep cancer cells under control.  Science today accepts that various meditation and relaxation exercise techniques to reduce stress have health benefits.  In other words, stress is a strong enemy of our health and any stress reducing technique is welcomed.

My interest was to find a way to keep the immune system stronger by reducing stress through a relaxing, compelling game.  I believe an ounce of prevention is worth a ton of cure.  In order to fight stress and improve health and the chances of our immune system to fight various diseases, I created a game that has relaxing effects.  Many users (even those that never play games) felt more relaxed after playing it.  Due to the lack of funding it was not possible to do scientific research of the spectrum of benefits, cancer, blood pressure regulation, relaxation related or any other benefit.  That is planned in the near future.

The Game

In order to offer such a program to as many people as possible, an excellent, fun, compelling and relaxing game had to be made.  It was just made as Pentamino game iOS app for iPhone and iPad and is currently offered on iTunes:

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/pentamino/id639...

It is there for you and for your personal evaluation as to how good, fun, compelling and relaxing it is, and if you like it or not.  It will be offered for free during this campaign, so if you have an iOS device you can check our claims yourself for free.

At this moment, the first item required is funding for the final debugging.  After that, marketing is needed to let the world know about the existence of such a program/game/app.  Even putting this project on IndieGogo is spreading the word about it and a kind of marketing.  Thank you very much for your support, either through funding or just through social marketing networking and spreading the word about this project.

What The Money is For

Those that will check the game will notice that the game is already in excellent shape, but there is always a room for improvement.  Therefore, the money will be used to pay for the further improvement and debugging.  After that, money will be needed for marketing, because the primary goal is to spread the program as much as possible in order to allow as many people as possible to reduce stress levels.  That means the game will have to be free and in need of funding.  Especially, it needs help to virally spread into the world through social media networking.  Beside development and marketing, the funding will also be used for legal fees, and all the other costs that a video game start-up will incur.

Initial goal for further development and debugging costs is $500.

If the campaign exceeds $500 the money will go to marketing with emphasis on social networks marketing and some viral marketing experiments.

If the campaign exceeds $2,000 the money will go towards legal fees.

If the campaign exceeds $4,000 the money will go towards further development.  The idea is to create multiplayer game based on the single player version.  The multiplayer game version will be viral by definition and the game should become financially independent, allowing profits to be channeled to further marketing.  When that happens, I will look for ways to obtain scientific proof of the benefits.

If the campaign exceeds $8,000 the money will go towards issuing a book about the whole process from a very simple idea to the final product.

If the campaign exceeds $10,000, translation to other languages and porting to other platforms will be the first priority.

Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously, the whole IndieGogo project will be a fund raiser and a marketing campaign.  It will let the world know about this project and make some noise about it!  Use your social media networking, IndieGogo share tools, or just word of mouth.  Please, do not let this idea to vanish just a few yards from crossing the finish line.  I don't know of any other project that exploits the simple idea of using a game to intentionally target reducing of stress level for health benefits.

Note:

Again, I am not a doctor.  The whole idea is a product of years of my strong interest in health improvement, but I hold no medical degree of any kind and am not associated to anyone that has a medical degree.  Anything that I produced here is a result of my interest, experience, my ideas and a desire to create a relaxing and compelling game.  Therefore,  I am presenting my work so far for your personal evaluation. It would be my ultimate satisfaction if you like my project, or at least have good entertainment.

story:
Oh, hello

Bread & Roses is founded by Liam Lynn Martz who is almost too happily married, queer, a heavy coffee drinker, and believes in tarot readings a little too much. She has a decade of experience in womxn's health and operates from a reproductive justice model.

Reproductive justice, introduced by SisterSong, is "the human right to maintain personal bodily autonomy, have children, not have children, and parent the children we have in safe and sustainable communities."

The mental, physical, and emotional health of our community's womxn, and dedication to everyone having excellent reproductive health experiences is foundational to Bread & Roses' work.

 

Put your money where your heart is

We are inviting you to help raise our goal of $7,000. We can do this! By backing this campaign you are:

1. Funding a start-up, local, woman owned, and woman run doula business to help transition our support for our community from a side hustle to full-time business.

2. For every donation, an amount provides free doula care to someone who is having an abortion or experiencing a miscarriage.

3. 10% of all funds will go to All Options Pregnancy Resource Center. "At All-Options PRC, you can find open-hearted support for all your experiences with pregnancy, parenting, abortion, and adoption. We offer free pregnancy tests, peer counseling, abortion funding, diaper support, and referrals to all kinds of services."

 

What's in it for you

We are inviting you to help raise our goal of $7,000, and to help us get there, we have really cool stuff from stickers and self-care kits (the same ones our postpartum moms get!) to trainings and mentorships at a discount to bring you into the #doulalife. 

 

We're all connected

Everyone loves someone who has had a baby, had an abortion, or had a miscarriage. This work is relevant to all of us. Bread & Roses' mission is to provide real, tangible support in our community. With your help we can make sure it happens.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If y'all are poor (we hear you) and you think you can't contribute, you're wrong! Sharing our campaign and being our hype-woman is so, so helpful.

  • get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
If given the choice, no one would want to lose hair due to medical reasons. Hair loss can be a crisis that's hard for many to take. The right wig can make all the difference in the world – boosting self-esteem, even helping the healing process for chemotherapy patients.

Living with Alopecia can be very stressful as well. Feelings towards baldness have been devastatingly negative as most view hair loss as a sign of weakness. Most Alopecia patients are not frail. Alopecia is an autoimmune disease that causes a person to lose their hair as the immune system destroys the hair follicles.

Egypt Lawson, co-owner of Hairline Illusions, has been making and designing cranial prosthetics for over 2 decades and have listen to the stories from many patients. They have expressed to her how upsetting it is to experience their hair falling out in the shower and chunks of hair coming out when they brush. How their scalps ache and they can’t wear traditional wigs because of how much they hurt. How the experience of loosing hair robbed their confidence and self esteem. How they dreamt at night about still having their lovely hair only to wake up to a nightmare of realizing their hair is gone. One cancer patient shared as she looked in the mirror, she didn’t see herself anymore, she saw a feeble cancer victim. But after she received her natural looking wig from us she felt like a real woman – she felt whole again and her life was less stressful!

Yet the medical industry doesn’t accept hair loss as a vital medical problem and disregards the real distresses endured by so many.

So with that in mind our mission is to produce the Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis a realistic looking medical wig for those suffering from Alopecia and Cancer to help aid scalps and restore confidence.

Introducing the World's First Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis and the Disposable Healing Cap®

What is a Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis?

It's a medical wig used to stimulate the scalp and aid infected sebaceous glands in the skin and protect scarred tissue from bacteria, microorganisms-inducing extra collagen production in the scar tissue.

What is a Disposable Healing Cap®?

The Disposable Healing Caps are similar to the cap of the wig. You can wear it under your own wig, scarf or hat. They are reusable and will last about a month. Pre-Order now and save!

What is made of?

The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis “Medical Wigs” foundation is made of medical formulated polymers that mimics skin. It is flexible, breathable, washable and reusable. Human hair or hair fiber is used on the outer-side of the foundation.

The Healing Cap is made with a variation of medical formulated polymers that mimics skin. It’s also flexible, washable and reusable.

How to use it?

Apply Healing Cap Medical Wig on scalp for a minimum of 4 hours a day up to 4 days. Clean inside of the cap with base cleaner and dry with towel before reapplying. So far patient results have varied from 1 week to 2 months depending on how long the patient wore the wig.

Wear the Healing Cap under your regular wig, hat or scarf to protect your scalp. The cap should be worn for at least 10 hours a day for 3 days. Clean inside of the cap with base cleaner and dry with towel before reapplying.

What sizes we offer?

The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis will come in 4 sizes: Children, Adult - small, medium and large. Custom sizes will also be offered. Initially, Healing Cap will come in 2 sizes: Children and Adult.  Later we will offer more sizes.

Challenges

Production and Technical Challenges
From the conceptual stage we have done tons of research on developing the Healing Cap® and Healing Cap® Medical Wig.  A few volunteers have tried the first trial version with good feedback. We require the cap to have different strengths for adults and children and have consulted with engineers to sort out issues including accurate materials with formulation and availability for mass production.

Objectives

A Healing Cap® for every cancer and Alopecia patient with scalp issues
With your support, our objective is to make the Healing Cap® the standard. After the first production run the Healing Caps® will be given to participating physicians and organizations to distribute to hair loss patients for feedback. After we launch eventually physicians, pharmacies and hospitals will make the Healing Cap® accessible to patients.

Why the Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis?

It is estimated that approximately two percent of the population will be affected with Alopecia - over 4.5 million people in the United States. Alopecia is a autoimmune disease such as diabetes or lupus that causes a person to lose their hair as the immune system destroys the hair follicles. Hair can fall out in small areas, clumps or may lead to severe hair loss. Anyone can be affected by alopecia. Some people may have an increased risk if they have a family history of the disease. Children and young adults are also commonly affected. Scalp infections and rashes can develop in Alopecia patients.  The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can aid Alopecia sufferers of this common problem.

According to Cancer.org the Estimated cancer prevalence in the United States as of January 1, 2009 is 12,549,000 men and women. Chemotherapy patients can loose their hair as well as develop folliculitis (inflammation of a hair follicle) and head sores. The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can aid chemotherapy patients suffering from these issues.

The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can also help with emotional pain of patients who suffer from hair loss, because they look extremely realistic - Enhancing one's self-confidence and positive self-image.

The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can be the answer to many of these problems.

The Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis VS. Traditional Hair Replacement Wigs

Hairline Illusions™ unique Healing Cap `Scalp prostheses' differ from wigs, in many ways.

  1. The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can aid in healing scalp rashes, acne and infections by protecting scarred tissue from bacteria and preventing microorganisms-inducing extra collagen production in the scar tissue.
  2. The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can help to protect disease-weakened immune systems from the sun, and to regulate body temperature.
  3. From a template of the client's head, The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis is individually hand made with the highest quality human hair which is matched to the color, density and texture of the wearer's own hair.
  4. Believable, realistic prosthetics - The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis features a natural and undetectable hairline that can be cut into the latest, shortest styles and allows the wearer to comb the hair away from the face.
  5. The wearer sleeps, showers and surfs in The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis only removing it for cleaning.
  6. The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis looks so real that many wearers do not suffer from the embarrassment and scrutiny of friends and family members which boost confidence!
  7. The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis is made with 100% Human Hair with no synthetic or animal hair fillers used. Wigs with fillers can cause scalp irritation.
  8. The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis wigs do not cause patients scalp irritation like traditional wigs.  
  9. The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis is hygienically manufactured with the finest materials   

Through this special campaign we are alo offering our Disposable Healing Caps® you can wear under your own wig, scarf and/or hat. 

The Disposable Healing Caps are not the cranial prosthesis medical wig.  It's similar to the cap of the Healing Cap medical wig.

Children and Adult Sizes are offered.

Save over 50% off the retail price if you order through this campaign.

The innovative Disposable Healing Cap® is reusable and will last about a month.


Perks

Every dollar is appreciated

Through this special campaign, we’re offering our supporters on Indiegogo a wide range of perks for every budget.

If you have a loved-one who has medical related hair loss or work in this industry, our perks cater to everybody.

 

In addition to the physical ailments, the emotional and psychological pain of being bald especially for women and young children is beyond measure.  For the person who wants the chance to lead a physically healthy life, free of emotional torment, the traditional wig is not an option.  What is the alternative for the woman or young child suffering from these afflictions?

The answer is the “Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis.”  To minimize the damaging effects of the aforementioned ailments Hairline Illusions, a local wig manufacturer, has effectively created a replacement scalp, and like a healthy scalp, the Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis can accomplish the following physical benefits:

1.     Can stimulate healing of the scalp from the effects of burns, chemotherapy and alopecia

2.     Can aid in healing scalp rashes, acne and infections.

3.     Can protect scarred tissue from bacteria, microorganisms-inducing extra collagen production in the scar tissue

4.     Mimics scalp and looks extremely natural – as if the hair is growing from the scalp.

The elimination of the emotional pain and embarrassment brought on by hair loss and baldness may be the greatest benefit of all, especially for women and young children.

Following our inspiration for providing premium problem solving products for women with hair loss, we have developed a diverse base design that looks extremely natural. We have beta tested several versions of our Healing Cap through due diligence and have had an abundance of positive feedback and some great testimonials praising us on the affects of our product.

We need your help to fund the manufacturing and development of at least 10 Healing Caps to give to physicians for patient trials.  The follow-up research will enable us to refine the design for a more economical version for mass production.

After we have confirmed the design, we will mass produce a more affordable Healing Cap medical wig.

 Front, Top and Side of Cranial Prosthesis

Patients are able to wear their hair off the face in many hairstyles!Human hair is collected locally enabling us to have full control over the quality of the hair.

We appreciate your pledges to continue the development for the final scalp prosthesis designed for mass production and are passionate to move this idea forward. We know with R and D funding we can accelerate the process of creating a scalp prosthesis that can better the lives of many.

The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can be the best and economical substitute for surgery, hair transplant or hair weaving.

Traditional Hair Replacement Wigs can be hot, sweaty, and unrealistic plus cause even more irritation and infections of the scalp from the friction of the wig foundation and chemicals used to treat the hair.

We would like to mass-produce the Healing Cap Scalp Prosthesis and we want it to be perfect.

Making prototypes, formulating, molding and more testing is required to perfect the therapeutic base of the wig. The wigs need to last longer and wear well.

It has taken a lot of hard work and alterations to make it this far.  Now we require your support.

About Hairline Illusions

Hairline Illusions™, LLC manufactures, distributes and markets one-of-a-kind realistic hair-scalp, facial  prosthetics to patients affected by disease or trauma conditions. The prosthetics is designed for people who are seeking a high level of realism. Measurements are taken and molds are created to mimic the original as close as possible. Skin color – pigmentation and nails are also matched creating a realistic prosthesis.

Since 2006, the Company has offered it’s one for one program providing medical wig grants to deprived women and children. The Hairline Illusions one for one program was created from the concept when people look good, they have a tendency to feel good. Hair loss can be a crisis that's hard for many to take. The right wig can make all the difference in the world – boosting self-esteem and the psychological healing process.

Every cent counts. Even if you can't donate, please spread the word. Tweet it, Blog about us, share this campaign on Facebook so that others may lend their support.  Use the power of your social network to make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word about the Healing Cap Medical Wig campaign here on Indiegogo is really important to our success.

Post our link (http://igg.me/at/healingcap/x/2023446) on your blogs, twitter, facebook, linkedin -- everywhere you feel it's helpful!

Thanks for visiting!

Production and Technical ChallengesFrom the conceptual stage we have done tons of research on developing the Healing Cap® and Healing Cap® Medical Wig.  A few volunteers have tried the first trial version with good feedback. We require the cap to have different strengths for adults and children and have consulted with engineers to sort out issues including accurate materials with formulation and availability for mass production.
Objectives
A Healing Cap® for every cancer and Alopecia patient with scalp issuesWith your support, our objective is to make the Healing Cap® the standard. After the first production run the Healing Caps® will be given to participating physicians and organizations to distribute to hair loss patients for feedback. After we launch eventually physicians, pharmacies and hospitals will make the Healing Cap® accessible to patients.
Why the Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis?
It is estimated that approximately two percent of the population will be affected with Alopecia - over 4.5 million people in the United States. Alopecia is a autoimmune disease such as diabetes or lupus that causes a person to lose their hair as the immune system destroys the hair follicles. Hair can fall out in small areas, clumps or may lead to severe hair loss. Anyone can be affected by alopecia. Some people may have an increased risk if they have a family history of the disease. Children and young adults are also commonly affected. Scalp infections and rashes can develop in Alopecia patients.  The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can aid Alopecia sufferers of this common problem.
According to Cancer.org the Estimated cancer prevalence in the United States as of January 1, 2009 is 12,549,000 men and women. Chemotherapy patients can loose their hair as well as develop folliculitis (inflammation of a hair follicle) and head sores. The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can aid chemotherapy patients suffering from these issues.
The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can also help with emotional pain of patients who suffer from hair loss, because they look extremely realistic - Enhancing one's self-confidence and positive self-image.
The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can be the answer to many of these problems.
The Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis VS. Traditional Hair Replacement Wigs
Hairline Illusions™ unique Healing Cap `Scalp prostheses' differ from wigs, in many ways.


The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can aid in healing scalp rashes, acne and infections by protecting scarred tissue from bacteria and preventing microorganisms-inducing extra collagen production in the scar tissue.
The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can help to protect disease-weakened immune systems from the sun, and to regulate body temperature.
From a template of the client's head, The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis is individually hand made with the highest quality human hair which is matched to the color, density and texture of the wearer's own hair.
Believable, realistic prosthetics - The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis features a natural and undetectable hairline that can be cut into the latest, shortest styles and allows the wearer to comb the hair away from the face.
The wearer sleeps, showers and surfs in The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis only removing it for cleaning.
The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis looks so real that many wearers do not suffer from the embarrassment and scrutiny of friends and family members which boost confidence!
The custom Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis is made with 100% Human Hair with no synthetic or animal hair fillers used. Wigs with fillers can cause scalp irritation.
The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis wigs do not cause patients scalp irritation like traditional wigs.  
The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis is hygienically manufactured with the finest materials   


Through this special campaign we are alo offering our Disposable Healing Caps® you can wear under your own wig, scarf and/or hat. 
The Disposable Healing Caps are not the cranial prosthesis medical wig.  It's similar to the cap of the Healing Cap medical wig.
Children and Adult Sizes are offered.
Save over 50% off the retail price if you order through this campaign.
The innovative Disposable Healing Cap® is reusable and will last about a month.






Perks

Every dollar is appreciated
Through this special campaign, we’re offering our supporters on Indiegogo a wide range of perks for every budget.If you have a loved-one who has medical related hair loss or work in this industry, our perks cater to everybody.
 


In addition to the physical ailments, the emotional and psychological pain of being bald especially for women and young children is beyond measure.  For the person who wants the chance to lead a physically healthy life, free of emotional torment, the traditional wig is not an option.  What is the alternative for the woman or young child suffering from these afflictions?

The answer is the “Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis.”  To minimize the damaging effects of the aforementioned ailments Hairline Illusions, a local wig manufacturer, has effectively created a replacement scalp, and like a healthy scalp, the Healing Cap® Cranial Prosthesis can accomplish the following physical benefits:
1.     Can stimulate healing of the scalp from the effects of burns, chemotherapy and alopecia
2.     Can aid in healing scalp rashes, acne and infections.
3.     Can protect scarred tissue from bacteria, microorganisms-inducing extra collagen production in the scar tissue
4.     Mimics scalp and looks extremely natural – as if the hair is growing from the scalp.
The elimination of the emotional pain and embarrassment brought on by hair loss and baldness may be the greatest benefit of all, especially for women and young children.
Following our inspiration for providing premium problem solving products for women with hair loss, we have developed a diverse base design that looks extremely natural. We have beta tested several versions of our Healing Cap through due diligence and have had an abundance of positive feedback and some great testimonials praising us on the affects of our product.
We need your help to fund the manufacturing and development of at least 10 Healing Caps to give to physicians for patient trials.  The follow-up research will enable us to refine the design for a more economical version for mass production.
After we have confirmed the design, we will mass produce a more affordable Healing Cap medical wig. 









 Front, Top and Side of Cranial Prosthesis
Patients are able to wear their hair off the face in many hairstyles!Human hair is collected locally enabling us to have full control over the quality of the hair.
We appreciate your pledges to continue the development for the final scalp prosthesis designed for mass production and are passionate to move this idea forward. We know with R and D funding we can accelerate the process of creating a scalp prosthesis that can better the lives of many.
The Healing Cap Cranial Prosthesis can be the best and economical substitute for surgery, hair transplant or hair weaving.
Traditional Hair Replacement Wigs can be hot, sweaty, and unrealistic plus cause even more irritation and infections of the scalp from the friction of the wig foundation and chemicals used to treat the hair.
We would like to mass-produce the Healing Cap Scalp Prosthesis and we want it to be perfect.
Making prototypes, formulating, molding and more testing is required to perfect the therapeutic base of the wig. The wigs need to last longer and wear well.
It has taken a lot of hard work and alterations to make it this far.  Now we require your support.
About Hairline Illusions
Hairline Illusions™, LLC manufactures, distributes and markets one-of-a-kind realistic hair-scalp, facial  prosthetics to patients affected by disease or trauma conditions. The prosthetics is designed for people who are seeking a high level of realism. Measurements are taken and molds are created to mimic the original as close as possible. Skin color – pigmentation and nails are also matched creating a realistic prosthesis.
Since 2006, the Company has offered it’s one for one program providing medical wig grants to deprived women and children. The Hairline Illusions one for one program was created from the concept when people look good, they have a tendency to feel good. Hair loss can be a crisis that's hard for many to take. The right wig can make all the difference in the world – boosting self-esteem and the psychological healing process.
Every cent counts. Even if you can't donate, please spread the word. Tweet it, Blog about us, share this campaign on Facebook so that others may lend their support.  Use the power of your social network to make this happen!
Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word about the Healing Cap Medical Wig campaign here on Indiegogo is really important to our success.
Post our link (http://igg.me/at/healingcap/x/2023446) on your blogs, twitter, facebook, linkedin -- everywhere you feel it's helpful!
Thanks for visiting!

story:
Orphans Abandoned at Birth

I am a high school teacher in Singapore. In a recent trip to Ho Chi Ming City, I visited an orphanage that houses 57 orphans accessible by an alley. There are 57 orphans altogether with the youngest around 6 months old to the oldest at 21 years old. 47 of these children were born physically and mentally handicapped and were abandoned at the hospital by their biological parents. 

Sister Thu is a Catholic sister who dedicates her time and energy to taking care of these children at St Therese. Because of the size of the orphanage, St Therese did not qualify for government subsidies and relies on public donations and the selling of handicrafts made by the children to get by. 

Many Children are at the age where they still need milk powder and many others who reached teenage years but who suffer from muscle dystrophy that prevents them from swallowing solid foods. When I asked Sister Thu what the Orphanage needs most on a daily basis, she answered without hesitation that it was milk powder because they are simply so expensive.


We Need 1000 Kg of Milk Power.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • VinaMilk, a Vietnamese milk company, produced local milk powder at 100,000VND (Vietnamese Dong) for 1 kg of milk powder (Approximately 
  • SGD$6 and USD$5). It is the cheapest milk powder one can find at any supermarket in Vietnam.
  • We need 1000 Kilograms of these milk powders to get the children nourished and well-fed for the rest of 2015.
  • If the entire goal isn't reached within 60 days, all money donated will be handed over to St Therese Orphanage.

Small Things With Your Great Love!

Undernourishment for children is a very real issue everywhere in the world, especially when they are born with physical and mental disabilities. At St Therese, 47 children have a list of the following illnesses and disabilities:

1. Paralysis and Cerebra, Palsy

2. Blindness

3. Down Syndrome

4. Deaf and Dumb

5. Mental Retardation

6. Legs malformation 

7. Dioxin Toxicity

8. Acute Glaucoma at birth

Mother Theresa enlightened us: "We cannot do great things, only small things with great love". Many of these children will not never go to school or live beyond a certain age due to their birth defects. But as long as they live, your contribution to their milk powder will bring another day of happiness and nourishment to their very fragile bodies, many rejected and at birth. Thank you all!!

story:
Our Story

We want everyone to be pretty inside and out!

By infusing social media with positive inspiration, offering teas to heal the body, and clean veganic products to nourish the skin, we hope everyone will feel better, think happier, and look prettier!

Your contribution will help us bring the natural products that we are so passionate about to the forefront of the market. We aim to get people excited about the benefits of essential oils, teas, and all things natural!

We're creating all natural beauty products handmade with herbs, flowers and essential oils to soothe and nourish the skin and body, as well as providing inspiration through our blog. By offering herbal teas that are carefully blended and geared toward alleviating ailments and encouraging wellness,  we hope to bring back pretty- in all shapes, sizes and styles. When you feel good you look good, and you treat others good too! That is our goal!

Risks & Challenges

While there are substantial challenges such as finding the time to learn everything required to create the products we will bring you, this is a family endeavor and we can share the load among many. Each person brings their own talents and strengths and that will help us to make this a successful company with meaningful goals. After the trial phase of testing our products, we feel confident that we can identify the ones that would be most beneficial to the market, and to the people that we will serve.

Already we have created pages across social media sites and have set up a plan for a marketing campaign to get the word out within the first month. While we are sure our products will speak for themselves, we will share interesting facts, and help to educate people so that they may help themselves.  With a soft spot for our younger followers, we will also try to support those surrounde by negative social media, by providing inspiration, kindness and happiness through our posts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make sure to hashtag #honestlypretty whenever sharing something beautiful, funny, hopeful, or encouraging! Together we can flood social media with more love than hate, and help everyone to become more honestly pretty inside and out!

story:
There are 2.6 million breast cancer survivors in the US. After surgery, 56% are left with mastectomy scars and often, no nipples.


BREAST CANCER SUCKS.

Even if you survive, it ravages the body, complicates relationships, and leaves permanent, uninvited marks. We think that covering these scars with a different kind of mark—a tattoo—can not only help mastectomy patients reclaim their bodies, but also turn something painful into something beautiful.



P.INK DAY 2013

We're planning the first inaugural, crowd-funded P.INK Day on October 21 at Saved Tattoo in Brooklyn, NY. At the event, 10 of NYC’s top artists will ink scar-coverage and/or nipple-replacement tattoos on 10 breast cancer survivors. Our partial lineup of participating artists includes:

Virginia Elwood from Saved Tattoo

Stephanie Tamez from Saved Tattoo

Michelle Tarentelli from Saved Tattoo

Ashley Love from NY Adorned

Roxx from 2Spirit Tattoo (San Francisco)

Shannon Purvis Barron of Indigo Rose Tattoo (Columbia, SC)

Nikki Lugo from Tattoo Paradise

Joy Rumore from Twelve 28 Tattoo

Miranda Lorberer from Pop's Tattoo Emporium

Jen Carmean from Monarch Tattoo



WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Consider this an investment in art—body art. Your tax-deductible contribution will help commission a beautiful work that will serve as a constant, permanent celebration of life.

But more specifically: Our base goal of $25K will fund tattoos for at least 10 survivors and allow us to produce the event.


STRETCH GOALS

If we surpass this goal (which would be awesome) we can do even more.

  • $50K will fund tattoos for at least 25 more survivors in the future.
  • $100K will fund tattoos for at least 50 survivors in the future. 
  • $250K will help us grow P.INK DAY into an annual, international event and allow us to fund tattoos for hundreds of breast cancer survivors in cities across the globe. 
  • $500K or more will help us establish a permanent P.INK Space—a high-end tattoo shop/spa exclusively for breast cancer survivors, with tattoo services provided free of charge. 


PERKS

A sneak peek of some of the perks we're offering for donating:

Wall of Fame:

Tattoo Sampler:

P.INK Print / Original


10/25 UPDATE

The first-ever P.INK Day was a success! We had an amazing time and are so glad we've been able to connect artists with survivors to help them in their recovery process. Thanks so much to the awesome Stephanie and Scott at Saved Tattoo and the talented artists who joined us. However, we haven't yet reached our goal and still need donations to cover the event and to fund future P.INK Days. Please help us make this an annual tradition. To see more on the event, check out this HuffPost Live story on P.INK Day 2013.



WHAT IS P.INK?

We began at Boulder-based ad agency CP+B with a handful of employees who had each been affected by cancer. Our goal is to connect breast cancer survivors with tattoo artists—two disparate communities that seem (to us) naturally allied. In early 2013 we launched p-ink.org on Pinterest, and what started out as a nights-and-weekends passion project has snowballed into a movement that we would all like to see expand.



AND IF YOU CAN'T CONTRIBUTE MONEY...

That's okay. You can contribute by sharing our page and helping us spread the word, using #PinkTattooDay. 

Thank you,

The P.INK Team


FOR MORE INFORMATION:

Visit P-ink.org. 

Follow us on Twitter.

And on Facebook.

And, of course, feel free to ask us any questions. We'll be updating the campaign regularly and we're looking forward to your involvement.


"Every time I look in the mirror I don’t see a nice new pair of breasts, I see the thing that tried to kill me. It’s the final chapter of the ugliness of cancer. It will be something beautiful to look at. It’s like it comes full circle. I’ve been to counseling, but nothing is going to help as much as this." -- Anonymous survivor on her new tattoo

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Ricardo Banda I am a 27 year old guy and I was in a car accident 8 years ago that left me paralyzed from the chest down and bed ridden. I have been stuck inside my room for 8 years! The only way that I've been able to go outside is on a stretcher with an ambulance taking me to a hospital. Other then that I've only seen the 4 walls of my room. Think about it, prisoners who have committed rape and murder get to go outside for at least 1 hour a day to get some sun. I literally go months without seeing the sun shine in my face. I live with my parents who are both in their 60's and are unable to physically help me get out of bed and I've gained allot of weight I'm about 300 lbs, so it's not easy to move me. So they have to get me everything. Which is also taking their toll on them. If I want a drink of water or even if I just want to eat at a table I'm unable to because I can't leave my room. Please Help!!! 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal here is to raise $21,000 for a new electric chair and a battery for my electrical lift. I've talked to several wheel chair company's and they've all said that new wheel chairs cost a little over $20,000 and a new battery for my electrical lift will be a couple of hundred dollars. So that's where all the money if going.  To help e see the sun once again whenever I want to see it not just when a ambulance takes me outside.

The Impact

The impact this will have on me would be amazing! Like I said I haven't been outside in 8 years the affect that has on someone is hard to describe. I can't tell you how it's damaged me mentally and emotionally. Every Christmas/Birthday/New Years/Thanksgiving ect... has been spent inside my room. 8 years of my life might as well not of existed. I'm a ghost in this world... I would like to go outside and become somebody.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey if you guys cant contribute money to the my cause no worries. Please! Spread the word on social media. Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Youtube just spread the word and let as many people as you know, well know. Every little bit counts. :) 

Thank you for reading my story.  <3

story:
Medical Mission 2015

My name is Kaitlin Spring and I am a nurse anesthesia student at Duke University. I will graduate in May of 2015.  In February I have a chance to go with a medical and surgical team to a town called Barahona located near the Haitian border of the Dominican Republic.  During this trip I will spend a week providing anesthesia for patients undergoing a wide variety of operations. The surgical team performs various surgeries that would otherwise not get done, or would be extremely difficult to do, in Barahona.  

About Hands of Hope Organization 

Hands of Hope is a non-profit medical mission group based out of the Triad area of North Carolina. We travel with surgeons, anesthesiologists, CRNAs, pharmacists, physicians, mid-level providers, nurses, EMTs, and CNAs to provide free medical care to individuals. 

The surgical team has performed hysterectomies, thyroidectomies, cholecystectomies, tonsillectomies, adenoidectomies, hernia repairs, removal of lipomas, and gangrenous wound repair and treatment in the past. On average, we perform 70 – 80 surgeries per week, and we take care of the patients from the pre-operative area, through the surgery, and then in the post-operative state as well. The patients are then admitted to the hospital where our surgeons will follow them through their post-operative course.  

For more information about our organization please see the link below :

http://handsofhopenc.org/about-us.html

My experience with Hands of Hope

I had the opportunity to work with the organization in 2011 and 2012.  Both of these trips were eye opening and life changing.  The patients were so thankful for our care. 

What I need

  • The cost of the trip includes airfare to the Dominican Republic, along with room and board.
  • Any money I raise beyond what I need to attend will be donated to Hands of Hope Organization and will be used for others to volunteer in the future. 

Challenges

Before school started I was well aware that for the entire 28 months of the program I would be unable to work due to the vigorous courses and busy schedule.  Given this, I previously thought that participating in a medical mission wouldn't be possible.  My family and friends convinced me that getting the word out about the Hands of Hope organization through Indigogo could possibly help to raise awareness and funding for the trip.  If you have any questions about the trip or organization please feel free to email me at kspring01@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

I would greatly appreciate any help by sharing the site with others!
story_txt:
Medical Mission 2015 My name is Kaitlin Spring and I am a nurse anesthesia student at Duke University. I will graduate in May of 2015.  In February I have a chance to go with a medical and surgical team to a town called Barahona located near the Haitian border of the Dominican Republic.  During this trip I will spend a week providing anesthesia for patients undergoing a wide variety of operations. The surgical team performs various surgeries that would otherwise not get done, or would be extremely difficult to do, in Barahona.  
About Hands of Hope Organization 
Hands of Hope is a non-profit medical mission group based out of the Triad area of North Carolina. We travel with surgeons, anesthesiologists, CRNAs, pharmacists, physicians, mid-level providers, nurses, EMTs, and CNAs to provide free medical care to individuals. 
The surgical team has performed hysterectomies, thyroidectomies, cholecystectomies, tonsillectomies, adenoidectomies, hernia repairs, removal of lipomas, and gangrenous wound repair and treatment in the past. On average, we perform 70 – 80 surgeries per week, and we take care of the patients from the pre-operative area, through the surgery, and then in the post-operative state as well. The patients are then admitted to the hospital where our surgeons will follow them through their post-operative course.  
For more information about our organization please see the link below :
http://handsofhopenc.org/about-us.html   My experience with Hands of Hope
I had the opportunity to work with the organization in 2011 and 2012.  Both of these trips were eye opening and life changing.  The patients were so thankful for our care. 

What I need  The cost of the trip includes airfare to the Dominican Republic, along with room and board. Any money I raise beyond what I need to attend will be donated to Hands of Hope Organization and will be used for others to volunteer in the future. 


    Challenges Before school started I was well aware that for the entire 28 months of the program I would be unable to work due to the vigorous courses and busy schedule.  Given this, I previously thought that participating in a medical mission wouldn't be possible.  My family and friends convinced me that getting the word out about the Hands of Hope organization through Indigogo could possibly help to raise awareness and funding for the trip.  If you have any questions about the trip or organization please feel free to email me at kspring01@gmail.com   Other Ways You Can Help I would greatly appreciate any help by sharing the site with others!

story:
During his third year in medical school in London, Benji has dedicated nine months to analysing new treatments for cancer, in particular the use of viruses as a means to destruct tumor cells.

He has patiently developed a research project examining the measles vaccine virus and the way that it kills certain cancerous cells. As part of this, he discovered that some cancer cells cannot produce a 'defence molecule', called an interferon, which makes them less able to survive the virus. This is a small, and yet critical, insight.

Benji's research could have global implications for the way that cancer patients are treated. As some cancer cells do not produce enough interferons, patients should only receive a measles vaccination if they have a type of cancer that cannot defend itself against measles.

As a result of this work, Benji has been invited to attend the 2015 Oncolytic Conference in Boston, to present his research; this is a once-a-year gathering of the best minds working on cancer healthcare. His own lab is unable to financially support this, meaning that he is neither able to share his own work nor explore its potential to change lives and, ultimately, policy. We would like to change that, this weekend.

story:
Important: Contributions greater than $50 require my law for more information to be collected. If you wish to donate more than $50, please be prepared to be contact to have additional information collected. To avoid being contact again please select one of the perks on the RIGHT hand side of the page or indicate an amount $50 or below above the contribute now button.

Who Are We:

We are fellow community members. We are fathers, mothers, teachers, business men and women, t-ball coaches, and neighbors. We are a unified group for our parks and our community. We ask you to join us in support of improvements to our parks and a better Temple.

Our Purpose:

We have banded together to support our city and our parks. By Supporting our parks we are doing more than raising taxes to build more hike and bike trails, swimming pools, and rec fields. We are supporting those who use them. We are supporting a 10 year old’s Olympic soccer dream. We are supporting the elderly man who sits on the same park bench where he proposed to his wife. We are supporting families by providing trails and parks for them to gather and have fun. Our parks promote active and a healthy life style. We are building memories, relationships, and lives. We are building a better standard of living, and improving Temple for us all.

Why We Need You:

First and foremost, we need you to vote “YES” for the Parks bond at in Early Voting at City Hall from April 27 to May 1 and at your local voting station on Election Day May 9, 2015.

Second, we are asking you to give. Your contribution helps get the word out about the bond and the good it will do for Temple. Any amount will help us reach out $8,000 goal.

And finally, we want you to share. Share your park stories. Share your support. Share the campaign. Share your Yes vote for our Parks!

Quality Parks.

Quality Living.

Vote Yes for Our Parks!

story:
Emily Perry Severa is a young mother of two beautiful daughters. Her daughters are Kelsey age 16 and Lily age 11. Emily is 37 yrs. old and married to Artie.  Artie is a roofer. 

Emily has a familial heart defect that will require long term treatment. With recent surgery @ Tufts in Boston, her heart works @ 45%.  Emily cannot work and had to move from her rental apt. 2 weeks after surgery.  Her family struggles to put food on the table each and every day. She has mounting medical bills and high medication costs. She is not a heart transplant candidate. She won't survive the surgery.  She is fighting to get Social Security - they have denied her even though her doctor has classified as "terminal".     

 

Please help EMILY and her family.  Her life expectancy is not long but any help will make Emily's last few years more comfortable and less stressful.

story:
Who is AFC Ann Arbor?

We are Ann Arborites using our collective skills to realize AFC Ann Arbor -- a hometown amateur soccer team playing at Holloway Field (Pioneer High School) in May 2015 -- as part of the National Premier Soccer League (NPSL).  The NPSL is a semi-pro soccer league, currently fielding 80 teams across the US. Your donations help cover NPSL expansion fee and league costs, due early this fall and you get tickets in return!). Games will be fun, very affordable, and family-friendly. Our community is rich with enthusiasts of all ages and talent around the world. 

Who else is doing this? Who would we play?

AFC Ann Arbor would be placed in the Great Lakes West Conference, central region.The teams for this conference 2014 include: Cincinnati Saints, Detroit City FC, Indiana Fire, Lansing United,and Michigan Stars. Lansing and Detroit have started successful teams where fan interest flourishes and games sell out. Supporter clubs create makeshift marching bands guiding neighbors to game days with drums and tubas. Talented players and coaches remain in the area for the summer. Local businesses benefit from promotion and support. Kids awe at the performances and seek autographs after. The quality of the play on the pitch is excellent. Most importantly to us, the atmosphere is alive, fun and local.  

This is the excitement we want to bring to Ann Arbor next spring. 

The time is now!

World Cup fervor was ablaze this summer in our town. Local pubs were filled wall-to-wall with soccer fans. When tickets went on sale for Manchester United vs. Real Madrid they sold out before most even had their first opportunity to buy.  Even Relevent Sports CEO Charlie Stillitano who brought the program here stated that "the response surpassed our expectations."

The passion in our community is not just with international teams. Our community boasts a strong force of interest from all ages and talent and coaches from around the world. Let's get this started!




What We Need & What You Get

We need initial donations and sponsors to help us cover the expansion fee and league due costs due early this Fall. Early expenses will be uniforms, training equipment, and the hiring of our coach and general manager. We are shooting for a $10,000 minimum campaign to solidly cover initial expenses associated with bringing you your new team.

Our perks are built around things you will want to buy anyway when our team comes to town. Most levels include season tickets along with special edition t-shirts or scarves that will identify you as our earliest and most devoted fans.

If we are unable to reach our minimum goal, you will receive your funds back with no loss. Money only transfers from you to us if we are successful in our funding campaign.  It's a win-win!

Our Plan

In parallel with this funding campaign, we are working on our business plan and bringing in sponsorships from local Ann Arbor businesses. We KNOW this community loves soccer. This Indiegogo campaign will help show our sponsors that they'll get their return on investment.

We're getting the right staff and team in place. Leveraging the area talent that our  community and universities offer, we're getting interns to help with marketing and game days and already have candidates. We'll connect with the excellent clubs around town to identify a coaching staff. When we find the right person to lead our team, we'll work to set up tryouts for the spring season.

We have a great management team, but that team has to expand to reach all who can help us kickoff this vision and fill the 5000 seats in Holloway Field and make noise for AFC Ann Arbor


How You Can Help

Please spread the word and help get us funded. There are levels to fit every budget. Blast out the link to our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and through your email contact list. Then show up in your sky blue and orange next spring when AFC Ann Arbor takes the field to battle the likes of Detroit City, Lansing United, and the Indiana Fire.

Fine Print

You will only receive perks if our campaign is successful. Material perks will be delivered to you approximately 4 weeks after the successful completion of the campaign. Perks may differ slightly from those pictured. Colors and design aspects are subject to change. If we are unable to reach our minimum goal, you will receive your funds back with no loss. Money only transfers from you to us if we are successful in our funding campaign. 

For more information, find us on Facebook, Twitter, and see our Website for more information. Thank you!

story:
ZeSa Fitness

ZeSa needs your help in bringing the next evolution in fitness to the workout world. Based on the principles of unstable training, ZeSa founder Shanti Rainey has developed and patented the ZeSa Activator Training Platforms. These Activators are fast becoming the new floor for fitness training. They will be available in a range of difficulty levels, making this training regimen perfect for the workout novice to the professional athlete. All campaign funds will go to the manufacturing of the ZeSa Activators.

The Next Evolution in Physical Fitness

ZeSa is a cutting edge, never-before-seen fitness breakthrough that is the logical evolution of the two biggest themes in contemporary training—balance training and functional training.  In development for 15 years by fitness expert Shanti Rainey, the program’s guiding principle is Balance is Strength/Strength is Balance ™.  ZeSa incorporates the science behind instability training into its unique program to help the human body improve strength and balance, resulting in peak performance and maximum health and wellness. 

What problems does ZeSa solve in the fitness world?

The fitness industry has so many different options, it’s hard to know what is best for each individual.  ZeSa Fitness is the all-encompassing balance, strength and cardio workout that suits and challenges everyone from beginners to fitness enthusiasts and elite athletes.  The program generates maximum muscle recruitment through the combination of unstable training and a progressive exercise methodology.  The results are improved strength and peak performance at every level.  And, ZeSa workouts take advantage of the body’s natural fitness blueprint with low impact routines that focus on natural movements performed in equilibrium to reduce stress on specific muscles and joints.

What Makes ZeSa® Unique?

ZeSa, a high performance regimen, incorporates two basic components for unique, fun and progressively challenging workouts.

ZeSa® Activator Training Platforms

Shanti has personally developed and patented the progressive series of Activator Training Platforms used in all ZeSa workouts. They are the new “workout floor” and range in height from the Level I 1/8 spheres for beginners to Level IV 3/4 spheres for the experienced balance workout enthusiast.

The abundance of “bio-feedback” generated by the use of the unstable platforms, recruits all muscles including primary muscles (quadriceps, biceps, etc.) as well as stabilizers and neutralizers. The result is dynamic and rapid development of strength, agility and balance.


P.E.A.L Workout Method

During his years as a personal trainer Shanti has designed and perfected ZeSa’s proprietary training algorithm called P.E.A.L.  The letters stand for P. (position) E. (environment) A. (action) and L. (load). By following the P.E.A.L. exercise methodology, trainers and participants are guided through a dynamic progression of exercise routines.  All the exercises are performed using the ZeSa Activator Training Platforms.   Users vary the four elements of P.E.A.L., which establishes the framework for an infinite series of exercises for people at all fitness levels.

Be a part of our journey on this exciting new breakthrough in fitness.

The next step in introducing ZeSa Fitness to the market is to get the Activator Training Platforms into the hands of as many trainers, yogis, physical therapists, coaches and fitness enthusiasts as possible.  To do that we need capital to fund the manufacturing of this dynamic and unique equipment, and we are asking for your help.  When you do, you will have an opportunity to be one of the first to try – and benefit from - the ZeSa Activator Training Platforms.  See the PERKS  for more details.

Help us spread the word!

We want you know how much we appreciate your generous contribution to the production of the ZeSa Activator Training Platforms.  If we can just ask one more thing – please help us create buzz about ZeSa with your friends, families and colleagues.  Social media is a great way to let people know about this new fitness concept that could make a big difference in their lives.  So please, follow ZeSa Fitness on Facebook and Twitter.

Balance is Strength/Strength is Balance

Shanti and the ZeSa Team

story:
The SpinePRO™ is unlike any other back support product on the market. It's designed to dial-in your unique spine shape, providing orthopedic support, helping you ease back pain and improve your posture.

 

Let’s be real-- EVERYONE has bad sitting habits. Some slouch, some hunch, and some lean. The SpinePRO™ provides support to the lumbar and thoracic spine, helping to correct those bad habits. 

The average person will spend 30% of their life sitting down. That's a lot of time to either help or hurt your back. Think about how you feel when you sit everyday. Do you have discomfort or even pain? Most people look for ways to reduce their back pain without correcting one of the biggest problems: their chair.

 Most chairs (especially car seats) are not built to support your back's SPECIFIC needs. They're designed to be one-size fits-all. Poor-fitting chairs and bad sitting habits are one of the leading causes of back pain. Even cars or chairs with "lumbar supports" are usually too low and don't support the spine correctly. That’s the reason we created the SpinePRO™! 

 

In most cases, when you try to sit in a healthy position, there is a void or space between your lower back and the seat you're sitting in. This void is hazardous to your spine's health! 

  This void is a big cause of the back pain from which most people suffer. Without proper support, your discs become overloaded and bulge rearward. This creates pinched nerves, herniating discs, and eventually disc failure. 

Please note: If your car has built-in lumbar support, a quick measurement with our Fit-Stick will show how your support needs are most likely not being met.

 

The SpinePRO™ is the first product to support the lumbar vertically instead of horizontally. It directly places support up and down the lumbar and thoracic part of the spine, where you need it most. This helps to retain the spine in a healthier position. 

 The SpinePRO™ is truly one of a kind. But don't take our word for it. Check out what these first-time users and customers had to say about it.

The SpinePRO™ is not a one size fits all. It’s customizable for YOU! Your back is as unique as you are. No matter what type of condition your back is in, the SpinePro can dial-in custom support to help keep you protected with good posture.   

  

The video below will explain how to use the Fit-Stick and Fitting Guide: 

 

BOA® is a registered trademark of Boa Technology, Inc.

 As you feel Improvement in your posture, you can occasionally turn the BOA® dialer to increase the support curve. 

  IT'S THAT EASY!!

story:
Hi Everyone!  I'm Dr. Michele Burklund and my vision is to create a free (biodiesel)  mobile truck that travels to homeless populations in the southern California area.  

I think that everyone should have access to natural healthcare and fresh fruit and veggies, not just the people who can afford it!

I am a naturopathic doctor based in the Santa Barbara area. 

Natural medicine certainly isn't something new, it's the oldest form of medicine on earth, yet these days the only way to get it is to have money.

So how do we help the people who have no money or food? By creating a mobile clinic that goes to them!  Everyone should have access to fruits, vegetables, and simple natural healthcare.

My goal is to create the mobile clinic and get local farms to donate fruits and veggies while also getting sponsors for natural companies.

I'm going to do this on a budget...........

 We don't need a brand new truck or fancy equipment... we're creative!  We plan to purchase a used delivery truck, change it to biodiesel, and completely remodel the inside of the truck with shelving, chairs, lighting, a compact fridge, and reclaimed wood flooring.

Sign up for our newsletter to get updates on the clinic by clicking here

What We Need & What You Get

A used box truck (preferably a diesel grumman olsen) $7500

Conversion to biodisel $500

Paint $1500

Flooring: $300

Medical Supplies $2000

Compact Fridge $500

This is my photoshopped version of what the truck is going to look like.

The Impact

The impact from this mobile clinic is going to be HUGE because we are mobile and can go to the populations that need us most.  We will choose a new area each week and help as many beautiful souls as we can.
The added bonus: on the days that I will not be using the truck any licensed naturopathic doctor in the area can choose to use it for free to provide charitable services.
This clinic is going to encourage people to make healthier choices while getting the voice of naturopathic medicine out to the community.

    Risks & Challenges

    The biggest challenge is raising the money.  Our startup costs are quite small for a clinic and this project is attainable.!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Thank you so much of wanting to help, you are helping many lives.

    If you can't donate money we can always use donated medical equipment, perhaps a used delivery truck, your time (if you live in So Cal), or if you're a doctor then your wonderful expertise!
story_txt:
Hi Everyone!  I'm Dr. Michele Burklund and my vision is to create a free (biodiesel)  mobile truck that travels to homeless populations in the southern California area.  
I think that everyone should have access to natural healthcare and fresh fruit and veggies, not just the people who can afford it!
I am a naturopathic doctor based in the Santa Barbara area. 
Natural medicine certainly isn't something new, it's the oldest form of medicine on earth, yet these days the only way to get it is to have money.
So how do we help the people who have no money or food? By creating a mobile clinic that goes to them!  Everyone should have access to fruits, vegetables, and simple natural healthcare.

My goal is to create the mobile clinic and get local farms to donate fruits and veggies while also getting sponsors for natural companies.I'm going to do this on a budget...........
 We don't need a brand new truck or fancy equipment... we're creative!  We plan to purchase a used delivery truck, change it to biodiesel, and completely remodel the inside of the truck with shelving, chairs, lighting, a compact fridge, and reclaimed wood flooring.

story:
Maximus William Richard Daley was born 02.06.2014 with several heart defects and over the last few weeks his condition has been deteriorating, great ormond street and the royal brompton are now refusing to do surgery, because they think it wont be beneficial to Maximus.

These Hospitals are basing their decision on statistics and we believe statistics and theories are always meant to be dis proven,
In Boston they have leading researchers, for heart conditions and america have more leniency on FDA approved methods also they have more of a willingness to actually try and help Maximus.

The heart defects he has are as follows

Right Atrial isomerism (more than one heart defect based on the right side of the heart)

Severe ventricle regurgitation (mitral regurgitation is when the mitral valve does not close properly which lets bad blood back into the circulatory system and makes the heart enlarged) 

he has an underdeveloped left ventricle which does not function (If you do not know that is the ventricle which pumps blood around the whole body and the right ventricle can not really perform the same job for a long time without really struggling)

due to his heart being enlarged his lungs can not grow accordingly 

and he has 2 right atrium's instead of one right and one left

so if you can help us get this page more awareness or if you want to donate to help( we need to raise a lot of money but have not got a confirmation of price yet)  we would be eternally grateful our son is a fighter and we wont give up on him.

story:
WHY WERE ARE FUNDRAISING

We have a close friend that is now suffering from epilepsy.  She was a dancer and very active before this disease took to her.  It was through the Chelsea Hutchison Foundation (www.chelseahutchisonfoundation.com) that a detection support animal was provided for her.  This allowed her to return to some normalcy in her day to day life.  

As a sign of gratitude and thanks, we have decided to embark on a Holiday Fundraising effort.  We have scheduled a Holiday Benefit Concert in Denver, CO at the Walnut Room.  (HOLIDAY BENEFIT CONCERT)  We are also engaging in fundraising through this avenue to reach those that are unable to make the show but would still find it in their hearts and minds to contribute to this cause. 

We are hoping to raise at least $3000 dollars for the Chelsea Hutchison Foundation. We support there cause.  

ABOUT THE CHELSEA HUTCHISON FOUNDATION

"The Chelsea Hutchison Foundation is a Colorado non-profit corporation formed by Julie and Doug Hutchison to help individuals, particularly children and young adults, who have epilepsy. The main focus is to raise funds to provide grants for trained seizure-response dogs who may be able to detect an oncoming seizure and provide warnings and/or respond after the onset. The Foundation also provides Emfit monitors for those in need. Emfit movement monitors are the latest technology for monitoring an individual who, during sleep, may experience seizures which a caregiver or family member should be alerted to. The Chelsea Hutchison Foundation is named for Julie and Doug's beloved daughter, Chelsea, who died in her sleep during a seizure in April of 2009, called SUDEP (Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy). During the 6 years that Chelsea had seizures, no one ever told the Hutchisons that a seizure could take her life, other than through an accidental fall or drowning. As a result of that omission, the Chelsea Hutchison Foundation raises SUDEP awareness so other families are not blindsided."

WITH YOUR HELP

By attending our show on December 23rd or by simply donating to this cause you can help the Chelsea Hutchison Foundation further assist some of the nearly 1 in 26 people that are affected by Epilepsy in thier lifetime.  

I would like to thank you in advance for your support in the cause.

story:
Update!

Be sure to check out this update video! There's bonus prizes for every contributor! 

What's All This?

Life is Pain is a line of T-shirts celebrating the fact that life isn't always easy or fair, but that's no reason you can't laugh in life's face and give it your best shot. Even when life is delivering lemons with a high-speed potato gun.

Life is Pain acknowledges those rough patches and encourages you to keep at it. When things go awry, some really great stories are born!

About the Shirts

The main goal of this project is to make some funny shirts with an encouraging message of taking life less seriously. Every supporter will get first pick at the print run, some fun bonuses, and the extra shirts that get printed will make a debut in artist alley at this year's Denver Comic Con.

These tees will be printed at a local shop right in our little home town, run by awesome folks, each of whom has over 18 years in the screen printing biz. Needless to say, they know that they're doing. With their guidance, we picked out a soft-style shirt that feels like you've already worn it. The color(as you'll see below) is a dark heather that compliments the white artwork.

Where the Funds Will Go

All of the funds(minus the processing fees) will go toward printing and shipping everything to supporters in the United States.
*If you are pledging from outside the United States, extra shipping costs will be requested at the end of the campaign.

The Designs

This is what you're really here for, the shirt designs! Check out the reward levels on the right and remember that you can mix and match any of the designs if you back a level that includes multiple tees/goodies. A survey will be sent to you if you pledge at any of the multiple-item levels. As mentioned in the video, every shirt that is rewarded to you amazing backers allows us to print your shirt and an extra one for us that can be taken and sold at Denver Comic Con.

 

What Goodies Come with the Shirts?

Buttons

These will be 1.5-inch buttons. The art may be modified a bit before they are actually produced.

Stickers

2" x 5" in size, they compliment the shirt illustrations

Postcards

5" x 7" limited edition print run. These are only being made for this campaign!

Handmade Scarf

I wanted to offer something extra unique, handmade, and functional at the higher perk level: a handmade scarf. The prototype has been knitted and I'm working with my wife to apply the Eyepoke design to it. If that image interests you, great! If you are interested in a different option, I'll be happy to work with you if you plegde at that level.

Original Art

At the highest level you'll get an original ink & watercolor illustration on watercolor paper. Here are a couple of tiny examples. What you'll receive will be bigger and more fun!

I've Seen That Somewhere Before...

This avatar? Well, that's fantastic! I hope it made you smile. It's been floating around the internet since I made it back in October of 2003 and posted it to LiveJournal. And you know what happens to avatars posted there...

Anyway, this is the animation that eventually lead to the designs featured in this campaign. Anyone is welcome to use the avatar!

All or Nothing Funding

I've chosen to go with the All or Nothing funding option here at indiegogo, similar to the model at Kickstarter. The project can't come to life without the full funds because certain minimums need to be met at the print shop before they'll print the shirts. 

This means that the project will benefit most from spreading the word. If you are unable to pledge, please help by sharing the project! That is a fantastic way to support the project and will be greatly appreciated!

Risks/Challenges

These are minimal. We have worked with the print shop in town before they are great. We expect no issues there. The other printed items will be coming from companies I've ordered prints from in the past and the quality is great.

As soon as June rolls around, your perks will start shipping!

Thank You!

Your support and spreading the word is greatly appreciated!

story:
My mom has battled Multiple Sclerosis for 36 years.  She had her first major MS attack in 1984 when my youngest brother was only a year old.  But looking back on her symptoms, the doctors decided she probably began experiencing this horrible disease in 1976, the year I was born.  My mom has been a single mother for most of my life and without any support from my father, she selflessly raised us four kids.  She always put us first and would go years without buying anything new for herself.  She was always putting everyone else first.  She went to school over an hour away to get her Bachelor's degree and eventually her Master's degree so that we could live a better life.  It took her 7 years and multiple MS attacks to get her Master's, but she has always been determined and that was the proudest I've ever been of her.

Mom has a progressive form of MS and she has steadily gotten worse over the years.  She has tried many different treatments, including subjecting herself to 20 bee stings every two days for over a year.  She did this because she wanted to actively participate in our lives.  She wanted to walk into my youngest brother's graduation, she wanted to play with her grandkids and be with us for holidays and vacations.  Unfortunately, none of this worked and she has quickly deteriorated in recent years.  It wasn't long after she received her Master's degree that she had to retire from her job as a Social Worker.  When most people retire it's so they can spend more time with their family, travel the world or just relax.  She was unable to do any of this.  She had to retire because she could no longer work a full day, she couldn't sit up in her wheelchair and she couldn't drive.  At the age of 50 she had to go into a nursing home because we could no longer care for her at home.  This was the hardest thing we have ever done.  My mom is a huge animal lover (we used to have to move turtles that were in the road to the side, whichever side they were going to!) and she had to leave her beloved dogs.  She is now 57 and bedridden because we are unable to afford an electric wheelchair and her last one broke.

Studies have shown that depression has a profound physical effect on people.  Depression is killing my mother.  She has 3 beautiful grandchildren that she is unable to fully interact with.  She is unable to come home for holidays or just go on outings because we don't have anything she can sit up in.  This once vibrant, determined, selfless woman is now forced to lie in bed 24 hours a day and stare at the wall.  When she first went into the nursing home she brightened up the lives of the other residents.  She would go visit and talk with everyone and this kept herself and many other people happy.  Being a Social Worker, she knew the life story and problems of staff and residents alike and would "unofficially" counsel them..  She is unable to do any of this anymore.

The picture up there is one of the last times we were able to get her up for any length of time and that was taken in July 2011.  My youngest brother got married in October of last year and she attended the wedding, but only for 30 minutes because she was unable to sit up in a normal wheelchair.

I just want my mom home for the holidays.  But to do this we have to get her an electric wheelchair.  The basic model costs $10,000 and any customizations could raise the price to $25,000.  My mother has spent her whole life giving to other people.  She would kill me if she knew I was doing this, because she always believed there were people worse off than her, but for once she deserves to be the one that gets the help.  Please help me make her, mine, my brothers, and my niece and nephews holiday dreams come true and help stave off the worst effects of MS that depression helps cause.

story:
I am asking for your help for my mother and her battle against Multiple Sclerosis.   My mom was diagnosed with MS when she was 39. She worked full time at a bank as an investment officer and was forced to retire due to her illness in 1997.  She is a quadriplegic and is financially struggling due to her MS. She has had to pay all of her own home health care and it has taken a toll on her financially. The stress of her financial situation doesn't help her medical condition. I am asking for your help to make a donation to help my mom stay in her home and out of a nursing home. She is a fighter and has a smile on her face everyday considering how MS has taken everything from her.

If you can't contribute, please feel free to pass along to others. If everyone I know contributes $1 and everyone they know contributes $1 we could easily raise money to help out Susan.

Please join me in helping her fight agains MS!

Thank you !

Mandi
