The device is 'simple' in operation, requiring only the pull of one finger on an 'ejected' stowed "pull ring" which is activated by a bi-lateral force against each (occupied, belted), seatbelt.  Even the impact 'g-force' weight of a baby's car seat will activate the unit. Once activated, the unit immediately ejects a pull ring, which simultaneously causes a bright, flashing,  LED light to activate, which indicates the location of each (belted) passenger (in the dark) - so that none would be left behind.   The ejected pull ring offers the 'opportunity' to cut the seat belt by being pulled perpendicularly, internally (across) the seat belt.   An internal surgical steel blade instantly sever the threaded, 2.9 inch wide standard sea belt.  If there is no need to cut the seat belt, the pull ring would simply be pushed back inside the unit and reset for a 'possible' next event where it might be needed.  Changing cars? Simply remove each individual unit, using the special supplied tool, and mount them on the seat belts in the new car.                                                                                                        THE REAL 'PRIORITY' COMPARISON As I write this update, the campaign has less than seven days of life.  We  know that many more lives could be saved if we could eliminate the fear of entanglement  from the equation.   We covet your support in this lifesaving safety effort, even at this late hour, which is why every one who supports us at each level will receive at least one unit for the driver.  Benefits: This simple product will save lives - possibly your own.  Then, once away from the accident, when everyone is safe (hopefully), you can use that $725.00 "smart phone" to call for help - or 'stew' in your regret for not taking advantage to prepare for a clear and present danger your family faces every time you drive your car, IN FAVOR OF ELECTRONIC 'TOYS'.  THE TRUTH STANDS FOR ITSELF - THERE SHOULD BE PRIORITIES.   This product is about self-preservation of you and your family in a (possible) crisis situation. This is the one product, like paper insurance, that  you don't need until you need it, then you'll be glad you have it.   Noah didnt wait for the rain to fall before starting to build the Ark.  Remember, the American-made "RIP-CORD" Emergency Seatbelt Cutter is the best (and least expensive) "Insurance At The Accident".                     ANOTHER REASON WHY WE ASK FOR YOUR SUPPORT  We need funds to launch a 'buckle-up'  publicity seatbelt campaign, and build a demonstration device for the simulation of different escape techniques using the "RIP-CORD"  to remove the fear of entanglement.  We feel this campaign will be more effective than anything that has been offered before , since we uniquely offer each belted passenger an on-board device to enable an 'E.S.C.ape' from that (possible) deadly restraint.  Unlike giving for a general 'feel good' social cause, buying that must-have newest cell phone, or latest 'game', your support could be a direct reason for a life being saved  -  possibly your own.  We will honor all campaign perks to the end of this campaign, it's not too late.Should we ultimately fail to reach our campaign goal, which seems likely at this point, we will resubmit an unpgraded campaign version at a later date - but will wonder how many lives may have been lost in the meantime, due to non response.  Thanks for your support, !  Talk it up!   Johnny out.

story:
About this project

 

Beat Poor Posture.

End neck and back pain with ALEX!

 

ALEX is your wearable posture coach and posture tracker. It's the first wearable to accurately measure the angle of your neck and the position of your head, so you can put an end to neck pain.

More than 80% of office workers suffer from Forward Head Posture (FHP) or Text Neck.(Just look around.) These conditions are caused by looking down at laptops, smartphones and other digital devices for extended periods. Even if you've never heard of FHP or Text Neck, you probably know their effects: Soreness and stiffness in your neck and spine.

In the short term, FHP and Text Neck can make it that little bit harder to get out of bed in the morning or to sit in your chair at work. In the long term they can lead to chronic pain and more serious spinal issues. Medical studies have even shown that physiological changes invoked by bad posture can include increased levels of cortisol and decreased testosterone, leading to stress and depression.

Many products promise relief from the pain cause by an epidemic of poor posture. We've tested out quite a few wearables and found that they're often overly complicated, inaccurate or inconvenient. And while pills and massage therapies exist to treat the pain, none of these options effectively treat the underlying problem: Poor posture.

Our team of biomechanical engineers, developers and technology experts created ALEX to be different.

ALEX doesn’t treat your pain, but addresses the causes underlying your pain by gently coaching you towards better posture, every day.

How ALEX Works

A number of other wearables claim to determine posture via devices fixed on your wrist or clothing. ALEX, on the other hand, sits lightly on the back of your neck, the only reliable location to measure neck posture. 

When you adopt poor posture for more than a few minutes, ALEX vibrates gently, encouraging you to improve. You can customise the exact length of time and the intensity of the vibration using ALEX’s companion smartphone app.

The app also lets you track your progress over time and monitor your posture in real time.

ALEX can track the angle of your neck and the position of your head, relative to your body. This means it can tell if you’re looking too far down or if you’re holding your head too far forward.

 

4 Easy Steps to Wearing ALEX

Step 1
Squeeze or separate the legs of the device to adjust the position of the sensor module to just below your hairline.

Step 2
Place the sensor module on the back of your neck and hang the legs over your ears. ALEX's legs will naturally unfold to achieve the correct position.

Step 3
Ensure that Alex is not placed on top of a shirt collar, or other clothing or jewelry.

Step 4
Check that the sensors are working correctly by selecting Avatar Mode in the companion coaching app and tilting your neck back and forth while watching the screen. You can calibrate ALEX for your own posture using the app.

 

About the Coaching App

The accompanying coaching app will help you get the most from ALEX. It offers a number of unique features that help you track your posture over time and make improvements.

Avatar Mode allows you to view and manage posture changes in real-time. The app also provides graphs that track your progress toward improving your posture with ALEX. The video below demonstrates these features.

The companion coaching app's feedback settings let you set the length of time before ALEX alerts you to poor posture, the angle at which it determines your posture to be poor, and the strength of the vibration.

ALEX communicates with your phone or tablet using Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy. This saves your phone's battery, extends ALEX's battery life to seven days, and reduces the number and duration of Bluetooth transmissions.

We're working on even more features and will announce these in due course!

 

 

Featured On

 See Dr. Chee explain how ALEX works live on Good Day Sacramento.

 

The Technology Inside ALEX

Vibration Motor: Provides feedback to users when they adopt poor posture. (This is built into ALEX. You don't need to rely on your phone for poor posture alerts.)

Tri-Axis Motion Sensor: Measures the angle of your neck in real time and sends data to the companion application.

Bluetooth 4.0 LE: Connects ALEX to the app on your mobile device.

Flash memory: Retains posture data temporarily before syncing with the App.

LED: Indicates power status (on/off), Bluetooth connectivity status, and battery recharging status.

 

Why We Developed ALEX

Our founding team began with an idea of creating something to protect people against the health concerns brought on by prolonged computer and smartphone use. We thought; 'Protective clothing is available for dangerous work and for sports, so why not when we do other activities that also lead to ill-health?

Our CEO, Jonathan and Co-Founder, Youngjoon, a Biomedical Engineering Professor, spent years finding a solution that really addresses the shortcomings of other posture wearables.

We also wanted to create something that would resolve poor posture in the long term, rather than provide a quick fix through short term pain relief. The idea is that once ALEX coaches you to better posture, you’ll develop muscle memory and no longer need to wear it.

 

Where We Are In Development

We began designing the technology for ALEX around two years ago. By late 2014 we were able to track poor posture using this technology and began work to bring it to life.

Through numerous iterations we've worked tirelessly to ensure that ALEX tracks posture with precision, looks and feels great and makes a positive long term impact on health.

We're proud of how much we've achieved. We have been testing market-ready prototypes and have completed development of the complimentary smartphone app. 

 

The Team behind ALEX

Our CEO, Jonathan Kim, founded NAMU (Korean for “tree”) along with long-time friend Youngjoon Chee. Jonathan has nearly 20 years of experience working in technology, finance and healthcare. Over time these three disciplines merged and he brings his vast experiences into NAMU. 

Co-founder Youngjoon is a Professor of Biomedical Engineering at the University of Ulsan in South Korea, and earned his Ph.D. and M.S. in Biomedical Engineering at Seoul National University.

 

ALEX Specifications

Materials & weight

  • Sensor case : Skin wearable bio-compatible (ABS) Legs : Squeezable and stretchable (Silicon with metal wire inside)  
  • Total weight: 25g 

Battery 

  • Lithium Polymer (110mAh) 
  • Up to 7 days (10hours per day) on single charge. 
  • Zero to fully charged in 2 hours. 
  • Charges using standard micro USB cable 5pin (5V, 1A)

Memory 

  • Up to 4 weeks of posture data storage. 
  • Lifetime posture data storage in the cloud. 

 Compatible Devices 

  •  Compatible with iOS and Android with Bluetooth (BTLE)
  • Be sure to download the free ALEX Posture coach iOS/Android app to activate your ALEX N5. ALEX N5 syncs wirelessly with select Bluetooth 4.0 equipped iOS and Android devices (Compatible with iPhone 5 and iOS 9.2 and above, and Android 4.4 to 6.x)

 

Thank You!!

Thank you for taking the time to learn about our campaign. We would be honored for your contribution to help us bring ALEX to life. Please feel free to ask us anything about ALEX in the comments and we promise to get back to you as soon as possible.

story:
You have cancer.  

Those three words devastate lives.

My sister-in-law was robbed of her life at age 32 by Hodgkin’s lymphoma. Then just two months later, my dad was diagnosed with colon cancer.  I had to act.

Inspired by their fights, as a Board Certified Physician Assistant I founded Integrative Health Solutions (IHS) in 2008 because I knew we needed a different approach to fight cancer.  The statistics tell a painful story.

Breast cancer is the most common cancer among American women, second only to skin cancers. About 1 in 8 (12%) women in the US will develop invasive breast cancer during their lifetime.

This year alone, 65,000 American women will have their world turned upside down when diagnosed with Ductal Carcinoma In Situ (DCIS) (a non-invasive, early form of breast cancer) and over 230,000 women will be diagnosed with invasive breast cancer.  40,000 will die.

40,000. Will. Die.

It doesn’t have to be like this. 

Over the last 6 years, we have built IHS into an integrative health facility with a reputation for integrity, quality and excellence specializing in holistic and preventive healthcare.  Our mission lies in empowering the patient with knowledge and power to make educated choices in healthcare. Our unique integrative care philosophy provides the tools, information and support to help heal the patient; and something remarkable happens - the patients heal themselves.

I need your help to fund the research that will change how we attack this dreadful disease.  Today, tremendous research dollars are focused on “a cure”, but little goes to prevention research.   

And one lesson of my practice stands out above all the rest: 

Prevention is critical.

Here is one patient's story: 

This patient presented with Breast pain, symptomatic periods and terrible fear about getting cancer!

12 months after following the protocol: Iodine, Vitamin D, & Frankinscence oil.  The patient no longer has any pain, nor symptoms, her breasts are noticeably softer, and she is no longer afraid but thrilled to observe the difference that she made in her own breasts. The patient was so happy she was moved to tears. :)

Case study #2:

REPORTED HISTORY:

 Female in her 40's reports significant family history of breast cancer, patient c/o bilateral breast pain/ tenderness, fibrocystic breasts  history.

INTERPRETATION:

There are thermal asymmetries seen in the breasts. The heterogeneous thermal mottling and vascular patterns identified in both breasts, L>R, are consistent with moderate fibrocystic changes (previously diagnosed and typically associated with estrogen dominance). Fibrocystic changes are often associated with localized discomfort, which correlates with the reported bilateral breast pain/tenderness. Additionally, there are suspicious vascular patterns in both breasts, from 1-5 o’clock in the right breast and from 11-1 o’clock in the left breast, best observed in oblique views, which may indicate neo-vascularity.

Follow up study : 08/2013

INTERPRETATION:

There are no significant thermal changes noted in the breasts compared to the most recent study. The nipple and areola areas as well as global breasts continue to show minor temperature differentials. Thermal patterns and temperature differentials have remained very stable. There is no thermal indication of neo-vascularity. The long-term stability of all thermal patterns continues to show a reliable comparative record of stable physiology with no indication of tissue changes.

** As you can see not only did the thermogram show improvement but the patient feels so much better. She also is not terrified of breast cancer she is now empowered to be proactive in her breast health and feels more secure that we can monitor her symptoms and thermography closely to work with her as a team to help her be proactive in PREVENTING cancer. 

I have witnessed this amazing transformation in countless patients’. 

Inspired by what I have seen, I decided to pursue an MD/PhD.  I know, now more than ever, that a preventative approach to healthcare is the future of medicine. 

Here is how we will help this future be realized.

PREVENTION RESEARCH

As a part of my MD/PhD degree at the USAT School of Medicine, I aim to publish research data that will help fortify the movement of preventative medicine throughout the country.  This thesis is titled: Digital Infrared Imaging and Genetic Testing as a Tool to Stratify Risk for Breast Cancer, Implement and Monitor Impact of Breast Cancer Prevention Protocol, and Monitor Decrease in Fibrocystic Breast Disease as well as Minimizing Neo-vascularity.

Bear with me, but I need to speak technically with you for a moment.

My research seeks to fortify the evidence that Breast Thermography can stratify women into high, moderate, and low risk groups for breast cancer.

Thermography detects the heat pattern within a body part. We believe that inflammation plays a significant role in all disease, specifically cancer. It is also known that angiogenesis is a major component to tumor development. With the thermogram, we can identify areas of “neovascularity” (indicating new blood vessels leading to a given area) which will alert us to the fact an aggressive prevention protocol is needed.

This neovascularity can be seen as early as 6-8 years before the problem is detectable on a mammogram . . . this gives us precious time . . . 6-8 years to prevent that disease!

Additionally, it is documented that the mutation of a gene known as MTHFR effects the methylation and thus detoxification pathways in the human body. Published literature has established a firm connection between toxins and breast cancer. 

Thus, our goal is to identify a connection between the MTHFR gene mutation and a higher risk for breast cancer.  From there, we can illustrate how the diagnostic exam can be utilized as a tool primarily for the detection and augmentation of risk factors and to implement a nutritional protocol to reduce modifiable risks for having this gene mutation and potentially reduce the risks for breast cancer.

METHODOLOGY AND YOUR HELP

If you will help me raise $315,000, we can conduct pioneering research, working with 100 women at our Long Island facility during the initial 18 months of this study.  Using the non-invasive Breast Thermography, we will identify the prevalence of the MTHFR gene mutation in “high risk” women, further identify gene mutation and the link to increased risk, and implement holistic nutritional and lifestyle adjustments that will avoid toxins.  The prevention protocol will incorporate the synergistic effect of Iodine, Vitamin D, Boswellia Sacra, an anti-inflammatory diet, breast self-exam, and stress relief.

Our hypothesis is that we will be able to demonstrate how reversing basic nutritional deficiencies and simple life style changes in these high risk women can reduce risk.

We want to empower women to minimize their own risks of breast cancer.

PARTNERSHIP


George Einstein, PhD, DSc HC is my PhD mentor. Dr. Einstein is a Distinguished Professor of Biophysics and Director of Einstein Research Foundation at Einstein Medical Institute, USAT Montserrat. Dr. Einstein has a distinguished international career in teaching and research. He is former US Navy scholar and consultant for NASA and the Tennessee Valley Authority. He has taught courses in engineering, mathematics and physics in the USA since 1986. He also served as a Visiting Associate Professor for the University in Poland and Thailand. His research interests include: medical treatment instrumentation, biophotonics matrix treatment and coherence bio-communication, medical treatment robotics, rehabilitation robotics, assistive technology robotics, environmental robotics and algorithmic & heuristic models for problem solving. Dr. Einstein is passionate about preventative medicine. 

YOUR INVESTMENT CAN CHANGE LIVES

If we are right, we will show that breast cancer is not a ticking time bomb waiting around the next turn of a woman's life.

Women will know that their fate is their own.

We will show that there are many things women can do to protect themselves and their breasts from this disease, and that there are options other than prophylactic mastectomies to prevent breast cancer.

Equally important, this research could help physicians realize that non-invasive tools are available to them and their patients that will identify women at increased risk and recommend the use of natural nutritional protocols to decrease the risk of this disease.

The outcome of this research could spark a preventative revolution in medicine. 

I need you in this fight with me. 

If you have ever lost someone you loved to cancer or if you yourself have ever had to endure those three horrific words “you have cancer,” help me fight.

We can change the paradigm.  We can save lives. 

I see it every day in my practice. I know the power of prevention and empowerment in healing.  I just need the data to prove it to the world.

Join me. 

Together we can change the face of medicine.

Kristine Blanche, RPA-C

Founder, Integrative Health Solutions

PhD Candidate

Listen to Kristine on the pod cast interview talking about this research:

Part 1 - Interview on this research with John Cote on HealthcareElsewhere.com

Part 2 - Interview with John Cote on HealthcareElsewhere.com

Check out our press Release!

Check out a real patient testimonial video here

Pod cast interview with Jen Julius

Dr. Einstein is passionate about preventative medicine. YOUR INVESTMENT CAN CHANGE LIVESIf we are right, we will show that breast cancer is not a ticking time bomb waiting around the next turn of a woman's life.Women will know that their fate is their own.We will show that there are many things women can do to protect themselves and their breasts from this disease, and that there are options other than prophylactic mastectomies to prevent breast cancer.Equally important, this research could help physicians realize that non-invasive tools are available to them and their patients that will identify women at increased risk and recommend the use of natural nutritional protocols to decrease the risk of this disease.The outcome of this research could spark a preventative revolution in medicine.  I need you in this fight with me.  If you have ever lost someone you loved to cancer or if you yourself have ever had to endure those three horrific words “you have cancer,” help me fight.We can change the paradigm.  We can save lives.  I see it every day in my practice. I know the power of prevention and empowerment in healing.  I just need the data to prove it to the world.Join me.  Together we can change the face of medicine.Kristine Blanche, RPA-CFounder, Integrative Health SolutionsPhD CandidateListen to Kristine on the pod cast interview talking about this research:Part 1 - Interview on this research with John Cote on HealthcareElsewhere.comPart 2 - Interview with John Cote on HealthcareElsewhere.comCheck out our press Release!Check out a real patient testimonial video herePod cast interview with Jen Julius

story:
Changing lives one pack at a time!

Our goal is to help in the transportation of clean drinking water. In a safe and comfortable manner.
By working with other Non-governmental organizations, and your help we can get our Hydro-TransPaks into the hand of the people that really need them.


IT'S TIME FOR A CHANGE!




THE PURPOSE OF THE HYDRO-TRANSPAK:

We want to help women and children transport water, from schools or other water sources, to their homes in a more safe, comfortable and timely manner.

The Hydro-TransPak is a new and innovative wearable water carrying device, that will allow one to carry water longer distances and in a more safe and comfortable manner as the weight of the water is evenly distributed throughout one's body.

The Hydro-TransPak is versatile, allowing the user to wear the pack as a double pack or a single pack.

The Double Pack:



Wearing the Hydro-TransPak as a double pack, will allow the user to carry a maximum of 4 gallons of water. Simply attach the two smaller straps with the yellow coded female fasteners to the yellow color coded male end fasteners, Fill the  pack with water, roll the top of the pack down three times, connect the top and drape the pack over your shoulders. Total weight: 4 gallons of water = 33.4 pounds.


The Single Pack:


Wearing the Hydro-TransPak in single pack mode will allow the user to carry a maximum of 2 gallons of water. To use the Hydro-TransPak as a single pack, simply attach the two longer straps to the appropriate color coded fasteners, fill the pack with water, roll the top of the pack down three times, connect the top and wear the pack as you would a school backpack. Total weight: 2 gallons of water = 16.7 pounds. Wearing the pack in this method is ideal for smaller children that cannot handle very much weight.

 

Pack Features & Specs:




• Each Hydro-TransPak comes with 2 packs & 4 straps

• Max weight when both packs are full: 33.7 pounds

• Wear as a single pack or double pack

• Each pack holds a maximum of 2 gallons of water

• Easy to wear and carry

• Allows users to walk further to clean water sources

• Color coded fasteners makes assembly a snap

• Weight is evenly distributed throughout the body



Donate Now, we need your help:

Your donation of $10 will help in the manufacturing of 1 Hydro-TransPak.

Your donation of $20 will cover the cost to manufacture 1 Hydro-TransPak and cover the cost of shipping so we can fulfill our requested orders.

We are asking for $100,000 as we have teamed up with other Non-government organization who are currently requesting our Hydro-TransPaks for the following countries: Haiti, Uganda, Rwanda, Ethiopia and Kenya.

If we meet our goal of $100,000 that will equal 5,000 Hydro-TransPaks and we will be able to reach our goal to provide the organizations and people in the counties listed above with our Hydro-TransPak.

If we are unable to reach our goal amount. That money that has been raised will still be used for manufacturing and shipping our Hydro-TransPaks to as many organizations as possible. 

If you are unable to make a contribution at this time you can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign by sharing it with your friends and family via social media outlets, email and word of mouth.

Please help us get these packs into the hands of the people that really need them!

Any bit helps.


The Effects of Head-Loading:

   

In 2010 a study was conducted by the Environmental Health Journal. 

According to the study: Water carrying was mainly performed by women or children carrying containers on their head.  This method is know as, "Head-Loading."

During the study: The containers used, typically weighed 43 pounds and were carried over a distance of a 1/4 mile. Due to the "Head-Loading" method, 69% of the participants in the study reported spinal pain in their neck and back, while 38% reported pain in their backs only.


The Hard Reality:


  • Head loading can lead to Musculoskeletal Disorders and other physical injuries.

  • Women and children in water-stressed regions walk on average 3.5 miles everyday to get water to their homes.

  • On average women and children travel 3 times per day to collect water.

  • Due to the distance one may have to travel to get clean water one may be tempted to stop at the closest water source, which may be a contaminated pond, river or swamp.



    • Many of the items used to carry clean drinking water are worn-out jerry cans, discarded clay pots and contaminated buckets that originally carried fuel, oils, pesticides, paints and other chemicals.



    WHO WE ARE:

    We are "Equipping for Life", a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization on a mission to lend a helping hand to people in developing countries and in emergency crisis situations. We are currently working with other Non-government organizations and foundations to provide education,  training and safe water carrying solutions to under resourced communities around the world. 

    Please Join us by donating to our campaign or by helping us spread the word about our Hydro-TransPaks

    HOW WE STARTED:

    After a trip my wife and I had taken to Nicaragua we noticed most of the women and children were responsible for collecting water on a daily basis. They used plastic jerry cans / 5 gallon buckets to collected water from a local water well and used the head-loading technique to transport the water back to their homes.

    What I remember most was watching an elderly women struggling to complete this task. That was my "aha" moment and knew there had to be a better way for the local residents to transport water from point A to point B. Once we left Nicaragua I couldn't get the visions of the women, children and elderly lady out of my head and took it upon myself to do something about this situation.

    That is when Equipping for Life was born!


    WHAT WE'VE ACCOMPLISHED:

    Over the past year we used our own savings to developed the Hydro-TransPak.
    We have designed, manufactured, tested and donated our product to multiple organizations. 

    We are currently trying to make a difference in developing countries across the world by manufacturing and delivering our Hydro-TransPaks to other,
    "Clean Water" organizations so we can get them into the hands of the people that really need them.

    There are a number of organizations that are doing remarkable things by providing clean drinking water in some of the most remote places in the world. What we want to do is help the women and children in these developing areas relieve the burden by collect clean water and bring it home in a easier and less strenuous fashion.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Again if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Help us get the word out about our Hydro-TransPak campaign.
    • Don't forget you can always use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank you for your time!

story: Hi! We are Camie and Jared Sotiangco. We go to West Ranch High School in Stevenson Ranch, CA and we are part of our school's drumline. Our program has won the High Percussion award since 2012. Last year, our program received the highest score in SCSBOA history with a 97.0! This year, our program has the opportunity to take our talent to WGI World Championships in Dayton, Ohio this coming April. Drumlines from all over the world come to this event! It's amazing to be able to perform on the same floor with the greatest groups EVER! Though, this great experience comes with a price. For both of us, it is about $4,000 for uniforms, food, hotels, travel costs, and other expenses. We are suuuper passionate about drumline and this opportunity isn't offered to just any program. ANY help would be greatly appreciated! Thank you sooo much!!

story:
As many of you may or may not know, our dear friend Victor has been in the Hollywood Presbyterian Hospital for about 6 weeks with a rare blood disease that unfortunately took quite a while to be diagnosed.  During that time, he has been in and out of ICU, suffered a few mini strokes and has continued to fight hard and defy the odds, every step of the way, largely due to the immeasurable and unwavering support of Jay Becker and prayers from friends and family.

  Although Victor is receiving the best care possible from the amazing doctors and nurses at the hospital and is responding well to the treatment, he still doesn't have Health Insurance and the bills are mounting.   

This is where you come in.  

Victor's amazing mom, sister Cathy and brother James have been handling many of his expenses, but the time has come for outside assistance.  

The treatment that he is receiving may keep him in the hospital for many more weeks and during this time he is obviously not able to work and earn the money necessary to continue to pay his rent and utilities. Even after he is finally released from the hospital (which we hope will be soon) he will be recovering and still may not be able to work for a while. This is why your donation will help more than you’ll ever know.

Victor is so many things to so many people, but first and foremost he is a son and a brother. Victor would do anything for his friends and family, so now it's time for his friends and family to do as much as they can to help him.  

How?  

We have set up this Indiegogo account as a way to help raise funds for his medical bills as well as his everyday living expenses while he is still in the hospital as well as after. Indiegogo is a crowd funding website that allows everyday people the opportunity to set up a campaign to raise funds for a cause. In this case it is our amazing friend Victor.  

By giving through Indiegogo, you are giving Victor and his family some financial breathing room and alleviating some of the mental stress from being in a hospital that may be weighing on him (Even though he'll never let it show).  

Please take a second to think about what you can contribute. If you know of others who have had the pleasure of meeting Victor and you think they would like to contribute, please feel free to share this link with them.  

Every bit counts.   

All proceeds will go directly to Victor and his family.

XOXOX

story:
We love our RockStar

Thank you for stopping by our page. I am Jenn and Sterling Sky is my niece. She is very near and dear to my heart. She was recenlty diagnosed with ETANTR= embryonal  tumor with abundant neuropil and true rosettes. A very rare aggressive cancerous tumor. Our medical bills and transport bills are still inknown at this point. Anything we can raise for her will bless my brother and his sweet family.

Every penny that gets donated will go directly to saving her life and giving her the best quality of life that we can possibly give. You will become apart of that and a part of our family.

Thank you for all your love, prayers and support. We can't fight this fight alone.

 

Her blog is here: www.mylifeline.org/sterlingchronicles. We wold love for you to follow us on our journey.

story:
On November 27, 2012, Heaven called home one of its Angels faster and more suddenly than anyone expected.  On that date, Heaven's gain was Earth's loss. 
 
Grace Waite and her twin sister, Gloria, were born on April 17, 1947 in Cleveland, OH.  They were the youngest of ten children of Parents, Anne Marie and Montrose Waite.  In 1948 the family made its second pilgrimage to Liberia as missionary ambassadors for Antioch Baptist Church.  Grace loved having spent her formulative years “on The Continent.”  The family returned to Cleveland in March of 1954.

As an adolescent, Grace was initially confused by the goings on of the Civil Rights Movement in America, having been raised in a predominantly Black, African nation under a Black governing body.  As she gained further understanding though, Grace became angry and passionate about the Struggle and watched with fascination as it unfolded during her teenage years.

On January 28, 1967 Grace Waite wed Richard E. Jones.  The Draft sent Richard to Vietnam before the birth of their only child, Richard E. Jones Jr. whom Grace’s twin sister, Gloria affectionately nicknamed Asante, which means “thank you” in Swahili, the common tongue of the native Liberians.  The new nomenclature stuck.

Grace and Richard divorced in 1970 and she found employment with the Call & Post Newspaper covering the entertainment beat.  Grace interviewed such notable acts as Earth, Wind and Fire, Stevie Wonder and the Harlem Globetrotters in their 1970s heyday.  Afterwards she worked for boxing promoter Don King as his first secretary upon his release from prison. 

In 1974 Grace went to a screening of a documentary short film titled, “Last Grave at Dimbaza.”  Shot in secret, the film was smuggled out of South Africa during the Apartheid era.  The film’s unabashed display of the evils of Apartheid made a lasting impression on her that would set her on an entirely new path.  In 1976 a group of Black South African schoolchildren decided to demonstrate against the racist regime in Soweto, South Africa.  South African police opened fire on the children and massacred several hundred of them.  To which Grace angrily queried, “What if one of them had been my son?”

Thereafter Grace Waite Jones quite famously went about organizing demonstrations and rallies on the streets of Cleveland to draw focus to a tremendous injustice taking place half a world away.  From the forefront of the Anti-Apartheid Movement she joined her voice with others on a national scale to raise American awareness of the inequities of Apartheid.  By the early 80s Grace was a professional social activist, getting paid for speaking engagements on the subject of not only Apartheid but racial disproportions right here in America.

She remained fervently on this path until Nelson Mandela was released from Robben Island Prison in 1990.  In 1994, Grace traveled to South Africa as a delegate for The Africa Fund to oversee the elections process and helped to insure Mandela’s overwhelming appointment to the office of President of South Africa.  She viewed this as her crowning achievement.

Subsequently Grace opted out of the hustle and bustle of social activism and focused wholly on her family.  After her twin sister, Gloria succumbed to breast cancer in 2000, Grace filled her days quietly gardening in her yard on Cleveland’s east side.  She organized neighbors to get to the polls in large numbers in 2008 and 2012, making multiple trips to drive them herself.

On Tuesday, November 27, 2012, Grace Waite Jones passed away in her home.  She is survived by her four brothers, Robert (Joan), Jimmy, David and Paul and her son, Asante (Kelli), a host of nieces, nephews, great nieces & nephews and 3 grandkids by proxy....  She impacted the world on both a global scale and an individual basis.  Though gone from us now, her indelible mark on the world will not soon be forgotten.

The Memorial Service for Grace Waite Jones will be held on Saturday December 8, 2012 @ 1PM at Lucas Memorial Chapel, 9010 Garfield Blvd., Garfield Hts., OH 44125.

In lieu of flowers, the family is requesting this donation.  Please note, regardless of the amount listed, the family is honored and welcomes any and all donation.  Every penny will go towards honoring the life of a woman who touched so many in the form of donations to her favorite charities such as Breast Cancer Awareness, The Africa Fund and TransAfrica to name a few.  The family thanks you for any and ALL gifts.  In these ecomonic times we know giving is hard and we can't thank you enough for giving so we can give to others in Grace's memory!

The Memorial Service for Grace Waite Jones will be held on Saturday December 8, 2012 @ 1PM at Lucas Memorial Chapel, 9010 Garfield Blvd., Garfield Hts., OH 44125.

In lieu of flowers, the family is requesting this donation.  Please note, regardless of the amount listed, the family is honored and welcomes any and all donation.  Every penny will go towards honoring the life of a woman who touched so many in the form of donations to her favorite charities such as Breast Cancer Awareness, The Africa Fund and TransAfrica to name a few.  The family thanks you for any and ALL gifts.  In these ecomonic times we know giving is hard and we can't thank you enough for giving so we can give to others in Grace's memory!

story: I am an hiv positive person and have been for many years now. I have several medical issues that have placed me on Medicaid and receiving Social Security each month. I live off of $675 a month. After rent, bills, it basically leaves me with a lot of zeros. There are many things Medicaid does not cover as well as basic needs that I can't always buy. I am going with a goal that is equal to one month of money I receive because it should be able to help me for a couple months at least. Every dollar I can raise will help. I thank you for your kindness and god bless.

story:
Hi! My name is Tracy and my sons name is Jaden. We are a single-parent family unit in Saskatchewan Canada. Three years ago, our lives and that of our adopted family; were changed after I experienced a life threatening event called "Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis" Syndrome. A more severe form of Stevens Johnson Syndrome. I was 34 years of age at the time. My son was 8.


SJS/TEN is a severe life threatening allergic reaction which is usually caused by certain pharmaceutical medications. Mainly Pennicillins, Sulpha medications, some anti-convulsants, as well as some mainstream pain relievers. Mine was caused by an anti-convulsant I was taking to control Juvenille Myoclonic seizures as well as Absence seizures. I was given a 50/50% chance of surviving, having blistered and burnt over 60% of my bodies surface. I spent a little over a month in a Burn Unit, receiving iVIG treatment for my condition. I spent 4 weeks in a drug-induced coma, and another few weeks simply healing and receiving physical therapy in order to get back walking again.


This condition also caused me to lose half my hair, my fingernails, and my toenails. I suffered liver damage which lasted a year in entirety. Today; TEN has left me with dry eye syndrome, Interstitial lung disease, photo-sensitivity, anxiety, scarring of my esophagus, as well as increased sensitivity to other medications.


In essence with SJS/TEN, your body is unable to metabolize the offending medication. So it distributes it under the skin. (Hence the name: Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis. aka: Skin death.) Once under your skin, it causes the patient to "burn from the inside out." Developing severe blistering, sloughing of layers of epidermis; leaving the patient of increased risk of sepsis, pneumonia, as well as other infections and death. I firmly believe that patients who survive this ordeal, give all new meaning to the term "Survivor."


There are many other after-effects I haven't listed here. I only listed what I have been effected with. Some patients lose their ability to see, others have GI issues, the list is endless it seems. For more information on this horrible disease, please feel free to visit: Stevens Johnson Syndrome Foundation. 


Flash forward to present time: My son and I have been invited to participate in the Fox Cities Marathon in Appleton Wisconsin this September 2011, by members of Team SJS. A group of people who walk/run the marathon to raise awareness of SJS/TEN. Some members of this team are survivors themselves, and some are family/friends/supporters of survivors. The day I was invited, was truly an honor. My son and I walking with fellow survivors, raising awareness, and bringing a little bit of Saskatchewan to Wisconsin!


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

From a personal perspective, I see a tremendous impact being had on my son and myself; as well as some of the survivors we will be meeting in Wisconsin. Many I have met through Facebook, and have been a huge support for myself and my son over the three years since my hospitalization in the Burn Unit. I feel this will be a very cathartic as well as therapeutic experience for all of us whom are involved. Putting a real time face to the name. Spending "real-time" with our support system a country away. It will truly be an experience of a lifetime, and one my son and I won't soon forget.


If our campaign doesn't happen, then we simply miss out on what I feel would be an extremely healing experience emotionally for both my son and myself. I have yet to talk to or meet anyone in my home city, let alone province; who has experienced the hell of TEN, and the after effects it can bring. Meeting others who understand first hand what life is like post-SJS/TEN would be an amazing experience to say the least!


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Jaden and I are looking at $1,450.00 in travel costs to make this goal a reality. If we succeed in our fundraising goal; we have the opportunity to meet fellow survivors and their families. As well as raise awareness on this under-diagnosed and life threatening disease, which affects 100,000 people each and every year.


Monies donated to this cause, will cover our flight only. If we exceed our fundraising goal of $750.00, anything over and above will be donated to the Stevens Johnson Syndrome Foundation. If circumstances show that we are short of our goal, we will be making up the difference on our own; as well as possibly holding a steak night in our hometown. A group of lovely people in Wisconsin have expressed their interest in starting a scholarship fund, to assist us with travel costs as well. This campaign is our way of "giving back" to these kind people who would love to have us come down for the marathon, as well as meet us in person too.


As a symbol of our gratitude and "thank you" for any donations, I will be hand-making SJS/TEN awareness chokers for all donors. Every little bit helps in raising awareness ;)


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

If you'd like to help Jaden and I reach our fundraising goal (or exceed it), please feel free to share our campaign with others! If you cannot help us out right now with a financial donation, that is okay. Feel free to visit and share our website with others, so that you too can raise awareness of SJS/TEN.
story_txt:
Hi! My name is Tracy and my sons name is Jaden. We are a single-parent family unit in Saskatchewan Canada. Three years ago, our lives and that of our adopted family; were changed after I experienced a life threatening event called "Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis" Syndrome. A more severe form of Stevens Johnson Syndrome. I was 34 years of age at the time. My son was 8.


SJS/TEN is a severe life threatening allergic reaction which is usually caused by certain pharmaceutical medications. Mainly Pennicillins, Sulpha medications, some anti-convulsants, as well as some mainstream pain relievers. This condition also caused me to lose half my hair, my fingernails, and my toenails. I suffered liver damage which lasted a year in entirety. Today; TEN has left me with dry eye syndrome, Interstitial lung disease, photo-sensitivity, anxiety, scarring of my esophagus, as well as increased sensitivity to other medications.

In essence with SJS/TEN, your body is unable to metabolize the offending medication. So it distributes it under the skin. (Hence the name: Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis. aka: Skin death.) Once under your skin, it causes the patient to "burn from the inside out." Developing severe blistering, sloughing of layers of epidermis; leaving the patient of increased risk of sepsis, pneumonia, as well as other infections and death. I firmly believe that patients who survive this ordeal, give all new meaning to the term "Survivor."

As well as raise awareness on this under-diagnosed and life threatening disease, which affects 100,000 people each and every year.

Monies donated to this cause, will cover our flight only. If we exceed our fundraising goal of $750.00, anything over and above will be donated to the Stevens Johnson Syndrome Foundation. If circumstances show that we are short of our goal, we will be making up the difference on our own; as well as possibly holding a steak night in our hometown. A group of lovely people in Wisconsin have expressed their interest in starting a scholarship fund, to assist us with travel costs as well. This campaign is our way of "giving back" to these kind people who would love to have us come down for the marathon, as well as meet us in person too.

As a symbol of our gratitude and "thank you" for any donations, I will be hand-making SJS/TEN awareness chokers for all donors. Every little bit helps in raising awareness ;)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
If you'd like to help Jaden and I reach our fundraising goal (or exceed it), please feel free to share our campaign with others! If you cannot help us out right now with a financial donation, that is okay. Feel free to visit and share our website with others, so that you too can raise awareness of SJS/TEN.

story:
About Liam!

Liam was born December 29, 2011 to his amazing mommy and daddy, Erica and Andrew. Liam's start to life wasn't easy with two fractured legs, so he spent his newborn days in casts. Now that he's older, they have more of an understanding of what he has, but still no real idea of how Liam's mobility will be impacted.

Liam was born with a rare disorder called Arthrogryposis Multiplex Congenita in his lower extremities.  Arthrogryposis or AMC for short.  He also has Muscular Dystrophy in his lower extremities. Clubbed feet that was finally corrected on Sept. 14th 2012.  And finally bilateral (both sides) Hip Dysplasia. 

We're not sure if Liam will be able to crawl or walk, so your generous gift will help towards Liam's mobility!!

You can read more of Liams story here! http://liamsfootprintsoflove.blogspot.com/

What We Need 

Since Liam doesn't have use of his legs to walk, this little guy needs a way to get around. The ZipZac is a small seat with wheels (it looks like a mini wheelchair!!) that will allow Liam the freedom and mobility to explore and be a child!

Read more about the ZipZac here!! www.zipzac.com

The Impact

As an almost one year old, it would be so amazing for Liam to be able to explore his surroundings and be a mobile child! I know this would be an absolutely amazing gift for Liam.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, spread the word! Maybe this campaign will help to raise awareness for AMC!

Also pray! Praying can be so powerful, so is greatly appreciated!

And finally, even if our goal isn't reached, Liam is facing some large medical bills now and in the future! Every little bit helps!

story:
A few years ago, my friend Randy and his family packed up their belonging and moved to the nation of Swaziland to serve the people there.  Swaziland is a nation ravaged by the AIDS pandemic. There is desperate need, both physical and spiritual.  I am running the Prairie Fire Marathon to raise money and awareness for their cause.  I am trying to raise $2000 dollars to send for food, medicine, and equipment needed to continue their work.  Please support Life For Swaziland.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/lifeforswaziland/

story:
Introduction

The CT007F is the most practical and economical way to measure radioactive contamination. Unlike most radiation detectors on the market, the CT007F can measure not only gamma, but alpha and beta as well, allowing it to directly measure contamination, as well as ambient radiation levels.

CT007F With Radium Dial Pocketwatch

 

Dangers of Radiation 

Radiation is all around us, and this is natural and normal. But, there are situations where the levels of radiation can become a concern. These include fallout from nuclear weapons, nuclear power plant accidents, radioactive dispersal devices, lost, stolen or smuggled radioactive material, transport accidents etc. 

Radioactive materials have also been used for political assassinations and other nefarious activities, with hundreds of people collaterally exposed.

Radioactive contamination becomes a concern if it is inadvertently ingested or if it is left on clothes or skin. Alpha emitters are the most dangerous type of radiation, once inside the body. They are also difficult to detect and, unlike the CT007F, none of the low-cost radiation detectors available to the general public can detect alpha radiation.

 

Comparisons to Other Detectors

Most of the radiation detectors on the market are not suitable for measuring contamination. They do not detect alpha and beta, as well as gamma radiation. Some also lack the range necessary to measure up to dangerous levels.

Radiation Detectors Under $300​

Contamination meters on the market now typically use pancake style Geiger tubes. These are quite expensive, bulky, and are also extremely fragile. They feature a thin window that can be broken with only a minor impact, or even a change in pressure. This makes them prone to breaking during transport and use, and therefore unreliable when you really need them.

Contamination Meters

 

About Our Detector

The CT007F allows for complete alpha/beta/gamma detection which makes it practical for assessing the safety of items or locations, to insure they are free from radioactive contamination.

Its compact size makes it easy to store, carry, and operate. It is durable and reliable, as its sensor is not sensitive to impacts or pressure changes. The built in display and one button interface makes use simple and intuitive. It is sensitive enough to measure background levels, but with a wide enough range to also measure dangerous levels.

Here is a demonstration of it in action.

 
Let's take a look at it up close.

The front includes an OLED display and one button user interface. Also visible are the LED, and buzzer, which can be used for alarms or count tones (configurable from within the app).

On the back is the sensor with alpha/beta shield.  This shield can be closed to take gamma only measurements or opened to reveal the sensor window and take alpha and beta readings. It also keeps the sensor safe during transport. Below that is the battery door. The CT007F uses two AAA batteries.

 

Other Practical Uses for the CT007F

The CT007F does not just have to be used as a personal radiation detector for someone's peace of mind. It has many other interesting and fun uses and is a great way to educate yourself or others about radiation in our everyday environments. People are often scared at the thought of radiation, yet knowing about natural occurring radiation is the best way to learn about unnatural and unsafe radiation. The CT007F is the best tool for doing this since its range of detection begins at very low levels, as found in your basic grocery store, upwards to higher more dangerous levels. Here are some ways to measure safe levels of radiation that occur naturally in these various environments:

  • During air travel, you can measure the increase in background radiation as the plane increases altitude.
  • When visiting antique shops, it can be used to determine if uranium glass is authentic or not.
  • You can take measurements on granite counter-tops to see their elevated level and find possible uranium hot spots.
  • If you travel to a potentially contaminated area, you could scan food before eating it and scan your clothing and shoes to make sure they were not contaminated.

In the video below, we demonstrate some everyday places radiation can be found. Including potassium iodide at the grocery store, thoriated tungsten at the hardware store and radon decay products deposited on dryer lint from radon gas in a basement.

     

    How it Works

    So how were we able to make a contamination detector that is more compact and durable than any others on the market? This began a few years ago, with a joint research venture involving the University of Regina, regarding the use silicon photo-multipliers in radiation detectors.

    Silicon Photo-Multiplier and Scintillator

    Typical photo-multipliers are large, heavy, fragile and require hundreds of volts to operate. Silicon photo-multipliers can perform a similar function with a solid state chip, at a much smaller size. When coupled with a scintillator, it detects when ionizing radiation hits the scintillator.

    After much research and testing, we were able to design a sensor, and optimize our amplification circuitry enough, to effectively measure alpha, beta, and gamma radiation.

     

    Smartphone App

    Using Bluetooth Low Energy, the CT007F can connect to GammaGuard, our Android app for monitoring radiation from your smartphone.

    With GammaGuard, you can view detailed detector data, set alarms for elevated levels, log your data with GPS coordinates and change settings on the detector. It also provides interpretation of the data, giving you  context so you know what the data means. 

    GammaGuard is already available for download in the Play Store here. In addition to serving as a UI for external detectors, it can also use the smartphone's camera to detect radiation.

    Simple View in GammaGuard

    Interpret View in GammaGuard

    We also have an early release of GammaGuard for iOS on the Apple App Store. It is available here.

     

    Where We Are Now

    We have completed design and development of the CT007F and have working prototypes. Tests with the prototype units have been very positive. We are now ready for production. Cases and membrane panels are manufactured, sensors are being built and circuit boards are on order. Early bird units will be produced in house. 

    With a successful campaign, we will hire an outside company to populate the circuit boards in bulk in order to keep prices low.

    Our Story

    We are Environmental Instruments Canada, a small, five person company based in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. We have been designing and building radiation detection equipment for 20 years, mostly for uranium mining. The CT007F is our first detector designed specifically for public use and we think it may be our most useful and versatile detector yet.

    The Team

     

    Shipping

    We will ship worldwide. The shipping price to the USA, Canada and most of the EU includes tracking. For countries where the checkout shipping amount is not enough to cover tracking, we will contact you prior to shipment to give you the option of tracked shipping, at cost.

    Conclusion

    There are many radiation detectors on the market but none that are as economical and versatile as the CT007F. Our prototype units have been a complete success and we are ready for production. Support our campaign and get your own CT007F.

     

    FAQ

    We appreciate the comments and questions we have received about the CT007F and our Indiegogo campaign so far. Here is a summary:

    1) The mushroom cloud imagery is a bit over the top.

    The mushroom cloud image can rub people the wrong way. But it is timely. According to some analysts, there is about a 20% per year probability that a nuke will be used somewhere. This is not necessarily a nuclear Armageddon, but not an insignificant event either. For a really good discussion on this please see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tW7IgKJWtqk . This is a 2008 TED event, and does not include some of the more recent threats. 

    For some people, spending $200 as a precaution on an instrument that tells them if they need to wash their hands or change their contaminated clothes is not unreasonable. If you wait until you need it, it will be too late.

    The CT007F has a wide range of uses, going from the worst case scenario, to transport accidents, to just educating yourself by measuring natural radiation all around you. We tried to be reasonably balanced in our description. Whether or not we have succeeded will depend on your perspective.

    2) To allow alpha particles into the sensor, the Mylar cover has to be thin. Wouldn’t that make the CT007F just as fragile as a pancake tube based detector?

    No. The actual sensor is a solid. Therefore, changes in air pressure will not put stress on our Mylar and there is no tube to pop. 

    Even if you do stick a pin through the Mylar (which isn't easy to do with the aluminum slider), you have a light leak but have not totally destroyed the instrument (unlike a pancake). You just have to keep light from shining through the hole and the instrument will still work. You can put a piece of tape over the entire window, and you still see beta and gamma. With a hole in a pancake, you see nothing! Also, with some skill and manual dexterity, you can put a drop of paint or black silicone on the pin hole and you end up with a tiny spot that is blind to alpha, but otherwise everything still works. Try that with a pancake!

    3) How does the sensitivity compare with a pancake based detector like the CT007P?

    Both the CT007F and CT007P will detect almost all charged particles that enter them. The P has about 3 times the detection area. So, if you put both on a distributed source (e.g. a bag of KCl salt substitute), the P will read about 3 times the CPM. If you put them both on a point source (e.g. the alpha source from a smoke detector), they will read about the same. For typical gamma (Cs-137, natural background etc.), the efficiencies are also more or less proportional to the surface area. We are planning to send a couple of units out this week for a Cs-137 calibration.

    For a contamination meter, you want to have the gamma sensitivity fairly low, so that you can still detect surface contamination (alpha, beta) without getting swamped by gamma background. As shown in our video (see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VATv9ls0L9w ), the CT007F works well detecting small amounts of contamination, without getting swamped by background gamma radiation.

    One thing CT007F users may notice if they are used to pancake type detectors, is that the sensitivity of the F to very low energy gamma radiation is quite low. For example, you won't measure anything above background on the outside of a smoke detector (60 keV gamma), while the P does respond to that. The F does respond to 60 keV gamma, but the efficiency is low. Pancake type detectors tend to over-respond to low energy gamma rays, considering the fact that these carry very little radiation dose. Of course, both the P and the F will easily detect the alpha particles from an exposed smoke detector source.

    4) The constant beeping would annoy me. Can the beeps be turned off?

    Yes, you can turn off the local buzzer through the settings menu of the Android app. The app also allows you to play the beeps (or any alarms you set through the app) through ear buds. 

    5) I want to go prospecting for Rare Earth deposits, and I need to be able to detect tiny changes in background radiation. Is the CT007F the best instrument for this?

    No. If you want to get very high sensitivity in a small instrument, consider the CT007N (AKA NanoNuke). See video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QIXLUSOqPUk . The NanoNuke does not detect alpha/beta contamination.

    6) Does the CT007F do the same thing as a $50 000 instrument?

    Probably not. There are special purpose instruments that are better at a particular purpose. 

    The CT007F is the best, most practical, general purpose radiation detector. It detects both ambient gamma and alpha/beta contamination. It is small, light weight, rugged and affordable.

For a really good discussion on this please see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tW7IgKJWtqk . This is a 2008 TED event, and does not include some of the more recent threats. For some people, spending $200 as a precaution on an instrument that tells them if they need to wash their hands or change their contaminated clothes is not unreasonable. If you wait until you need it, it will be too late.The CT007F has a wide range of uses, going from the worst case scenario, to transport accidents, to just educating yourself by measuring natural radiation all around you. We tried to be reasonably balanced in our description. Whether or not we have succeeded will depend on your perspective.2) To allow alpha particles into the sensor, the Mylar cover has to be thin. Wouldn’t that make the CT007F just as fragile as a pancake tube based detector?No. The actual sensor is a solid. Therefore, changes in air pressure will not put stress on our Mylar and there is no tube to pop. Even if you do stick a pin through the Mylar (which isn't easy to do with the aluminum slider), you have a light leak but have not totally destroyed the instrument (unlike a pancake). You just have to keep light from shining through the hole and the instrument will still work. You can put a piece of tape over the entire window, and you still see beta and gamma. With a hole in a pancake, you see nothing! Also, with some skill and manual dexterity, you can put a drop of paint or black silicone on the pin hole and you end up with a tiny spot that is blind to alpha, but otherwise everything still works. Try that with a pancake!3) How does the sensitivity compare with a pancake based detector like the CT007P?Both the CT007F and CT007P will detect almost all charged particles that enter them. The P has about 3 times the detection area. So, if you put both on a distributed source (e.g. a bag of KCl salt substitute), the P will read about 3 times the CPM. If you put them both on a point source (e.g. the alpha source from a smoke detector), they will read about the same. For typical gamma (Cs-137, natural background etc.), the efficiencies are also more or less proportional to the surface area. We are planning to send a couple of units out this week for a Cs-137 calibration.For a contamination meter, you want to have the gamma sensitivity fairly low, so that you can still detect surface contamination (alpha, beta) without getting swamped by gamma background. As shown in our video (see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VATv9ls0L9w ), the CT007F works well detecting small amounts of contamination, without getting swamped by background gamma radiation.One thing CT007F users may notice if they are used to pancake type detectors, is that the sensitivity of the F to very low energy gamma radiation is quite low. For example, you won't measure anything above background on the outside of a smoke detector (60 keV gamma), while the P does respond to that. The F does respond to 60 keV gamma, but the efficiency is low. Pancake type detectors tend to over-respond to low energy gamma rays, considering the fact that these carry very little radiation dose. Of course, both the P and the F will easily detect the alpha particles from an exposed smoke detector source.4) The constant beeping would annoy me. Can the beeps be turned off?Yes, you can turn off the local buzzer through the settings menu of the Android app. The app also allows you to play the beeps (or any alarms you set through the app) through ear buds. 5) I want to go prospecting for Rare Earth deposits, and I need to be able to detect tiny changes in background radiation. Is the CT007F the best instrument for this?No. If you want to get very high sensitivity in a small instrument, consider the CT007N (AKA NanoNuke). See video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QIXLUSOqPUk . The NanoNuke does not detect alpha/beta contamination.6) Does the CT007F do the same thing as a $50 000 instrument?Probably not. There are special purpose instruments that are better at a particular purpose. The CT007F is the best, most practical, general purpose radiation detector. It detects both ambient gamma and alpha/beta contamination. It is small, light weight, rugged and affordable.

story:
Our Story 

Why do we drink juice, soda or anything else we know isn't the best for our health? Taste. This is why we created Pressa Bottle. A portable way to extract flavor from fruit into your water. There are obvious health concerns to drinking soda and juice but instead of concocting a low cal, detox-skinny tea with anti-aging benefits "that tastes great" (pff!), we decided to simplify and create a product to flavor water naturally.

Pressa Bottle was created by 3 brothers; Jesse, Luke and Mason and was created as an alternative to all the (expensive) sugary drinks we were putting back in College. Since our original prototype we've come a long way and are on our way to fill our initial Kicksarter order shortly. 

Original Prototype 

Nicknamed "Frankenbottle" this "thing" was our proof of concept. It's not pretty but believe it or not it worked and helped us to prove our concept. 

 

What You Get & What We Need To Get To

What We Need 

  • Nothing, WE ARE NOW SHIPPING
  • !
  • Here are some cool pictures of our mold and a video of it in action!

 

What You'll Get

  • Depending on how much you contribute you'll receive at least one Pressa Bottle 
  • Your choice between a glass or plastic bottle 
  • Optional protective sleeves can be added to the glass bottle's as well
  • So much flavor your taste buds will tell their buds 

BPA Free Tritan Collection $25

 

Premium Glass Collection + Protective sleeve 

 

Our Impact

We created Pressa Bottle as an alternative to all the garbage drinks that are on the market, all claiming health and hydration. With Pressa Bottle you don't have to sacrifice a smart choice for a little flava! 

(Extremely) Real Life Pressa Bottle Scenario

The health benefits of Pressa Bottle are obvious, so here's another scenario for you. You're at work, it's 3:30pm and everyone's taking a break. You're filling up your Pressa Bottle at the water cooler and bump into your work crush. They ask you about your Pressa Bottle and you tell them, all nonchalant, like they probably should know what it is (smooth). They ask you what you're doing after work. BOOM! Pressa Bottle is better than Tinder. 

There are so many other scenarios where Pressa Bottle can improve your lifestyle and this is just one. 

Other Ways You Can Help Us Out! 

If you can't contribute now or maybe are shy on cash because of all those overpriced soda's and juices. You can still help us! We are just a small crew and could use your help sharing our campaign. To make things easy there are share tools located at the top of the campaign. 

We really appreciate the support and the help from our newly made friends so if there is anything we can do for you, be sure to let us know and we'll see if we can help. 

One last time to show you how well it works!

story:
BLINCAM is a wearable camera that responds to winking and blinking.

It doesn't simply respond to ordinary blinking, though--you have to give a noticeable wink (or blink, if you aren’t a good winker).

BLINCAM is a new type of camera - let's explore the world with BLINCAM!

- The company was founded out of a simple idea
---- Wouldn't it be great if we could snap photos of our families and friends when they’re acting naturally? Not posing for a camera, but with all the expressions of joy and surprise you have as you actually live your life.
After one year of effort, it is a reality.

By using BLINCAM to snap photos of your children, you won’t get posed, unnatural photos -- you can capture them in the candid moment.
BLINCAM is a tool designed to let you capture life as it happens.
While posed photos with the framing carefully planned are also nice, don’t you want to capture the world before you as you see it? This special camera is designed to let you capture those magic moments.

How you use it is, of course, up to you.


When you catch your family and friends off-guard making an interesting expression or you see a touching scene, whipping out your smartphone to take a pic will be too late.
By the time you’re ready, the moment will have passed. Children grow up very fast. Each and every instance is a precious memory. You can’t let those valuable shutter opportunities go by.

But with BLINCAM, you will never let the moment pass.


You catch a great view as you ride your bike--snap!

Your hands are busy as you cook a meal. Snapping a pic is no problem!


Your hands are full of luggage on a trip. Now you can snap a pic!When watching a sporting event, you don’t want to have your eyes glued to your smartphone -- you want to be able to look up and enjoy the game with your own eyes. In these cases, too... Snap!



- Use casually and coolly

BLINCAM is committed to producing a device that simply attaches to your glasses. We didn’t want to make a massive, multi-function pair of goggles that was expensive. We wanted a more simple and intuitive design that could be used by people everywhere. The product is just 25 grams in weight (about 5 coins), meaning it can be attached to your glasses without discomfort.

We believe that wearable devices should be an extension of fashion. Giant, science-fiction esque devices or helmet-like gadgets can really spoil your looks. We have aimed to create a product that feels at home on your face and that has a UX as simple as it feels.
 

Getting started:

  1. Download the BLINCAM app and sign up
  2. Follow the instructions to pair BLINCAM to your smartphone over Bluetooth
  3. Attach the BLINCAM
  4. Follow the guidance to begin calibration
     *You will be asked to slowly adjust the position of the BLINCAM while blinking several times and finding the best position for you.
  5. You’re finished!

Usage:

  1. Put on your glasses.
  2. Set the BLINCAM switch to the on position and attach to your glasses.
    *It will automatically pair with your smartphone.
  3. Wink to snap a photograph.
    *A shutter sound confirms that you’ve taken a picture.
  4. Launch the smartphone app.
  5. Photos are displayed in the order taken; simply flick with your thumb to sort.
  6. Attach the device to your smartphone over USB to mass copy photos.
  7. Share your photos online or on social media.

Our video hit more than 10M views on CNBC!!
 

 


Since we hit our goal of $30,000, you can choose from five colors; black, white, blue, pink or green! After the campaign we’ll send you an email asking what color you’d prefer.











All purchase through Indiegogo are scheduled to be delivered in April 2017!


We're a team of dreamers, designers, engineers and problem solvers. Our goal is to help people to enjoy their life with our technologies and ideas!


The company was founded out of a simple idea--wouldn't it be great if we could snap photos of our families and friends when they’re acting naturally? Not posing for a camera, but with all the expressions of joy and surprise you have as you actually live your life.
BLINCAM is more than a gadget to us. It’s about remembering the world in an entirely new way.

Have you ever noticed that people in pictures from the 1800s are never smiling? The camera technology from those days meant they had to sit still for 15 minutes or more for a single picture, so it was too hard to smile for that long. As a result, the happiness of an entire era of people has been lost with time.

Today we can capture smiles, but we rarely capture moments. Our phones, snug in our pockets, capture only the planned, the posed, the expected. They capture the action as it passes us by, having stepped to the side to take out our phones and line up a shot. They miss when your friend laughs so hard that milk comes out his nose. They miss the tears in your lover’s eyes when you pull out a ring and ask her to marry you. They miss when the baby in your arms wakes up to your face and laughs.

Our backers will be the first to capture these moments, to forever preserve the special moments in their lives the way they really saw them. All it will take is a blink to let you, your friends, your children, and even people hundreds of years from now step into your life during your happiest moments.

We invite you to make history with us.

 

About the product:

Q. I live outside of United States. Will you ship to my country?
Sure! We ship worldwide so won't be a problem.

Q. Can I wear BLINCAM with sunglasses?
Absolutely yes!

Q. What glasses can I attach BLINCAM to?
The product comes with three attachments used to attach to glasses. These will allow you to attach BLINCAM to most standard glasses. There is a possibility that it may not fit glasses with a unique temple size that is very thin or thick.

Q. Isn’t this product heavy?
The product weighs in at 25 grams (about 5 coins) and is designed to be so light that you won’t notice it.

Q. How accurate is the wink detection?
Tests have confirmed over 90% accuracy with the current prototype, and virtually no delay between the wink and the picture. We plan to continue testing and calibrating the device further before it ships.

Q. Does the device mistake normal blinking for shutter snapping?
BLINCAM features a sensor that is tuned to not detect ordinary blinking, so it should not misfire. However, there may be cases (about 10%) where it mistakes normal blinking for a shutter snap.

Q. I’m not good at winking. Can I still take photos?
Instead of winking, you can simply close both eyes firmly to take a photo as well.

Q. How do I align the focus?
The BLINCAM features a fixed focus and is designed to be in focus in most cases. You cannot focus on specific objects or subjects or intentionally blur the background.

Q. What about photo blur from vibrations?
The BLINCAM does not feature a blur correction feature. If engaged in intense movement, the photos produced will be like those taken on a smartphone in equivalent circumstances. We suggest stopping your movement before taking a photo.

Q. Can the BLINCAM take videos?
The BLINCAM only takes still photos. If there is sufficient demand, we may consider adding video in the future.

Q. The battery life is listed as eight hours on standby. How long will it last when in use?
While it varies by the volume of photos you take, we estimate about four hours.


About the app:

Q. Do I have to have the app to use BLINCAM?
No. The device can be attached to a computer via a Micro USB cable to transfer data directly. The files will be browsed in the same fashion as when you insert an SD card or other external media in your computer.

Q. Can BLINCAM be used on iOS and Android?
Yes, it supports both systems. Please refer to the Specs document for supported devices and OSes.

Q. Can BLINCAM be used with feature phones?
Unfortunately, the system does not support feature phones.
 

Usage environment:

Q. Can the BLINCAM be used overseas?
Yes. Note that connections to web sites and the cloud depend on your particular Internet connection.
 

Miscellaneous:

Q. Privacy
BLINCAM should not be used in public locations or other venues where it would infringe on the privacy of others. The video includes a scene of a user winking at a cafe, but the BLINCAM was originally developed to let you take photos of your private moments with your family and when engaging in your personal hobbies. Please respect the privacy of others when using BLINCAM.

BLINCAM is designed to be easy to attach and remove. When in a public space or when not using the device, you can conveniently detach it. BLINCAM is a special camera that responds to winking -- no hands required. While a shutter sound is produced, it is intended for your own confirmation and is not a loud sound that will disturb others. As with a smartphone, respect the privacy and rights to likeness of others when photographing, sharing photos, and posting online so as not to infringe on the rights of other people.


Please reach out to us at info@blincam.co if you have any questions!!
