story:
GETTING CRITICAL!!

TO BE CONTINUED.....

GAIANS....WHAT IS THE MATTER?? 

The deadline for this campain is running out in less than 2 Days!! 

BUT DENISE, HER FUZZ KIDS ARE STILL STUCK

Our friend is going through a bit of a nightmare recently due to issues with her 

husband. She lives in Japan because her husband works for the Military and was then 

based in Japan. Upon her time in Japan our friend became the owner of eight dogs 

which she rescued from the street in a cruel scenario. These dogs are her children, 

there is nothing more important to her in the world. Four of the dogs are now in 

America with the husband as he moved away from Japan which is all part of the 

troubling issues our friend is going through. Apart from a really bad health, caused from 

stress , asthma and different allergies the four dogs that are left, are all she 

has left in the world and she needs to somehow get these four wonderful creatures 

with her back to Germany (Her home country) or to get settled in Okinawa to start making a living & provide for herself & the Fuzzes!

consequences of leaving these dogs in Japan are worse than you'd every think. I 

won't go into that much detail as to what could happen to four dogs who are left to 

a shelter. To move four dogs across the world, it doesn't come cheap. There are 

many phases of the process that need to be done carefully and so the extravagent 

prices get worse and worse. Although it is a large amount of money, it is extremely 

worth it to get these dogs to a safe home where they can continue their lives with 

their true owner. The money so kindly given will go towards vetenary sessions which 

are compulsary and also the actual flight to get them and her away to safety. 

We did contact the embassy about her situation, but they are not really qucik in making 

decisions or borrowing money for a plane ticket, so that we need to be worried, that her 

health issues will be worse. The only things the embassy offered till now are 2000 

japanes yen, which is as much as 15 Euros. Also they did send her a lost of homeless

people places.

AT THIS POINT SHE IS HOMELES!! Selling her equiptment to provide for a roof in the limited accamodations.

We really do appreciate any amount of money given as each penny is a step further 

towards the end of this disaster.  

thats the story of the dogs, she rescued

http://gaia-intervention.com/2011/06/the-story-of-5-lil-bundles-of-thankfulness-love/

ONE WORLD, ONE PEOPLE!!

thats the story of the dogs, she rescuedhttp://gaia-intervention.com/2011/06/the-story-of-5-lil-bundles-of-thankfulness-love/
ONE WORLD, ONE PEOPLE!!

story:
Hey there! My name is 'Amy'. I am better known as Ashlin Taylor, I am 20 years old and I am transgender.

I am a male in a female body who just wants to be comfortable with who they are and how they look. For as long as I remember I have never felt or been female at any point in my life. 

My campaign is about helping me look how I feel. I am saving up funds to pay the full amount up front and to confirm a date to get my Top Surgery; otherwise known as a bilateral mastectomy. This surgery removes my breast tissue via incisions and the surgeons will contour my chest and nipples to a more masculine shape that better represent who I am on the inside. This surgery is important to me because I want to look how I feel. I am a man trapped with a woman's body and I don't want to give up on life simply because I do not look how I should! I am a strong dude with a passion for life and I will not give up on my campaign until I have reached my goal. I will not give up just because I cannot get health insurance due to birth defects and other health conditions, and instead will keep fighting for my much needed surgery no matter how long it takes.

 

 

Any contributors will help me reach my goal and help fund my top surgery to help me express who I truly am and for that -- any donation made no matter how big or small -- I thank you so much in advance for your help.

After a huge amount of research I have come to realise I need $11,000USD to cover everything. This amount includes:

  1. Surgery, painkillers/anti-biotics and post-op check-ups and revisions
  2. Anaesthetist which is not included in surgery costs
  3. Hospital stay for up to 2 nights
  4. Any travel costs such as petrol, or inter-island flights
  5. 2-4 weeks off of work to recover and heal before returning; this includes bills, rent, food and petrol cover over that period off work.

Any excess funding will be going to a trust fund that helps other transgender FtM and MtF reach their top surgery goals. Effectively by helping me you are helping the rest of the transgender populace reach their goals as well. If I reach my goal, the entire surgery, anaesthetic, and hospital costs will be put down to confirm a surgery date within the next year, and to pay 2-4 weeks worth of rent, bills, food and petrol. If I do not reach my goal, I will put the entire amount into a locked savings account and will continually be adding to that account via continued use of IndieGoGo, Kickstarter and GoFundMe as well as the savings from my own job until I reach the full amount to do the same as above. I am going as far as selling anything that is not necessary when it comes to personal belongings, I feel that I can always get these items back in the future but for now I am focusing on my life and making myself comfortable with my body!

 

 

My campaign is highly important to me, i've known I was a guy in the wrong body for years but denied it until I moved out and realised I can be who I want to be and no one's opinions on who I am matter. 

I have come out to my family, all of my friends, and my loving partner who has chosen to stick by my side throughout everything. I have even gone so far as to get the trans*/bigender/agender/intergender marker X put on my passport ( http://img16.imageshack.us/img16/5992/passportl... ) As without the top surgery and hormones I do not have access to the gender marker for males yet. I am making a strong push and am not giving up on this at all. Previous GoFundMe campaigns for another health issue i've had (Severe Bowlegs) ended in me getting enough funding to be seen by a professional, a physiotherapist and Xrays which lead to being diagnosed with my current condition as well as hip dysplasia -- the reason I cannot get health insurance.

If you can't donate but still want to help, please share this around and promote it! Any help is good help so please help me get this noticed! Unfortunately no perks can really be made for donating other than an honourable mention in any campaign video that is made including when I post my first post-operation video!

I also have a tumblr under http://akitaboy.tumblr.com and this is my trans* tumblr. I have enabled questions and answer them when I get them. This contains all the information from before and during my transition and the problems I have faced so far.

I just want to be me and be comfortable with my body as a MAN!

story:
My son Craig has recently been diagnosed with a rare, deadly blood disease called HLH. He first became ill in October of 2012, which resulted in hospitalization for an extended period of time. After extensive testing and research by many doctors the diagnosis of HLH came, and fortunatly, unfortuatly at the same time there is only one cure. Craig must have a bone marrow transplant. While being hospitalized the first time he under went chemo therapy and has since been waiting t...o find a donor for his transplant. The donor has been found and Craig will be ready to go for his transplant April 2nd. The week prior to, he will under go extensive chemo therapy to prep him for the transplant. As you can imagine the medical bills have since piled up and will continue to do so through this journey, which is not a short one. At this benefit you can pay $20 for three games and shoe rental. For anyone 15 and under that cost will be $10. All proceeds will go to Craig to help with medical expenses. Please keep Craig in your prayers. Thanks to everyone for the support.
Kenny Simms

story:
Moore, Oklahoma Tornado Disaster Relief Fund

This campaign is strictly for the families for FOOD SUPPLIES and OTHER NECESSITIES as well as FUNERAL EXPENSES for the victims.

 

100% of the proceeds raised in this Indiegogo campaign will go directly

to the Red Cross and other local charities located in Oklahoma City

on behalf of the victims and their families of the Moore, Oklahoma Tornado

Disaster on May 20th, 2013.

 

* EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS! 

* PLEASE HELP IF YOU CAN.

(All donations are tax deductible.)

 
 

* Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help with this financial campaign, please consider sharing this donation page on your Facebook, Twitter, or Pinterest wall with your friends and get the word out.
 
Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a physical therapist (Cindy) from the US trying to help my Haitian friend Ivens, who is a PT (and OT) and his colleagues realize their dream of providing a rehabilitation and health center (FONHARE) in northern Haiti, raise awareness about disability in Haiti and the efforts there to change the lives of those, especially children, living with disabilities.

 The Haitian Foundation of Rehabilitation (FONHARE) is a not-for-profit organization NGO, dedicated to providing humanitarian rehabilitation services to the poorest people with disabilities in Haiti.  A year and a half after the devastating earthquake that hit Haiti thousands of children, youth and elderly are living with physical disabilities but they have nowhere to receive comprehensive rehabilitation services to improve their quality of life and integrate themselves into society. Specifically in northern Haiti, many disabled people have been moved to that region after the earthquake.  Until FONHARE there weren’t any Rehab Services where they could receive comprehensive care for the recovery of their disabilities and injuries to improve their quality of life and reintegrate them into society. Thus they remain a perpetual drain for the family. 

What We Need and What You Get

Our first goal is to raise $12,000 for the salaries of a physical therapist and a physical therapy technician for one year.  Ivens has been working 16 hour days and cannot continue this pace.  One Haitian physical therapist who is currently working in the DR is willing to come back to Haiti and work for basic expenses of $600 per month.  A physical therapy technician salary is $400 per month.  $12000 will cover these two salaries for one year. 

 Please help us make FONHARE successful in it's mission by contributing towards these salaries! 

Any funds raised over and above the salaries will go toward the purchase of a portable x-ray machine for the health center.  If the $12000 goal is not reached for salaries, the funds raised will still go toward the salary of additional help at the clinic.

The Impact

Since the earthquake, money has been donated to various causes in Haiti, but often gets lost in bureaucracy and/or the administration budgets of large organizations and never reaches the people and places it was intended for.  This is a chance to help bring about real and lasting change, help build the infrastructure in Haiti, and support Haitians where they live and work.

It is also an opportunity to support enormous change in a culture that devalues people with disability - a chance to help alleviate misery and give some real hope to those who have no one to stand up for them.

Hopefully, many donators will contribute to this cause and word will spread that there are great things happening in Haiti!

Show  solidarity and promote Haitian endeavors that are building up the lives of the most oppressed and disadvantaged!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on facebook and any other social media sites you visit!

Visit the FONHARE website:  www.fonhare.org and give them your support and encouragement for their work and find out more about what they are doing in their country.

story:
Hello, it is nice to meet anyone who takes a look at my campaign here. I am 29, and a Step mom to two wonderful children as well as a Fur Mom to my rescue kitties. I used to train horses and ballroom dance, but have had to give that up just for now to fight this cancer.

 

3 years ago I was told I had non Hodgkin lymphoma and I have been fighting it ever since. I have no insurance so I have had to go with the most “affordable” choices to me. While they have kept the cancer somewhat in check they have not helped to go into remission. That is when my Oncologist suggested Radio Immunotherapy, a therapy that delivers a lethal dose of radiation to the cancer cells while keeping a lower dose than normal to the normal tissue of the body.

 

The wonderful thing is through fund raising and working with the oncologist directly we have managed to collect the funds needed for this life saving treatment. The last stretch of what we are needing to do is the final funds for expenses of travel, and accommodation for the trip I will need to make to Indianapolis to the Memorial Hospital East for the treatment. This treatment has a very good chance of sending me into remission and helping me win this fight with Cancer. To give me back my life, and allow me to get back to the passions of work that I love and have been unable to do.

 

The impact

 

With this treatment completed I can finally hope to beat this and be on the full road to recovery. I have worked answering phones through the whole battle of my cancer, but it has not been an easy task. I want to get back to the horse training and dancing I have done in the past, and I know if I beat this I can. My goal when beating this cancer is to dedicate as much of my time as possible to helping a local rescue A hoof and a prayer, to retrain rescues and to find them the perfect homes. While also going back to teaching dance and starting a program for the youth in the area.

 

Other ways you can help:

 

If you can not help financially that is okay, spread the word! Also any kind of blessings, prayer and energy are always welcome.



Blessings upon you.

story:
Short Summary

Arnold McDuffie is passionate about life and most of all, others. Duff joined the Marine Corps when he was 18 years old. During his time in the corps, he would invite single marines to his homes for BBQ's to make them less home sick. In 1998 he started working in the school systems as a substitute teacher and a bus driver, and the city department of parks and recreation who both terminated his employment when notified of his diagnosis. He would also mentor kids and help them study for their EOG tests. He also helped students fill out paperwork for college and help them get grants so they could afford to go to college.  He worked in the boys and girls club helping kids with homework or just helping them with home life. In 2012 He was diagnosed with stage 3 emphysema and congestive heart failure. He never smoked a day in his life. He can no longer leave his house because he needs to be on oxygen 24/7. His passion is helping youth and he can no longer do that because he can not leave his house. 

What We Need & What You Get

Duffie needs $5,500 for a portable oxygen concentrator. All funds raised will go to help him get his portable oxygen concentrator.

The Impact

With your donation, you will not only help Duffie, but many kids who need his help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not give a money donation, please forward this link so others can see how passionate he is and help him get back to what he loves doing, which is  helping others.

story:
“Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him and He will direct your path.” – Proverbs 3: 5-6

My name is Rosemary Velez and I am the mother of 13 year old Michael Santiago. When Michael was born he was diagnosed with Cerebral Palsy. The disease was so severe that many doctors did not give my son a chance to see his teen years. But as he grew his desire to fight and live on grew with him. There are many things that most 13 years old have been blessed to do on an everyday basis that Michael does not get to do. Michael is stricken to a wheel chair for the rest of his life, he cannot feed himself neither can he play outside with peers his age but his smile and his ability to win always gives us hope of better days ahead.

But through all the struggles and sleepless nights I along with his father have always fought to treat Michael like everyone else and give him the life that one said he could never have.  One of the biggest struggles that we now face is the ever enduring task of taking care of a young teenage boy with limited resources to do the things necessary to give him as normal as life as possible.

We as a team are looking to purchase a van with a wheelchair lift installed to be able to do the things necessary to get Michael around. This is not an easy task because although he may not be able to do things on his own, his body continues to grow and grow more fragile. Transporting him in our current condition makes it hard on him and his health.

So we ask that you join us in this campaign to get Michael the help he deserves. God has truly blessed us with a miracle child. We hope that you be a blessing to us as much as he has been a blessing to all.

In Love

Rosemary Velez

story:
Women across the world labor and deliver in some of the filthiest conditions imaginable. Many maternity wards are over crowded with minimal supplies. The woman above gives birth on the floor in the main teaching hospital of Papua New Guinea. She lays on tiles with not even a blanket or pillow to comfort her head and neck. This is just one example of some of the horrors that extreme poverty brings.

    Earth's Angels is a non-profit organization that has dedicated its existence to help eradicate maternal and infant mortality one mother and baby at a time.      

     My name is Hanan. I was born and raised in Ghana, West Africa. I know first hand the terrible hardships of surviving in a third world country. I was orphaned by the age of 8 and then raised by my maternal grandmother. Life was anything but easy those days. However, I was fortunate enough to be able to come to the United States when I was 15, and soon after gained American citizenship. For many years following, I struggled alone to care for myself, knowing that I wanted a better life than I had known in the past. In 2008, after much perseverance, I graduated with a Bachelor's of Science in Nursing.

I am very proud to be a Registered Nurse.
I take care of mothers and babies as if they were my own family!

I have never forgotten the feeling of hunger and the sights of true poverty. I have always had the desire to go back and help people much less fortunate that struggle to survive in unimaginable conditions. Although nurses everywhere help people everyday, I know from personal experience that there are countless  people that desperately need help and have no way to get it, or even anyone to ask.
      
With your selfless contributions to this cause however, I will personally deliver the help that is needed, right where it will do the most good. When myself and our volunteers travel to these impoverished areas with things such as food, water, medical supplies, diapers, vaccines, etc, we will know exactly where to go, having memories from my childhood and my recent visits home to guide us.
Earth's Angels is currently under review to receive its 501(C)3 status. Hopefully, we will receive this honor in 2013.

story:
Multiple sclerosis stops people from moving, and the National MS Society exists to make sure it doesn't. We believe that moving is not just something you can or can't do, but rather is who you are. This is why we host events like Bike MS -- to raise funds for critical research, as well as comprehensive programs and services for people with MS -- moving closer to a world free of MS. By working together, we can keep everyone moving forward.

For the past two years my twin 14 year old boys and I have done the ride together.  I personally have ridden the Bike MS since 2005 and have raised about $5000. The first year I rode I raised $1200 and about $600 each year after that.

We each would like to raise $1200 to be a “Top Banana.” A “Top Banana” is simply someone that raises $1200 or more. As an incentive they earn a special jersey. The funding we need is to sign up for the ride, pay for lodging, and raise a minimum amount of $300. Funds will go for: Registration: depending on when the registration happens it is $30 - $60 a person Minimum fund raising amount: $300 per person to ride (Minimum amount MUST be met to ride) Lodging: $30 per person (two nights in a cabin at Camp Kern)

ALL EXTRA FUNDS WILL GO TOWARDS MS RESEARCH

Because of the work of researchers around the world, thousands of people living with MS can manage their disease and live productive, active lives. Those we care about personally- our family and friends -can be optimistic about what the future holds for them and their children.  YOU are the research revolution, and NOW is the time for bold action.  

Your fundraising helps:

•STOP MS in its tracks  

•RESTORE function already lost to damage from MS  

•END MS forever, including protection for future generations

One of my co-workers has MS, another co-worker has a family friend with MS, and one of my aunts has a friend with MS. We ride for them. Chances are you either know someone or know someone that knows someone with MS.

Any amount will do. And if you can't donate spread the word with the Indiegogo share tools.

This is why we host events like Bike MS -- to raise funds for critical research, as well as comprehensive programs and services for people with MS -- moving closer to a world free of MS. By working together, we can keep everyone moving forward.

story:
Short Summary

California Home for Seniors is an organization that assists seniors, young adults and their families find placement into different housing options for Free. We find placement for seniors and young adults into Assisted Livings, Board and Cares, Alzheimer's Communities, Nursing Homes, Adult Residential Facilities. We also assist families through the application process for Veterans Benefits and Medi-Cal Benefits for free. Our placement specialists are there to assist every family member and their loved ones find the right type of home where they can rest assured that they will be taken care of. 

Our highly trained elder care advisers will guide the resident and their family through the whole process, whether to apply for certain benefits, tour with the communities, negotiate the final price before moving in or providing transportation services. Best of all, these and many more services are provided free from charge to all parties involved. 

Our mission to help all who are placed into a difficult situation where they feel that they can no longer manage the care needs and health issues of their loved ones. We assess and evaluate every community we refer to, in order to make sure that our clients are referred to a safe and healthy environment. 

With the baby boomer age approaching, the need for these types of services would be a great asset to have.


With over 8 years of experience in the residential care facility industry, California Home for Seniors has assisted over 80,000 families and their senior residents for FREE to find the most appropriate senior care home.

Our caring staff takes into consideration all of the important factors that are associated with finding the best Senior and Young Adult Housing Option. When making our initial assessment of your family member’s situation we take into account their major health issues, ambulation status, cognitive standpoint, dietary requirements and any other major care levels that are important in their daily routines. With additional information such as location preferences and budget California Home for Seniors experts carefully handpick 4 to 10 communities that meet all of your criteria. These options are licensed, bonded, insured, and have a minimum requirement of caregivers.

California Home for Seniors is contracted with over 8,000 licensed and pre-qualified assisted livings, board and cares, nursing homes, Alzheimer's facilities and adult residential facilities. We cover all major areas such as Los Angeles, Orange, Ventura, Riverside, San Bernardino, Sacramento, San Francisco and many other counties throughout California.

California Home for Seniors placement services works with all major medical groups such as Kaiser, Healthcare Partners, Regal and Facey Medical Group. Our partners also include most major hospitals including Long Beach Memorial, Cedars-Sinai, Kaiser of Woodland Hills and Panorama City, St Joseph, Encino Hospital, St. Jude and much more.

Remember our services are 100% free from charge to the resident and their family members and there is no obligation to utilize our services. Some of our other unique services also include:

  • Applying for Veterans Benefits for qualified seniors
  • Guidance to apply for Medi-Cal Benefits
  • Asset Allocation to afford senior housing
  • Assistance with touring communities
  • Negotiate Pricing with facilities


What We Need

Our organisation needs a minimum of $70,000 for two specific reasons. 

The first is that we can hire additional placement specialists and provide them with proper training in order to assist our clients. Our placement specialists are dedicated to ensuring that every client we work with is given their utmost attention and professionalism. Fortunately, the need for our services grows every year by 20% in order to properly accommodate that growth rate our company needs to hire additional representatives.

The second reason why we need additional funding is to launch a series of websites for every county in California that will focus on providing detailed information on each different type of community that is available for seniors and young adults with disabilities. We want to make sure it is simple and stress-free for everyone to find a safe and reliable community to take care of their loved one. We have already launched one such website for Los Angeles County: www.losangelesassistedlivingfacilities.com, 

Our company has never needed the influx of additional capital. We started out with two partners and only $5,000. Unfortunately, we have reached a point in our company where the need for our services is growing faster than we can handle and this additional capital will not only help us sustain the impact from growth but also help the families in need. 


The Impact

With the baby boomer age group approaching and so many families struggling to find a place that can take care of their loved one as well as a place that is affordable, our service is tremendously needed. We have currently helped approximately 80,000 families throughout California since we started 8 years ago with finding the right type of housing option and that number is growing rapidly every year. 

Please help us grow our outreach in order to help those families in need of a better, more affordable option to take care of their loved ones. 


Testimonials

Arthur was such an important person to my sister and I when our father was living at a board and care facility a few years ago. He was extraordinary, he performed his duties in a very caring and professional way, but he also was truly a friend to my mother and to us. He gave us a level of comfort in a very stressful time. Jenny and Roxanne, Riverside CA


My husband and I were having a difficult time understanding what to do with his 85 year old uncle who has Dementia disease. We moved him from Lakewood CA to Anaheim at a moment’s notice. We had no resources due to being clueless of this illness. My husband and I had to rearrange our work schedule so one of us would be there due to her running away and it became very unsafe for him. I called Arthur, and he assessed the situation and, together, we were able to move our uncle into an Alzheimer’s assisted living facility within two days. If it weren’t for Arthur’s knowledge and quick assistance, we don’t know what we would have done. We appreciate everything he did to help us in this crisis. We would recommend him to anyone that is in need of this service.  Anna and Michael, Covina CA

Arthur was a tremendous comfort to my brother and I when we decided to move our mother into an assisted living environment. Not knowing exactly what to expect, we feel very fortunate that Arthur was there to make our father feel welcome and comfortable as well as answer any questions we had. His experience working with seniors was evident right away and made the transition to an assisted living environment much easier for our mother as well as for us. It has been several years now but when I think back it is Arthur and his caring that comes to mind.Susan and John, Los Angeles CA

Arthur is a very bountiful and caring person. Our aunt was a resident at the facility where Arthur knew wasbest fit for her cultural needs. When a crisis arose, Arthur was there. He also was a good friend, which made us feel that we could talk to him anytime about our concerns. Arthur is very qualified and we are quite convinced that he would do all that he could do to help make the right decisions for the family. It is such a stressful time for everyone concerned when dealing with their loved one.  Mary, Fullerton CA 

‘Thank You’ does not seem sufficient for all of the help that you gave us during this difficult time. Your understanding of who our father was as a person, as well as his medical needs was remarkable. Your willingness to go the extra step and take her to visit the various places was above and beyond anything we could have hoped for. We truly appreciate all that you did for us. Mike and Tracy, Irvine CA 

I am writing on behalf of my father, Jacob. He asked that I thank you for him for all of your help during this difficult time. I too wish to thank you for your ongoing concern and endurance in assisting my father in finding appropriate living arrangements for my parents. Your knowledge and ongoing support have helped ease the burden.  David, Ventura CA 

Arthur Mogilevski’s service is a blessing for people with aging parents in southern California who need help in placing them in facilities that are appropriate to their changing needs and budgets. He knows every eldercare facility in great detail: their backgrounds, their organization styles, the changing mix and quality of their services, the staff, and their costs and benefits. He makes searching for an appropriate placement, which can be a painful crisis in the lives of seniors and their family members, almost pleasurable.  Peter, Torrance CA 

My brother was in his end stages of Alzheimer’s. I received a message from the hospital that he had to go home or to a facility, but could no longer be helped at the hospital. CALIFORNIA HOME FOR SENIORS helped me locate a home for my brother the same day. California Home for Seniors made my life so easy at such a difficult time. Without their help I wouldn’t have known what to do. Thank you to all the staff members for their information and endurance, and for giving us peace of mind.  Jacob, Palm Desert, CA 

I had no family members to turn to. I was in a rehab center with a broken hand and congestive heart failure. I could not go back to my home for a while because it has stairs. I am older and my body is not healing as fast as I want it to. I was referred to CALIFORNIA HOME FOR SENIORS. I had to trust them to find a place for me to go to since I couldn’t view them myself. I am so thankful that social worker gave me their card. They found me a really nice facility and I am so happy. I will not be there for a long time because I have a home to go to, but for now I have a place I can call home, that I can afford, in the city I requested. I am well taken care of. Thank you  CALIFORNIA HOME FOR SENIORSWayne Cofax, Chatsworth CA 

When we decided it was time to find a place for my mother to live, I had no idea where to begin looking. After my first conversation with Arthur, I knew he had only our best interests in mind. His knowledge of the facilities in the area was so helpful to us in finding the right placement. His honest and caring approach makes it is easy to see he cares a lot about the people he works with. He helped to make this difficult transition go smoothly for all of us! Jackie, Pasadena CA 



Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help fund our goals, please help by spreading the word about our organization and the help we can provide to families and their loved ones.

story:
WE DID IT! With the help from all of you - we reached our GOAL!

Let's not stop here though! 

We have 1 week left in the fundraiser to raise additional funds! 

Ever dollar we raise over $3,500 will go towards buying more toothbrushes to help the millions of children in need throughout the world that suffer from poor oral hygiene.


***Words cannot express how thankful we are for your donations and support. Your contributions will truly make a big difference in the lives of children who need it the most.*** 


 

                    

Hi my name is Dane, welcome to Operation Brush's first fundraiser! 

At the beginning of this year I had an idea to start a nonprofit that distributes biodegradable toothbrushes to underprivileged children all around the world. How or why did I decide on doing this you might be wondering?

Well it all started with my twin cousins, age 6, doing a project for school. Their project was simple: raise money to purchase toothbrushes to send to El Salvadorian children in need (Sophia and Rody managed to get 700 toothbrushes in total!). When I heard about this project, it inspired me, so I did a little research... To my amazement I discovered that there are hundreds of MILLIONS of children all over the world that don't own a toothbrush and, like myself, you probably had no idea there were so many! 

I knew that poor oral hygiene is directly related to devastating chronic illnesses, and other health problems, so I decided that I would help take on this huge global problem, like my 2 cousins had, but in a much bigger way.

(Sophia and Rody) 

With the help of your donations we are going to buy biodegradable toothbrushes for the very first time, through our very new, and very unique, organization. 

Operation Brush wants to change the lives of children around the world, and we need your help to help them! 

By making a donation you are helping to improve the lives of children. In addition to giving these children in need the ability to eat without pain, preventing the loss of teeth, and decreasing their chances of developing chronic illnesses caused by poor oral hygiene, we are improving their overall health and happiness with the help of your donation! 


            

It is easy to relate to a lot of charities you see out there in the world today, for example: almost everyone has, or knows someone that has battled some form of cancer. However in our case we have always owned a toothbrush, and everyone we have ever known has owned a toothbrush; so at first, this cause seems hard to understand. But when you really think about it, it's the easiest thing to understand, we've been brushing all our lives, multiple times a day! The reality unfortunately, is that most of the world doesn't see the devastating effects that poor oral hygiene has on individuals. 

This cause impacts the lives of children whose families unfortunately can't provide this basic need to them. 

Did You Know? 

Poor Oral Hygiene Is Directly Related To:

  • Heart disease (#1 cause of death worldwide)
  • Stroke
  • Miscarriage and premature birth
  • Diabetes
  • Memory loss (e.g. Alzheimer's disease)
  • Pneumonia and other lung diseases
  • Cancers of the: tongue, pancreas, kidney, blood, and lungs
    •

With your help, and together we can reduce these chronic illnesses that occur in children's lives.



We are looking to raise $3,500

The money will be used to buy (at a special discounted price) biodegradable toothbrushes. It will also help pay for the shipping expenses, get our accounting system in place to manage our finances, and pay for the application fee for the IRS tax exempt 501(c)(3) form.

Here is a break down of how the funds are distributed.


                                                            


As our way of thanking you, you will receive awesome perks for your donations! (Perks are listed on the top right.)

*All donation are tax-deductible* 

NEW PERK BELOW!!!  *Comes with all perks from $10 on*








NOTE: If you select one of the perks with a biodegradable toothbrush, we will be in contact with you to find out what size toothbrush you want. We have different sizes of toothbrushes for different size people. 



                                

We get asked a lot, "Why biodegradable instead of plastic?" That is a great question. 

The places that we will be distributing to often do not have recycling, and even live near their landfills in some cases. It is VERY important to us that we respect both their environment, and their community while helping solve this global poor oral hygiene problem.

In the United States alone an estimated 50 MILLION pounds of plastic from toothbrushes are thrown into landfills each year, and take up to 1,000 years to decompose. So by using biodegradable toothbrushes we help prevent further plastic pollution.

The biodegradable toothbrushes that we use are made from bamboo. This makes them a perfect fit because they are a natural antimicrobial, which means they fight off bacteria naturally! There are other great qualities of bamboo as well, like their ability to grow in nutrient poor soil, and they can grow up to a meter a day (that's over 3 feet!)

Here's a 24hr time lapse of bamboo growing, it truly is amazing how fast it can grow!




                                  

Like most big efforts, we face some challenges.

Because it is important to us that we primarily allocate all of our donations to buying and shipping toothbrushes, our organization, does not spend money to travel around the world to pass them out. This is a waste of money to us, when we can instead find individuals and organizations that are already in the locations to which we want to ship toothbrushes. So, the actual final step of handing the toothbrushes to the children poses a problem because we are not there ourselves to do so.

Therefore, We must located these individuals and organizations that are willing to help, and because these relationships won't last forever we are constantly looking for new outlets to help us distribute.  




                     

If you can't donate money, that is okay! 
You can help us by simply spreading the word! Let others know about our cause and why it is so important. The more people who know, the greater chance and opportunity we'll have to help change the lives of children around the world! 
For example you can: like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter! Or tattoo our logo on your arm. . . well, maybe that is too far, but you get the point. Spreading the word is very valuable to our mission to help the health of children around the world.

Thanks for reading and becoming apart of our mission! We greatly appreciate your support!

With your help, and together we can reduce these chronic illnesses that occur in children's lives.




We are looking to raise $3,500

The money will be used to buy (at a special discounted price) biodegradable toothbrushes. It will also help pay for the shipping expenses, get our accounting system in place to manage our finances, and pay for the application fee for the IRS tax exempt 501(c)(3) form.
Here is a break down of how the funds are distributed.



                                                            

As our way of thanking you, you will receive awesome perks for your donations! (Perks are listed on the top right.)
*All donation are tax-deductible* 





NEW PERK BELOW!!!  *Comes with all perks from $10 on*
















NOTE: If you select one of the perks with a biodegradable toothbrush, we will be in contact with you to find out what size toothbrush you want. We have different sizes of toothbrushes for different size people. 




                                

We get asked a lot, "Why biodegradable instead of plastic?" That is a great question. 
The places that we will be distributing to often do not have recycling, and even live near their landfills in some cases. It is VERY important to us that we respect both their environment, and their community while helping solve this global poor oral hygiene problem.
In the United States alone an estimated 50 MILLION pounds of plastic from toothbrushes are thrown into landfills each year, and take up to 1,000 years to decompose. So by using biodegradable toothbrushes we help prevent further plastic pollution.
The biodegradable toothbrushes that we use are made from bamboo. This makes them a perfect fit because they are a natural antimicrobial, which means they fight off bacteria naturally! There are other great qualities of bamboo as well, like their ability to grow in nutrient poor soil, and they can grow up to a meter a day (that's over 3 feet!)
Here's a 24hr time lapse of bamboo growing, it truly is amazing how fast it can grow!




                                  

Like most big efforts, we face some challenges.

Because it is important to us that we primarily allocate all of our donations to buying and shipping toothbrushes, our organization, does not spend money to travel around the world to pass them out. This is a waste of money to us, when we can instead find individuals and organizations that are already in the locations to which we want to ship toothbrushes. So, the actual final step of handing the toothbrushes to the children poses a problem because we are not there ourselves to do so.

Therefore, We must located these individuals and organizations that are willing to help, and because these relationships won't last forever we are constantly looking for new outlets to help us distribute.  




                      

If you can't donate money, that is okay! 
You can help us by simply spreading the word! Let others know about our cause and why it is so important. The more people who know, the greater chance and opportunity we'll have to help change the lives of children around the world! 

For example you can: like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter! Or tattoo our logo on your arm. . . well, maybe that is too far, but you get the point. Spreading the word is very valuable to our mission to help the health of children around the world.
Thanks for reading and becoming apart of our mission! We greatly appreciate your support!

story:
Our Story

Gail and I have been in the customer service industry for...well lets just say...more years than I want to count! We have known each other for over 15 years and very excited to open our new venture.

We are opening a Olive Oil and Vinegar tasting center with over 50 different Olive Oils and Balsamic Vinegars  to choose from. If you are unable to stop in our shop don't worry we will be selling all of our products on-line.

We didn't take this venture lightly. We have tested a lot of different types of oils and vinegars from different suppliers.  We believe we found the best. Not only is it fresh and healthy, but the taste is amazing! We want to share this experience with you! To prove we have the freshest product in the market, we will include the crush date on all of our olive oils.

Does the Color of the Olive Make a Difference?

Olives are essentially the same fruit, picked at different stages of ripening, with different colors at different stages of ripening. All olives start off green and as they grow and ripen, they will start to turn yellowish.  Next, they will turn red and then a deep purple, with an end stage of black and soft. The majority of olive oils are a blend of both green and black olives. This may not seem like much to most, but we are excited to know that only the freshest Olive Oil comes from Green Olives.

Green Olives tend to be firmer than the black juicer olives. Because of the green olives firmness, it simply takes more to produce a liter of oil than it does with black ones. Our product is produced from olives grown on large estates where the average time between picking and crushing is six hours. What does that mean for you? You get a product that is high in polyphenols (High Antioxidants) and very low FFA’s (Free Fatty Acids) and peroxide levels.

Olive Oil is Highly Perishable

No olive oil has a shelf life  more than 12 - 14 months. Packages that claim a “shelf life” of more than 12-14 months do not warn the consumer that the oil has deteriorated over time and is a shadow of its original shelf in terms of flavor and nutritional value.

As olive oil ages, it becomes softer and softer in flavor while the peroxide value rises (Peroxide value measures rancidity). Rancid Oil is a health hazard and many olive oils are rancid before they are ever purchased or consumed.

So, take our challenge! Grab your favorite oil and see if it provides the crush date?  No?  Then ask the manufacturer if they can or will provide that information to you.  Ask if they know long it has been sitting on their shelf? Don't forget to ask them how long the product was sitting in the warehouse before it was shipped to their market.

Don't worry, we will be transparent with all our products.

What if I don't live in West Lebanon, NH? 

We realize some people may not live in or near West Lebanon, NH and are questioning why should I help a business so far away?  Well in short, we are the "Live Free or Die" state or as we so dearly call it, Live, Freeze and Die state.  What that means for you is NO SALES TAX on any purchases. The price you see is the price you pay. Besides we are good people.   We want to provide not only the best products, but also we excel at customer service. With all our products we will have a 100% guarantee.

 We plan on letting all our customers know what the crush dates are, the Polyphenols (Healthy Antioxidants), Oleic Acid (a healthy Monounsaturated Omega-9 Fatty Acid), FFA (Acidity), Peroxide Value (PV), PPP Score - This score was developed to measure the degradation of chlorophyll in olive oil and DAGS – This is a new measurement of overall quality, condition of fruit & processing.

What do we Need?


Our store will be opening August 1, 2014 in the Powerhouse Mall in West Lebanon, NH. While we have the money for our product, we need your help with the renovations. We are able to start all renovations on the 1st of July, but the place needs a lot of work.  The space we are leasing was a 1084 sq foot clothing store and not set up for sale of what is considered a "food" product.

What will the 15,000 support? 

A lot of construction starting July 1st! Yup, that is the soonest we can start our renovations. Your support will help us....

  • Tearing out the dressing rooms
  • Patching and painting all the walls and trim (help us make the choices see stain options below)
  • Removal of carpet
  • Refinishing the concrete floors, including a sander, because we are not sure what we will find under the carpet (help us make the choices see stain options below)
  • Painting supplies - For the Walls, Trim and Floors (yes, the floors are a stain)
  • Purchase of three bay sink
  • Plumbing of kitchen
We will be provide weekly updates on where we are in our much appreciated help from you, including all the votes . The updates will be on this site and Facebook.

Our stretch goal is 100,000 

This will allow us to open the way we want.  Instead of opening with a staggered phase-in for the products we wish to have available to our customers, it would be great to go full guns with all of it.  Lets face it, although we can make cutting boards, we are not builders, plumbers, nor electricians! We know our strengths, and for these projects we should leave them to the professionals. (Don't believe us ask my husband and Gail's fiance!)
  • Move the electrical on the back wall
  • Create door for small kitchen access
  • Purchase refrigerator for kitchen
  • Rack for pans/mixing bowls etc
  • Induction oven for food tastings
  •  Plumbing for three bay sink
  • Purchase of freezer (for our frozen infused pastas)
  • Purchase of refrigerator unit (for natural infused water, cheeses)
  • Displays for the oils and vinegars (looking at alternatives as the first quote we received was 15,000)
  • Display for wine rack
  • Initial order for wines, and cheeses
  • Initial order for pastas (think fresh, high-quality ingredients made in small batches and of course infused with natural flavors. We will be supplying traditional Italian pasta, nutritional pasta, low-carb pasta, and gluten-free)
  • Education: We will be going to California for two days on product training.  And while there for our training, will be interviewing natural pasta companies/distributors to determine the best we can find for our store in the Infused Pasta's and Sauces.  We are also looking at a week course to receive our Olive Oil Quality Assurance Certificate from the International Olive Oil School.


The Perks

You are a very important part of our success in making our dreams come true. Fear not, regardless of whether we achieve our goal, we do have our product secured and will fulfill our commitment to our supporters. We anticipate the perks will be shipped by the first week of Aug. The only exception would be our baskets options.  These are designed for people to take the guess work out of holidays and birthdays.


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to financially contribute to the campaign. You can still play a role by sharing this link on Facebook, twitter, instagram, and other social media platforms

Thank you for all your support and we look forward to seeing everyone at our new store.

We really appreciate the time you have taken to view our campaign.

Gail and Jen

story:
Hi, my name is David Parke, father, film technician, recreation student and outdoor enthusiast. I also volunteer for Vancouver Coastal Health and Interfit adaptive hiking for the disabled. As the result of a tragic mountain bike accident in June 2010, I am an incomplete quadriplegic.

Years of rehabilitation helped me realize the need to support organizations like Spinal Cord Injury BC. The need for support and improve the lives of people with spinal cord injuries continues to grow. 


Funds raised on Indiegogo will enable my bicycle fundraiser from Whitehorse, Yukon to Vancouver, B.C. this June 2014. The goal for fundraising for Spinal Cord injury BC on the bike ride is to raise $50,000. 

If we don't achieve the funds to facilitate the bicycle ride, all funds will go to Spinal Cord Injury BC. It's a win-win situation. All contributions are helpful,  by sharing this link with friends and family if money isn't an option.

Help me to help others build accessible communities and achieve their goals. 

Let's share this experience and make a difference. 


The difference is you. 

Thank-you for your support.

story:
Wait, quidditch?

That's right - the game from Harry Potter. Adapted by Middlebury College students in 2005, Quidditch is now played at over 300 universities and high schools in the United States and 12 other countries.

Learn more here at the official IQA website!

And...College of Charleston?

The College of Charleston is the oldest university in the United States, but we here at CofC like to keep it fresh - we jumped on board the quidditch train in 2009. Although the College does not officially recognize us as a sport or even a club sport, we infuse our playing with equal doses of serious competition and good humor - which, come on, is how all quidditch should be played.

Learn more about the College of Charleston Quidditch Team on our Facebook page!

Why should I help?

As previously mentioned, CofC Quidditch is not officially recognized by our university as a club sport or sport. This means that what little funding we have received from the College for this year has already been spent - on new t-shirts and travel to the South Regionals Tournament last weekend.
 
Unlike college teams to the north and south of us - we're looking at you baddasses, Middlebury, Boston, Miami, Ringling - quidditch is not taken quite so seriously here in Charleston. We have fundraised tirelessly. We have spent hours upon hours handcrafting snitch-shaped Christmas ornaments. We have sacrificed official jerseys for marketable t-shirts. While some teams run around in school-funded uniforms, we make do with home-made brooms and mostly-deflated balls.
 
While we have been to World Cups in the past, they have been entirely self-funded. This year, CofC Quidditch is composed almost entirely both of freshman who are just beginning to adjust to their college lives and seniors on the team who must think ahead to beyond graduation when making their plans for World Cup VI. This means that self-funding the trip to the World Cup is probably not going to be possible. As much as it kills us to, we need to ask you for help.

Can I see you guys actually play and stuff?

Why yes, you can!

  • http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lJUyZoin578
  • View more videos here.

Okay, so what exactly do you need?

To be quite honest, we need anything we can get, but we're aiming for about $600. There are 21 of us on the travel team. We don't need plane tickets; we all plan to drive down to Kissimmee since we're already in the South. Any funds you donate to our cause will go toward hotel rates in Florida and gas to get our cars there and back.

We understand if you cannot spare even a dollar to help us on our way to Florida in April - please, though, do not hesitate to share this page with everyone you know. TELL EVERYONE - your Facebooks, your Tumblrs, your Twittererers, your Instagramlies, I dunno.

Seriously, every little bit helps, and our team - our graduating seniors, especially - will be eternally grateful for your dedication to the growing sport of quidditch and the tenacity of Harry Potter fans everywhere.


XOXO
- CofC Quidditch

story:
The Race
I got offered a spot to compete in the Mongol Derby 2012! For those of you that don't know, this is a 10 day horse race in August 2012 across outer Mongolia. We'll be riding the semi-wild horses of the Mongolian nomads on the same route the Huns "pony express" followed.

Here's an excerpt taken off the race's website:

"The Mongol Derby is the longest, toughest horse race in the world. It's the Khaan's mother of equine adventures, a 1000 km multi-horse race across the epic wilderness of the Mongolian steppe. Its mammoth network of horse stations is a recreation of Chinggis Khaan's legendary empire-busting postal system."

We'll be riding for 12 hours or more a day depending on what we can handle. Navigating across Mongolia through rain, swollen rivers and mountains...we will be switching out horses two to three times a day at urttus along the way. We will be camping at night with either just our horse of the moment or with the Mongolian nomads and eating whatever they are cooking for dinner. I'm thinking I should get Pepto Bismol to be a sponsor...

There will be a live tracker so my family/friends/sponsors can be a part of the adventure. Looks like there will also be satellite stations at some points along the race for riders to upload video/photos. I cant wait to share my experiences hanging with the nomads and wild horses with everyone.

Here's the race's official website if you'd like to read more on it.
http://www.theadventurists.com/the-adventures/m...

Why?
For those of you that are asking "why" well basically I asked myself the same thing, why would I want to compete in this insane race? The answer came in the form of a question, What am I really doing that's challenging myself at the current moment? "The same ol same ol" becomes the everyday and without even realizing it you get stuck into a routine where it becomes auto pilot.  I feel that once you become comfortable in life, you stop growing as an individual -- e.g., learning new skills, having the ability to adapt to a new environment, you lose the excitement for adventure and life in general. I want to put myself in an uncomfortable position and in turn, challenge the skills that I have already acquired. Maybe more importantly for me, I will have to face one of the biggest challenges yet, being a world away from home, with a prominent language barrier, living with/relying on a nomadic people and instead of relying on my car to get me from place to place, I will be relying solely on the horses of the steppes to carry me 650 miles to my destination....the finish line!

The Impact
They only pick about 35 riders to compete from hundreds of applicants from around the world. Of this 35, only a few are American. This is some crazy adventure but it's also a race for charity.

The current official charity of the race is Mercy Corps Mongolia, who run economic development projects in rural Mongolia, helping herders access markets, business expertise and each other, to secure a sustainable and meaningful livelihood.

You can check out this special video showing how the funds raised for the Mercy Corps are used in Mongolia. http://youtu.be/NH83iiWclco

Each rider picks a charity they are racing for as well. I will be racing for The Children's Scholarship Fund. The Children's Scholarship Fund aims to maximize educational opportunity for all children: for those in need by offering tuition assistance in grades K-8 for alternatives to faltering conventional schools, and for all children by supporting and cultivating education reform and parental choice efforts across the United States.


You can check out their official website here:
http://www.scholarshipfund.org/drupal1/

Horse Sense
I grew up riding on a horse farm in Missouri, so I learned at a young age how to connect with the horse. Learning how to ride a horse bareback and at high speeds heightened my awareness of equine movement and behavior as there were no saddle/stirrups to aid in keeping balance nor saddle horn to hang onto when things got rough. This dance of the horse and rider will be an integral part of my survival in the race. As a rider I also have to be submissive to a horses instincts, especially the ones that tell him to avoid the marmot holes (there are a lot of those in Mongolia) that could break his leg!

Through some research and help from friends, I was able to track down and connect with 2 previous Americans who competed in the Mongol Derby before.  Kat Swigart of California and Sophia Mangalee of New Jersey.  Conventiently enough I was living in Los Angeles at the time I got in contact with Kat (I lived about 2 hours away from her) and ended up getting the opportunity to train with her on her awesome Thouroughbred and Arabian endurance race horses.  I got a ton of advice from her in regards to the race and what to bring/expect.  Then I moved back to NYC and got in contact with Sophia and got her perspective, she was nice enough to come with me and advise me on what gear I would need/would not need from her own experience.


What I Need
The entry fee for the race is super expensive, like $10,000 expensive!! The plane ticket to get me to Mongolia is $2,500. I've already raised/paid $7,500 of the entry fee.  Right now I still need $2,500 for the plane ticket, $2,500 for my last installment in the entry and $2,000 still to go towards my chosen charities.

Im seeking corporate/private sponsors as well to both sponsor me monetarily as well as provide me with the special gear Ill need for the race, such as riding boots, compass, thermal weather proof riding apparel, lite-weight sleeping gear, small durable cameras, camelbak M.U.L.E ect.

I will be featuring my sponsors both on my Rider Profile Page, my Derby Facebook page and in press materials. For those that send me adhesives I will wear their logos throughout the race as well.

Other Ways You Can Help
SPREAD THE WORD MY FRIENDS! Send your friends on over to the following:

This page: 

My Rider Profile Page on FB (have them like it) and follow my training progress:
http://www.facebook.com/ErikCooper4MongolDerby2012

CONTACT ME
Id love to hear from you, answer any questions you have, and keep you posted!
ERIKJAMESCOOPER@GMAIL.COM

We will be camping at night with either just our horse of the moment or with the Mongolian nomads and eating whatever they are cooking for dinner. I'm thinking I should get Pepto Bismol to be a sponsor...
There will be a live tracker so my family/friends/sponsors can be a part of the adventure. Looks like there will also be satellite stations at some points along the race for riders to upload video/photos. I cant wait to share my experiences hanging with the nomads and wild horses with everyone.
Here's the race's official website if you'd like to read more on it.http://www.theadventurists.com/the-adventures/m...
Why?For those of you that are asking "why" well basically I asked myself the same thing, why would I want to compete in this insane race? The answer came in the form of a question, What am I really doing that's challenging myself at the current moment? "The same ol same ol" becomes the everyday and without even realizing it you get stuck into a routine where it becomes auto pilot.  I feel that once you become comfortable in life, you stop growing as an individual -- e.g., learning new skills, having the ability to adapt to a new environment, you lose the excitement for adventure and life in general. I want to put myself in an uncomfortable position and in turn, challenge the skills that I have already acquired. Maybe more importantly for me, I will have to face one of the biggest challenges yet, being a world away from home, with a prominent language barrier, living with/relying on a nomadic people and instead of relying on my car to get me from place to place, I will be relying solely on the horses of the steppes to carry me 650 miles to my destination....the finish line!
The ImpactThey only pick about 35 riders to compete from hundreds of applicants from around the world. Of this 35, only a few are American. This is some crazy adventure but it's also a race for charity.
The current official charity of the race is Mercy Corps Mongolia, who run economic development projects in rural Mongolia, helping herders access markets, business expertise and each other, to secure a sustainable and meaningful livelihood.
You can check out this special video showing how the funds raised for the Mercy Corps are used in Mongolia. http://youtu.be/NH83iiWclco
Each rider picks a charity they are racing for as well. I will be racing for The Children's Scholarship Fund. The Children's Scholarship Fund aims to maximize educational opportunity for all children: for those in need by offering tuition assistance in grades K-8 for alternatives to faltering conventional schools, and for all children by supporting and cultivating education reform and parental choice efforts across the United States.
You can check out their official website here:http://www.scholarshipfund.org/drupal1/
Horse SenseI grew up riding on a horse farm in Missouri, so I learned at a young age how to connect with the horse. Learning how to ride a horse bareback and at high speeds heightened my awareness of equine movement and behavior as there were no saddle/stirrups to aid in keeping balance nor saddle horn to hang onto when things got rough. This dance of the horse and rider will be an integral part of my survival in the race. As a rider I also have to be submissive to a horses instincts, especially the ones that tell him to avoid the marmot holes (there are a lot of those in Mongolia) that could break his leg!
Through some research and help from friends, I was able to track down and connect with 2 previous Americans who competed in the Mongol Derby before.  Kat Swigart of California and Sophia Mangalee of New Jersey.  Conventiently enough I was living in Los Angeles at the time I got in contact with Kat (I lived about 2 hours away from her) and ended up getting the opportunity to train with her on her awesome Thouroughbred and Arabian endurance race horses.  I got a ton of advice from her in regards to the race and what to bring/expect.  Then I moved back to NYC and got in contact with Sophia and got her perspective, she was nice enough to come with me and advise me on what gear I would need/would not need from her own experience.
What I NeedThe entry fee for the race is super expensive, like $10,000 expensive!! The plane ticket to get me to Mongolia is $2,500. I've already raised/paid $7,500 of the entry fee.  Right now I still need $2,500 for the plane ticket, $2,500 for my last installment in the entry and $2,000 still to go towards my chosen charities.
Im seeking corporate/private sponsors as well to both sponsor me monetarily as well as provide me with the special gear Ill need for the race, such as riding boots, compass, thermal weather proof riding apparel, lite-weight sleeping gear, small durable cameras, camelbak M.U.L.E ect.
I will be featuring my sponsors both on my Rider Profile Page, my Derby Facebook page and in press materials. For those that send me adhesives I will wear their logos throughout the race as well.
Other Ways You Can HelpSPREAD THE WORD MY FRIENDS! Send your friends on over to the following:
This page: 
My Rider Profile Page on FB (have them like it) and follow my training progress:http://www.facebook.com/ErikCooper4MongolDerby2012
CONTACT MEId love to hear from you, answer any questions you have, and keep you posted!ERIKJAMESCOOPER@GMAIL.COM

story:
Our Little Miracle; Isaac

After 5 years of fertility treatments, my wife and I decided to stop all treatments and leave it in God's hands. To our SURPRISE, 5 months later we found out we were pregnant, after being told for 5 years that we would NEVER concieve on our own.

Our son, Isaac, has always been on the GO! He started fully independant walking by 9 months, and by 11 months he was running everywhere.  We always joked that it was a miracle that he hadn't broke a bone or needed stitches yet.

Last year, 2012, we flew through the year with out using our insurance deductible, so we decided we would drop our insurance down for 2013 and save money. Two weeks into 2013, we took our at the time 22 month old back to the dentist for his 6month check up, where we found out that he had the start of "bottle rot" (He has never had a bottle). We had to have a flouride treatment done, and we were told that we would need to come back in 3 months for another. If it progressed, he'd need to have surgery to clean the decay out and possibly pull/replace some of the teeth.  We were DEVASTATED. Just 6 months before, we were advised by the dentist that the little brown spots on his teeth were mineral staining from his vitamin drops.

In February, we took Isaac for his 2 year well child check up, where his doctor was concerned about the lack of sleep he gets because he's up all night with tummy pain. So she sent him for blood work to check for Chron's, Celiac.....which was $427.00.

March 23rd, Isaac was running through the house in socks, when he slipped and fell into the splits. He couldn't put any weight on the leg when he got up so we went to the ER. Turns out, he got a spiral fracture in the femur on the left leg which required surgery and he's now in a Spica cast (a cast around his rib cage, that goes down to the ankle of the broken leg and down to the knee of his other leg).

Our portion so far for the ER visit, Xrays, Er doctors, and surgery is just a bit over $3,000.  We haven't seen the bill yet for the Ortho at the Er, the orthopedic doctor who did the surgery, Anesthesia, etc. Apri 17th, we go back to the dentist for another flouride treatment and for a surgery consult. We're told there will be 4 more ortho office visits, at least 2 more sets of xrays, and the cast removal.

 So we're asking for some help as we don't have the ability to pay for the bills and we don't want to not pay the doctors when they're working on our little boy.

How you can help

 

If you were able to contribute even a small amount, that would help us out and possibly keep our heads above water. 

If you're unable to help financially, we'd love it if you could help us share our campaign and keep Isaac in your prayers.

 

Perks:

$50 -

For this level of donation, we'd like to send you one of our homemade dolls (patterns by Dolls & Daydreams). You can pick from one shown below or we can make you a custom one with different colors or accessories.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

$100 - 

If you donate $100 or more, we'd like to send you a custom name pillow. similar to this (your choice of name and colors) :

story:
Meet Hillary Plummer!

I would like to introduce you to Hillary Plummer! She is the most amazing person I've ever known, her charismatic smile and positive energy is unrivaled, nothing has ever brought her down even in the toughest of times. She is an amazing character that brings life and excitement everywhere she goes. She loves dogs and perfumes and is always trying to get people to try something new. She is a one of a kind character with a big heart and a genuine concern for others. 

The Accident -

On Sunday December 9 Hillary was having problems with her insulin pump and she was vomiting all foods and liquids. On Monday December 10, she missed work and thank god her work called her mother to check in. She had passed out on her kitchen floor and her blood sugar was dangerously high. Had her mother not checked in with her we would be without Hillary today. Because her blood sugar was over 1800, she experienced Diabetic Ketoacidosis.

Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) is a potentially life-threatening complication in patients with diabetes mellitus. DKA results from a shortage of insulin; in response the body switches to burning fatty acids and producing acidic ketone bodies that cause most of the symptoms and complications. Hillary slipped into a coma sometime on Sunday and is fighting for her life!  Please send us your prayers! Updates will be posted as we find out more information.

What is needed -

All donations will go directly to Hillary’s medical expenses and support in her time of need. It's as simple as that. Her hospital cost will easily exceed $30,000. This is just an amount to start to aid them in their need of support. Anything and everything we raise for them will greatly help.

For those that feel helpless in such a tough situation even the smallest donation will help. I realize we all wish we could do more, but for now this is a way how you can immediately support Hillary and her family like no other.

Other Ways You Can Help -

Even if you are unable to contribute at this time, please help Hillary out by sharing this fundraiser and getting the word out of his story. Thank you all so very much. I know she appreciates you all.

story:
• WE INTRODUCE TO YOU SPECULOO WONDER SPREAD, INFUSED WITH THAT FAMOUS DELICIOUS COOKIE FROM EUROPE TO CREATE A SWEET, SAVORY, INTENSE AND MOUTH WATERING FLAVOR WITHOUT BEING TOO SWEET!

WONDER SPREAD is locally made with love and purpose. Each jar is infused with Speculoo cookies and mixed with a blend of savory and flavorful ingredients. The spread will melt in your mouth with goodness. #WonderSpread #Delicious #Yummy #MustEat

 

WHO WE ARE AND ABOUT WONDER SPREAD

     The name of Wonder Spread originated from our oldest daughter named Zoey, who is 7yrs old. We were having a taste testing in our kitchen and she was one of our first tasters. And believe me, she was NOT a willing participant. My wife still laughs when I tell this story. I asked Zoey into the kitchen and told her that mommy and daddy had made a new peanut butter like spread. Immediately, she had the look of horror on her face and her eyes was looking for the nearest exit. I firmly asked her to sit down and asked her to taste our new recipe.

     She sat down reluctantly and I said, "Ok Zoey. Tell me what you think." She replied, "Nah, I'm good." I tried to be sneaky and spoon feed her a small amount but she was just fast enough to have her right cheek smeared with the spread. Slowly getting frustrated and anxious to hear her opinion, I decided, the best option was bribery. I told her, "Zoey, if you try alittle bit, I will buy you something from Target." Suddenly, Zoey turned to me and with a soft voice replied, "Yes, papa". I continued, "If you try this for papa, I will buy you something really nice at Target." Zoey jumped up and out of her chair and said excited, "REALLY! A SCOOTER!". Then I replied reluctantly and mumbled under my breath, "Yes. A scooter". She reached for the spoon and tasted the spread.

     Suddenly, a smirk formed on her face which turned into a big smile and she said, "This is WONDERFUL! OMG! I WONDER what you guys made this stuff out of." Then she surprisingly reached over to the table and took another big spoonful and devoured it whole. She turned to us and said "Good job Papa. Good job Momma. It's so yummy. Could you pack my lunch for tommorrow with that stuff. By the way, are we going to Target now?"

     When we returned from Target, Zoey said, "Papa, that yummy stuff that I tried earlier, why don't you call it WONDER SPREAD. Cuz when you try it and it tastes so yummy, you WONDER what it is made of. Since that moment, Zoey has been active in all aspects of Wonder Spread. She always asks me, "Hey Papa, how's my business doing?" You can't imagine how much pride a father can have until you have experienced that moment when two loves collide: the love of your daughter and the love for business.

    We believe without a doubt that Wonder Spread is the most delicious, savory and most mouth watering spread that you ever tasted because of it's sweet, savory, slightly carmelized flavor perfectly balanced so that it is not to sweet.

ZOEY URQUICO 7YR OLD WONDER KID

 

IT'S HARD TO EXPLAIN HOW DELICIOUS WONDER SPREAD IS SO WE DECIDED TO LET YOU READ THE FEEDBACK FROM MANY OF THE PEOPLE WHO HAVE TRIED IT:


 

WE NEED YOUR HELP AND SUPPORT

Thank you for being here! Mad love from Team Wonder Spread (Raxajack Urquico, Anabeth Urquico & Zoey) -- we are truly excited to launch Wonder Spread on Indiegogo. 

We've been working hard to make this happen for the last year and now need to raise a minimum of $10,000 to complete our next batch of Wonder Spread, payment of required licenses (USDA)/permits and the most expensive cost which is the vacuum sealing machine using induction cap sealing technology.* If we are able to beat our minimum goal, we can make more Wonder Spread and really grow this movement together. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for being a part of this with us!

 

*FOR ALL YOU TECHIES: INDUCTION CAP SEALING TECHNOLOGY

Most of all the major food manufacturers use this technology to place their Sealer on their products. The sealer is highly suitable for keeping your product hermetically sealed, tamper evident, maintian freshness, free from oxidation and contamination, sealed for consumer confidence, leak and evaporation resistant.

 

WARNING: Once you have tasted Wonder Spread, you may not be able to stop eating it. Spread it on everything. You're gonna LOVE it!

REASONS TO EAT WONDER SPREAD

1.) IT'S SO YUMMY! You can put it on everything! It makes food pop with flavor!

PANCAKES
BREAD
CHOCOLATE
BANANA
MUFFINS
DARE WE SAY IT TASTES AMAZING ON CELERY!
APPLE ANYONE

       You can put it on anything or

         just eat it by itself. It's that good.

 

  • HOW DO PEOPLE LOOK AFTER THEY EAT WONDER SPREAD

 

 

2.) NO NUTS. People who are allergic to peanut butter can eat Wonder Spread.

FOOD ALLERGIES
WILL SMITH FOOD ALLERGY FROM HITCH

 

3.) WE DON'T USE ANIMAL PRODUCTS . WE ARE VEGAN APPROVED. We use absolutely no animal products!

VEGAN APPROVED
ANIMAL APPROVED

 

OUR COMPANY MOTTO:

1.) THE ONE TASTE WONDER.

2.) ONE TASTE AND YOU WONDER WHAT THE HECK IT IS.

3.) WONDER SPREAD IS SO GOOD TO EAT WITH WONDER BREAD.

DISCLAIMER: We do not claim to any relationship or association with Wonder Bread. The above comment is just a personal opinion of a Wonder Spread fan that Wonder Spread and Wonder Bread taste good together. We do not claim any ownership of the name Wonder Bread or any copyrights. They are properties of their respective owners.

 

REWARDS


THANK YOU EVERYONE FROM OUR FAMILY. PLEASE HELP US REACH OUR GOAL OF SHARING WONDER SPREAD TO THE WORLD BY CHOOSING TO DONATE. WE WILL GIVE YOU A GIFT AS DESCRIBED IN THE REWARDS AREA. GOD BLESS.

story:
Sex Worker Appreciation Day Community Picnic

Sunday July 21st, 2013 marks the first annual Sex Worker Appreciation Day! This day will be dedicated to expressing love, care and gratitude to all sex workers for all the hard and stigimitized work they do.

In honor of this day the SF Bay Area's local chapter of SWOP (Sex Workers Outreach Project) will be joining forces with other local organizations to create the very first Sex Worker Appreciation Day Community Picnic.

This family-friendly event is geared to celebrate those working in the sex industry, bringing together sex workers, friends, family and allies for a day of food, fun and special prizes.

Where the funds are going

  • Mosswood Park reservation $75
  • Mosswood Park deposit      $75
  • Bounce house rental        $100
  • Bounce permit            $50-$75
  • Food and drink               $150

If we don't reach our entire goal the funds will still go directly to making this event a success. Surplus funds will be used to provide special games and prizes for youngsters. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page with your friends!
  • Donate food, drink and perks!
  • Join us at the park!
