story:
Hi,

I just turned 18 and recently graduated from high school. I'm upgrading right now and taking a few health courses needed to help secure my acceptance at our local institute of technology. I also work part-time to help pay for my transportation and school.

 

My dad passed away when I was 3 so it's been my mom & I for awhile now. She has always managed to make sure I got everything I needed plus a little bit more at times.

 

These past few years have been really tough though as my mom got really sick and couldn't keep herself out of the hospital. She had to quit her job and go on disability. I remember one summer she was admitted into the hospital almost every 2 weeks for 3 months straight.

 

She ended up having 3 major surgeries over the next few years to try and keep her stable and out of the hospital. It worked for the most part but she is still really weak most of the time and stuck at home. She feels bad that she can't work and provide more.

 

Our medical is covered, thank goodness and my dental is covered until I am 24. My mom isn't working so she has no dental coverage. She tries to take care of her teeth but hasn't been able to afford any dental care for years and is in desperate need for some now, before it is too late.

 

She recently had a molar tooth pulled out because she couldn't afford to fix it properly and it was causing so much pain. I also just found out that she has 4 more molars that need serious work done or she'll have to get them pulled as well.

 

We just don't have anyone to ask for help and she is too young and has gone through too much to lose anymore teeth. I have to try as best I can to raise some money.

 

Please donate if you can, any amount is appreciated and if you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
Hi,
I just turned 18 and recently graduated from high school. I'm upgrading right now and taking a few health courses needed to help secure my acceptance at our local institute of technology. I also work part-time to help pay for my transportation and school.
 
My dad passed away when I was 3 so it's been my mom & I for awhile now. She has always managed to make sure I got everything I needed plus a little bit more at times.
 
These past few years have been really tough though as my mom got really sick and couldn't keep herself out of the hospital. She had to quit her job and go on disability. I remember one summer she was admitted into the hospital almost every 2 weeks for 3 months straight.
 
She ended up having 3 major surgeries over the next few years to try and keep her stable and out of the hospital. It worked for the most part but she is still really weak most of the time and stuck at home. She feels bad that she can't work and provide more.
 
Our medical is covered, thank goodness and my dental is covered until I am 24. My mom isn't working so she has no dental coverage. She tries to take care of her teeth but hasn't been able to afford any dental care for years and is in desperate need for some now, before it is too late.
 
She recently had a molar tooth pulled out because she couldn't afford to fix it properly and it was causing so much pain. I also just found out that she has 4 more molars that need serious work done or she'll have to get them pulled as well. 
 
We just don't have anyone to ask for help and she is too young and has gone through too much to lose anymore teeth. I have to try as best I can to raise some money. 
 
Please donate if you can, any amount is appreciated and if you have any questions please feel free to contact me.
 
Thank you!

story:
*Short Summary*

Anna-Maria suffers from Rett Syndrome, a rare neurological disease. Since Macedonia has no center for children with rare neurological diseases, she stays at home and unfortunatelly does not receive any treatment, although she is in urgent need of daily exercises with physical therapist and special education teacher. Because of seizures, inability to use her hands she's wearing a diapers. Because her inability to eat and drink by herlself, partial inability to move on her own, she needs constant accompaniment. I (her mother) and her father are trying to provide gluten-free foods and dietary supplements that in Macedonia are very expensive, and we are not quite able to do so.

*What We Need & What You Get*

You will help to provide physical therapy at home and daily work with special education teacher as well as constant companion who will keep and take care of Anna-Maria while we are at work.
All this is not very expensive taken in our standards, but unfortunatelly we are not able to provide it - it takes no more than 600 USD per month.
You will take part in returning childs life to "normal" frames, although we don't want to use the word normal.  

 

*The Impact*

The Rett syndrome is really rear and there's no cure for it, only improvements. Children facing this rare syndrome deserve better life, and Anna-Maria is only one of them.

*Other Ways You Can Help*

Dear supporters, use your Facebook and Twitter accounts for spreading the word. We are hear waiting for your help. Thank You from family Vlastimirovi.

this is our twitter account: https://twitter.com/RettAngel_AnaM - please follow us

online petition: http://www.change.org/petitions/ana-marija-vlastimirova-rett-girl-11-years-old-from-macedonia-daily-physical-therapy-special-education-teacher-and-speech-therapist

                THANK YOU *ФАЛА*

story:
We are raising money to help launch our new product line for kids: KUTOA Kids Squares.

 

KUTOA, meaning "to give" in Swahili, is the central focus of what we do. At KUTOA™, our mission is to empower change by giving the most fundamental need for happiness and prosperity – health.

For every KUTOA bar that is sold, we donate and deliver a nutrition pack to a child in need. We believe every child deserves the opportunity for a healthy, happy and prosperous life. By providing children in need with basic nutritional needs, we hope to help give them this opportunity.

 

KUTOA™ Health Bars are currently handrcafted in three delicious flavors: Blueberry Almond, Cherry Cashew, Chocolate Banana, and Peanut Butter + Jelly (NEW!).

Additionally, in an effort to minimize waste, we wrap our delicious bars in 100% recyclable polypropylene.

At KUTOA™ we believe that eating an all-natural diet is the key to maintaining a healthy lifestyle. This is why we have gone to such great lengths to ensure that all of our ingredients adhere to the highest nutritional standards. KUTOA is currently found in natural food stores nationwide and in other health conscious workplaces, such as Apple and Facebook.

 

Kids Squares are our new and natural product line for kids! Kids Squares will provide a healthy and delicious snack for youngsters to enjoy! As always, for every kids square you buy, we give a nutrition pack to a child in need.

Kids helping kids! How cool is that?!

The squares will be:

With the funding from Indiegogo, we are aiming to launch three delicious flavors!

At KUTOA™, our delicious, all-natural bars are only half of the equation. We are working to benefit World Food Program USA and support World Food Program’s manufacturing and delivery of nutrition packets to children in need. The World Food Program currently operates in 75 countries and works on the front lines, providing emergency food aid in times of crisis as well as providing long-term sustainable solutions to hunger. In 2011, they reached more than 90 million people with food assistance in more than 70 countries. For every KUTOA™ bar that is sold, we donate and deliver a nutrition pack to a child in need. The nutrition packs are filled with the vitamins, minerals and micro-nutrients essential for maintaining bodily functions, growth, immunity, productivity, and prevention of mortality among vulnerable populations. They are delivered to severely malnourished children between the ages of 6 and 59 months and effectively alleviate malnutrition and the long list of awful diseases that coincide.

Did you know...

When you purchase a KUTOA™ Health Bar, you are not only making a health-conscious decision in your own life, you are also giving health to a child in need. The health you give this child will empower them to live a healthy life, go to school, and become a contributing member of their community.

 

 

 

Not only do our givers get our eternal gratitude, but they also have the chance to try the new product line that they helped fund and snag some specially made KUTOA™ apparel! 

 

Over the last year, we have delivered and committed tens of thousands of nutrition packs and bars to children in need, both domestically and abroad. The way that we see it, this is still not enough.

It is our goal to distribute 200,000 nutrition packs in 2013.

While childhood malnutrition is a chronic problem in the developing world, children in our own communities are suffering from obesity and poor dietary choice. There are very few healthy snacks that are delicious and exciting for children. For this reason, we conceived of a product line that allows parents to buy a healthy product for their children, and in doing so, provide a life-saving nutrition pack to a child across the world. This means expanding our product line to include a fun, exciting format that suits the palette and caloric needs of children. Funding this expansion is no small feat, though, and that's where your support comes in! Now that you see the big picture, we hope you will help us spread health to children near and far.

Thank you,

Your Friends at KUTOA™

story:
We believe that everyone should be afforded the opportunity to truly harness their cognitive potential in a safe, legal, and cost-effective manner. While a wealth of information is present on how to eat and best maintain a state of health for our bodies, very little information is widespread on how to best nurture the brain for maximum output and long-term efficiency. The world of nootropics has increasingly made this goal more realizable. To truly harness the potential of cognitive supplements, one must be thoroughly educated and up-to-date in the field in a manner that involves ordering numerous independent supplements and having to weigh and portion them out in capsules themselves - or turn over a significant sum of money for pre-made complete blends. 

Metatropics was created out of our desire to use the shared knowledge of this field to continuously create what we believe to be the most ideal blends to support brain function using scientifically-backed information, in a way that is both convenient and affordable. To begin our journey, we need $1500 to purchase all the necessary bulk and ingredients and packaging materials.

Signature Blend

So what exactly is in our blend? We are starting with a single balanced base blend that will be the most beneficial to the widest selection of users, while we have many blends in the works for the future. All of the ingredients in our blends are not merely supplements of anecdotal success, but scientifically studied and proven to be safe and effective.  Once the Metatropics website is live, we will have an entire section dedicated towards learning about nootropics and all of the individual ingredients involved. This will be complete with multiple peer-reviewed journal studies for each element of the blend.

Our first blend will be divided into two parts, one daily component and another that can be re-dosed multiple times, every 4-5 hours or when necessary. The daily component will contain: 

  • CDP-Choline, 350mg (precursor to acetylcholine - a neurotransmitter linked to learning and attention, as well as increases white matter density in the brain here)
  • Phosphatidylserine 20%, 200mg (reduces calculation time on cognitive tests here)
  • DMAE, 200mg (precursor to acetylcholine, has been shown to increase 'vigilance and attention' here)
  • L-Theanine, 150mg (increase alpha wave brain activity linked to sustained attention here)
  • Ginkgo Biloba, 250mg (improves speed of information processing, working memory and executive processing here)
  • Ginseng, 250mg (improves robust  working memory here)
  • Bacopa Monnieri, 300mg (evidence for improvement of free memory recall here)
  • Rhodiola Rosea, 500mg (boosts brain activity in the frontal lobe during cognitive and emotional challenges here)
  • Ashwagandha, 500mg (increase cognitive and psychomotor function here)
  • N-Acetyl-L-Tyrosine, 500mg (precursor for the neurotransmitter dopamine, improves working memory during demanding tasks here)
  • Pregnenolone, 20mg (neurosteroid involved in learning and memory processes here)
  • Vinpocetine 99%, 10mg (increases blood flow within brain and improves memory here)
  • Royal Jelly, 500mg (full of B vitamins, amino acids, and fatty acids - also shown to increase growth of neuronal projections here)
The re-dosable blend will contain:
  • Aniracetam, 500mg (selectively increases conductance of AMPA receptors involved in short and long-term memory here)
  • Noopept, 12mg (increases proteins that allow the brain to restore and produce more neurons and axons here)
  • Sulbutiamine, 250mg (More bioavailable form of thiamine, which is shown to increase mood and energy here)
  • Acetyl L-Carnitine, 500mg (increase energy metabolism and neurotransmitters noradrenaline and serotonin in mice here)

While this is the current formulation of the blend, it is subject to minor alterations as we do our part to create the most well-balanced and effective combination.

Get Smart

‘Nootropics’ is a term coined by Romanian doctor Corneliu Giurgea in the 1970’s when he created what he believed to be the first nootropic - something he defined as a cognitive enhancer that was non-toxic and non-addictive. These two qualities distinguish nootropics from other previously thought cognitive enhancers such as amphetamines, which are commonly abused by students throughout the world despite adverse long-term effects in terms of neurotransmitter depletion and reduced connectivity in the brain.

Rather than providing a rapid and very temporary release of neurotransmitters involved in cognitive processing, nootropics have many other alternative methods of action such as: endogenously allowing the brain to produce more of these neurotransmitters, increasing blood flow within the brain, altering the way in which neurons use energy for increased efficiency, and sometimes even signaling the brain to produce more neurons or connections between neurons. While the nootropic market is an exciting and emerging field where much research still has to be done, all of the ingredients in our blends are sufficiently studied to show cognitive improvement with no neurophysiological harm involved.

The effects include enhanced focus, memory, and mental agility from the most basic to most demanding tasks.


Why We Care

While helping get this campaign off the ground involves supplying individuals with supplements to ensure optimum cognitive performance at the consumer level, this project is also much more than that. The world of nootropics and cognitive enhancement is the next step in humans ability to more accurately shape and interact with the world they experience. We are increasingly shaping every aspect of our existence, and cognitive enhancement is both a means and an end in this path.
Spreading the shared knowledge of this field to as many people as possible in an affordable manner may be a stepping stone of great magnitude towards a more intelligent and kinder human species. By contributing to this project, you are directly taking part in the formation of the Metatropics vision. From this very  beginning and into our promising future, we will always particularly value the input and feedback of our initial backers - those who will make this project possible. This will include optional but very much appreciated self-assessments for what manner of your life you intend cognitive enhancement to serve, as well as how effective and useful our blends are for you. By actively fostering communication with our initial backers,  we will be able to continuously create the most ideal company and blends for you.

What You Will Receive

To acknowledge your part in shaping the future cognitive state of our species, we will be offering an exclusive email update list which will provide those who are interested with all information regarding the current state of Metatropics, as well as significant discount codes for all those who donate $5 or more. For those who donate $10 or more, we will be offering email updates and discounts, as well as your published name on our website as a permanent token of gratitude.

We will be offering a one week supply for all donors of $16 or more, a two week supply for those who donate $25 or more, and a four week supply to those who donate $40 or more. Nootropics are not for everybody, and some respond more readily than others to key ingredients. While we've done our best to formulate the most well-balanced blend, whether you are a novice or a veteran to the field of cognitive supplementation, we recommend not only taking our word for it, but simply giving a fair trial to our blend to form your own opinion!

Our initial shipment will have a longer period of production as we process and prepare all of the individual ingredients. We expect to have the first batch shipped out within two months of successful funding. However, we will keep all backers updated on our progress if this changes in any way, but rest assured we will be getting these out as soon as we can.

                    

All questions and comments can be directed toward info@metatropics.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute funding, but there are other ways you can help. Spread the word about our goal and campaign in whatever manner you can, such as the social networking share tools right here on the Indiegogo page.
We love all of our backers and all those who can help. 

Who We Are

We are Daniel and Lamar Howell - two brothers with backgrounds in the undergraduate neuroscience program at the University of Texas and AI research in the computer science program at the University of Houston, respectively. We are dedicated to the ever-expanding pursuit of knowledge and the harnessing of cognitive potential. We now wish to share the fruits of this passion with all who share this desire by producing a series of blends specially formulated from our combined knowledge in the field.

story:
Mission/Purpose/Reason

Our goal with Project Ninja Guidance is to create a sustainable Yoga and Meditaion class within the walls of RJ Donovan (State Penitentiary), and FCC (Federal Penitentiary) here in San Diego.  We have already been going in to these prisons with limited ability due to lack of funding, materials and able/capable teachers.  We have made the necessary contacts within the prison system and have the ability now to be going in five days a week should we be able to raise the funds to do so.  
At this point it is all volunteer based and consumes most of the day to do this.  The goal for teaching yoga and meditation in the prison system is to reduce the recidivism rate, "re-incarceration", to 0%.  Sending the ex-cons home with a very different skill set for dealing with their frustrations and addictions.  
The goal is for the "lifers" and all prisoners in general, is to heal the trauma that they have held onto from the past enabling the pain "system" to fall back and be replaced with love and kindness.  
This will create a more stable living environment that is conducive to healing and rehabilitation within the prison thus allowing the "system" to operate at a higher rate of health and functionality.  We are looking to create a two-year program within each facility.

My Story (a brief summary)

I got into yoga as a result of suicidal thoughts, and several attempts on my life, as well as meth and cocaine addictions.  I was using various drugs daily and each weekend dousing my system with as much meth and cocaine as i could possibly get my hands on.  
My grandfather killed himself by jumping off of the Golden Gate Bridge so as to avoid going to prison at the age of 77.  This alone shook me something fierce and made me take a step back.  I had a group of friends at that time that kept encouraging me to do yoga, and after the suicide urged me to take a yoga teacher training to begin my healing process.  The man running the training never asked me to stop doing drugs, to this day I don't think he and I have ever spoken of drug use.  I took my first yoga class a week before the teacher training and then my second on the first day of the training.  Within that weeks time I stopped doing drugs entirely (my daily and weekend habits literally vanished).  My own suicidal thoughts would take longer to vanish as I had some very serious cords to my heritage. 
However, through much meditation, study, practice, and support from the yoga community in the SF Bay Area, Southeast Asia and now here in San Diego I am a highly functional being of light.  I would like to share my light, as well as the gifts of yoga and meditation with these individuals "the forgotten souls" that are desperately in need of peace, compassion, loving-kindness and hope.
My most sincere wish is to assist the San Diego prison population with recognizing and healing the wounds of their past and to inspire them to know that through the darkness there is light.
*****Contact Info
facebook - Jon Old-Rowe
email - joldrowe@yahoo.com
instagram - @jonoldrowe
twitter - @intoit4divinity
story_txt:
Mission/Purpose/Reason
Our goal with Project Ninja Guidance is to create a sustainable Yoga and Meditaion class within the walls of RJ Donovan (State Penitentiary), and FCC (Federal Penitentiary) here in San Diego.  We have already been going in to these prisons with limited ability due to lack of funding, materials and able/capable teachers.  We have made the necessary contacts within the prison system and have the ability now to be going in five days a week should we be able to raise the funds to do so.  At this point it is all volunteer based and consumes most of the day to do this.  The goal for teaching yoga and meditation in the prison system is to reduce the recidivism rate, "re-incarceration", to 0%.  Sending the ex-cons home with a very different skill set for dealing with their frustrations and addictions.  The goal is for the "lifers" and all prisoners in general, is to heal the trauma that they have held onto from the past enabling the pain "system" to fall back and be replaced with love and kindness.  This will create a more stable living environment that is conducive to healing and rehabilitation within the prison thus allowing the "system" to operate at a higher rate of health and functionality.  We are looking to create a two-year program within each facility.
My Story (a brief summary)
I got into yoga as a result of suicidal thoughts, and several attempts on my life, as well as meth and cocaine addictions.  I was using various drugs daily and each weekend dousing my system with as much meth and cocaine as i could possibly get my hands on.  My grandfather killed himself by jumping off of the Golden Gate Bridge so as to avoid going to prison at the age of 77.  This alone shook me something fierce and made me take a step back.  I had a group of friends at that time that kept encouraging me to do yoga, and after the suicide urged me to take a yoga teacher training to begin my healing process.  The man running the training never asked me to stop doing drugs, to this day I don't think he and I have ever spoken of drug use.  I took my first yoga class a week before the teacher training and then my second on the first day of the training.  Within that weeks time I stopped doing drugs entirely (my daily and weekend habits literally vanished).  My own suicidal thoughts would take longer to vanish as I had some very serious cords to my heritage. However, through much meditation, study, practice, and support from the yoga community in the SF Bay Area, Southeast Asia and now here in San Diego I am a highly functional being of light.  I would like to share my light, as well as the gifts of yoga and meditation with these individuals "the forgotten souls" that are desperately in need of peace, compassion, loving-kindness and hope.My most sincere wish is to assist the San Diego prison population with recognizing and healing the wounds of their past and to inspire them to know that through the darkness there is light.*****Contact Infofacebook - Jon Old-Roweemail - joldrowe@yahoo.cominstagram - @jonoldrowetwitter - @intoit4divinity

story:
Joseph Morris has been surfing since he was 7yrs old and won both the under 12's and this year the under 14's Welsh surf nationals as well as getting to the semi finals of the Europeans last year and finishing in 11th, the highest ranking British surfer of his age category in Europe. He also has done extremely well getting to finals of many British surf competitions during his time surfing.

Joseph has been chosen by the Welsh Surfing Federation (WSF) to represent Wales at the 2015 VISSLA International Surfing Association World Junior Surfing Championship, being held in Oceanside, California, between 11 - 18 October. Joseph is so stoked to have been selected in the Under 16 category and being only 13 years he is the youngest in the Team.

There is no funding available to him to contribute to the trip so we are attempting to raise as much as possible to help Joseph to achieve his dream of representing his country in a sport he is so passionate about. He would be extremely grateful for any donations or help given.
Many Thanks

story:
Who I am and What I do

My name is Daniella Martin. I'm a wife, mother and lover of yoga.  

Yoga changed my life for the better and has continued to do so over the 10 years I have practiced and 8 years of teaching.  

I want to open a yoga school that offers more opportunities to deepen your yoga practice through workshops, immersions, teacher training and retreats.

More yoga in our community means more happy people and more happy people bring balance and peace to our community!


What We Need 

I need $1,000 to get my yoga school up and running.  That's all!  Funds will go toward registering with the yoga alliance, advertising and getting the business side of things rolling. 

I already have my application for the yoga alliance ready to go!

story:
Our Story

We have been training athletes and the health-conscious community for almost a year. All of our clients have reached personal bests through our training program, and the majority of them wanted more from a gym than just machines and weights. We use a method that what seems every gym in our area lacks: Boxing.

We first implemented boxing into our clients' workout plans as a means to do cardiovascular training and increase hand speed for our baseball and basketball clients. It became very popular so we began to do it for anyone seeking personal training for weight loss and strength training.

We believe that our non-intimidating and fun boxing studio will aid the local community of Rochester and surrounding area in health, just as it did our athletes. We want to help you have the energy to run around with your kids, fit into that dress or suit you want to wear, lower your blood pressure, and help you feel strong and confident about yourself.

Our Goal, Your Gain...

Our goal is to reach $5,000 for our campaign. Your contributions will be used for remodeling and purchasing the equipment necessary for our classes. In return, we will send you our boxing T-shirt and shout-out on our website video blog.

Our classes will allow for clients to hit heavy bags filled with water, and work with trainers.

Community Impact...

The stresses of life can be taxing, whether it be from your job, family, or personal matters. We feel that the best (and legal) way to blow off steam is to hit something. Boxing allows for many unique and fun workouts that will challenge our community and not make workouts feel like work.

Nothing Easy is Worth Doing...

We are ready to take the responsibility of becoming Rochester, Michigan's only boxing facility. Our staff is eager for the challenges ahead, and want to offer more for the fitness community. We have our fitness goals, and you have yours. Let us help one another and create a new standard for health and wellness.

Thank you for your time and support.

story:
Hi, My name is Meghan Riley. And I recently scored ZERO on a 3D vision test. 3d movies? They don’t work for me! Does that mean I see in 2D? hmmm, It means that I have a dominant eye. Both eyes take in peripheral information at the side, but right in front of my nose where depth perception is concerned, my brain only receives information from my left, dominant eye. If I cover this eye, my right eye DOES work… but it’s very farsighted in comparison to my left. 3D vision combines what each eye sees into one image but for this my two eyes just don’t work together.

I’ve known about the way I see and have wanted 3D vision for many years, but I’ve never had any success in the past.

Anyways this year, after experiencing more and more headaches around my weak eye, I decided to seek out Vision Therapy.

I made an appointment with Doctor Bastien in Montreal and put my vision to the test. While testing my eyes, he asked about exercise and whether I play any team sports. When I told him “Oh no! I’ve never been very good at that” He laughed and said “of course you’re not!!” Turns out, there are a lot of things that I avoid because of my lack of depth perception and I could rant for a while about the subtle ways my life would change and improve if I gained 3D vision. But I’ll keep this short.

It’s happening. I’m gonna do it!

 I’ve just started my vision therapy sessions, I have one contact lens for my weak eye, and some nifty vision therapy Jedi training tools. I’ll be practicing 4 days a week and visiting the optometrist  once a month. The training program will last a year. 

There’s no time like the present. I’m ready for this vision upgrade! 3D vision, Here I come!!!

Yes, But all this is an unexpected financial expense. I’d like to raise the funds for the complete vision therapy program over the next two  and a half months. And I’d like to do that using my skill sets.

I am a vocalist, fibres artist and painter. And I’m also a massage therapist in training. I practice Swedish and Thai Yoga Massage.

For April, May and June, I want to work full-time in my field. So if you would like to support my vision therapy quest, employ me as the artist I am! You can order a quilt! I’ll sew a gorgeous quilt for you! Or a personalized portrait doll! Imagine this! You send me a photo of you as a child, I’ll paint your portrait, and make a cuddly doll that represents your inner child! What? That’s beautiful.

You can buy a digital download of my compilation album that features work I’ve done with a number of talented artists over the years, or sign up for weekly lullabies.  I’ll send you a ten-minute track of improvised lullaby song each week. 

If you’re local to Montreal, join my weekly Experimental Choir! Or book me for a massage: Swedish or Thai Yoga. I also offer a Vocal lesson/Massage combo that will get you sinking into sublime song. For real!

So with that, I say Thank you! Get in touch! Wish me luck. And feel free to share my campaign widely!

http://meghanr.com/

Here is a breakdown of my costs.

Contact lenses: $200

Spacialization test: $195

Vision therapy: April -June, August-March ($105/m): $1155 

Vision Therapy tools: $295

Indie Go Go Fees: $100 

Grand total = $1945

story:
LiV Pi for Raspberry Pi model 2 and B+

This campaign is for LiV Pi for Raspberry Pi model 2 and B+. If you would like a LiV Pi assembled set for the old Raspberry Pi model B, you can order it here. If you would like a LiV Pi kit for the old Raspberry Pi model B, you can order it here. 

What does LiV Pi do?


  • LiV displays CO2, temperature, humidity and air pressure measurements on its LCD screen just like a regular indoor air quality monitor.
  • LiV offers an Intranet website with visualisation of indoor air quality measurement data.
  • LiV communicates with your mobile or desktop Instant Messaging application (Pidgin, Messenger, ChatSecure, etc…) using Jabber/XMPP protocol.
  • LiV retrieves measurements, sets alarm thresholds and sends notifications when thresholds are exceeded.
  • LiV connects to online Internet of Things platforms (DeviceHive, data.sparkfun.com, Xively, ThingSpeak, Emoncms, more to come in the future).
  • LiV offers an expandable set of APIs (Python Flask) for easy integration.

You can watch how one can chat with LiV in this movie. (please use HD quality in full-screen mode)

LiV Pi 

  • Find all information related to LiV Pi here
  • Find out why CO2 is a good general indicator of indoor air quality here
  • Find sensor accuracy information here 
  • LiV Pi Board schematics are here
  • LiV Pi board soldering instructions are here
  • LiV Pi device assembly instructions are here

Perks

So far, nine LiV Pi boards for RPi 2/B+ were assembled and sent for testing to members of a few hackerspaces in UK, Germany, US and Canada. All boards tested OK with both Raspberry Pi 2 and Raspberry Pi model B+. This is a low risk project. All perks will be shipped at the end of campaign, after receiving the funds from indiegogo. 






Open source

LiV Pi is an open source hardware and software project. LiV provides a flexible, high level, Python software framework. Developers can easily modify existing code or write new code in order to support new sensors, and change or extend LiV’s functionality. All LiV hardware and software files are available on GitHub.

Updated Kicad hardware schematics, PCB files, Bill Of Materials and all software files will be added to LiV GitHub repository at the end of this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
VeganTrainer Studio

My name is C. E. Flores. I have been vegan for 9+ years, a Certified Personal Trainer (PTS) during the last 8 years, and Certified Nutrition and Wellness Specialist (NWS and soon to be certified in Nutrition and Weight Loss, NWL) and Certified Kettebells Specialist (KBTS) both during the last 5-6 years. I come from a Wholefoods Plant-Based approach at dealing with nutrition. I also come from a Bodyweight/Functional paradigm when it comes to training. Both of these are optimal; the former is an optimal way to eat and the latter is an optimal way to train. The result of bringing both of these together is your Optimal Health. VeganTrainer Studio will be located near the downtown core of the city in a 750 - 1,000+ sq ft accessible studio, accessible via private and public transit with plenty of street and paid parking.

The campaign to raise $20,000 for the VeganTrainer Studio allows for the creation of our petite boutique (multipurpose) studio/training space, the equipping of our kitchen studio and training studio and the offering of our in studio, on site and online remote access classes/workshops. The nutrition and/or training studio spaces will allow for training to be either personal (1 on 1), partner (2 on 1), or small groups (of 3 up to 5 on 1) and possibly up to 10 on 1, depending on how much support we get. The creation of VeganTrainer Studio is of import not just to me as this is part of my contribution to the planet, but to the health and wellness of Torontonians, the  Earth's future, and the animals whose lives it impacts the most - since each person that goes vegan 'saves' thousands of other animals lives in their lifetime - the impact is exponential. VeganTrainer Studio serves as a role model of sustainable, compassionate and holistic living that can be modeled, and scaled.

VeganTrainer Studio will also rent out the training studio when it is not in use since it is a multipurpose facility that seeks to help foster not just the sense of community, but provide many with a 100% vegan space that is affordable, naturally lit, and pre-wired for multimedia. Whether the users are yoga instructors, Registered Massage Therapists, or Vegan business minded people/entrepreneurs - the studio will be fore hire and remain vegan. VeganTrainer Studio hopes to serve the Vegan community in Toronto and beyond as a venue for meetings, events such as workshops, and other educational events on site, and online. VeganTrainer Studio will be equipped with a large projection screen, projector, vintage audiophile equipment, whiteboards, and other high tech gadgets and software making organizing/communication and electronic billing easier. VeganTrainer Studio in an inclusive, Anti-Oppressive, LGTBQ* and Womyn Positive safe space and Anti-Speciesist space focused on developing and fostering positive space for all our clients, their extended families and all other human and non-human animals in their lives. 

While most gyms facilities are too large, too impersonal and too focused on areas that do not optimize their clients health and wellness results VeganTrainer Studio is the direct opposite. VeganTrainer Studio prides itself on optimizing results for our clientele through a holistic lifestyle approach. Often gym facilities will also charge twice; once for 'membership' and the second time for personal training. VeganTrainer Studio seeks to make the entire experience different by providing personal to small group, in an intimate environment bringing integrated nutrition and training together in a single community focused place - at a single price. No need to buy 50 sessions in order to receive discount pricing either. VeganTrainer Studio will be that place where your name is known, where you are always glad that you went, and know that you will be seen with the greatest of attention.

Contributors will help the secure the 750 - 1,000+ sq. ft studio space in our prime downtown/centrally adjacent location. Contributors will also help to equip the studios (kitchen and training) with kitchen pots and pans, Vitamix/Blendtec blender, and other kitchen equipment including juicers. The training studio will be equipped with bodyweight and functional implements including TRXs, Kettlebells, VIPRs, and other sports and fitness equipment. Contributors will help VeganTrainer Studio to get fully set up and operational within the next 100 day period. As well, any extra contributions will assist in the development and operations of the office such as with purchases of other assessment equipment, updated hardware/software or with upgrading the space with office equipment.  VeganTrainer Studio will also be offering CPR/SFA and AED courses out of the studio in 2015 apart from its core work around health and wellness lifestyle programming.

We offer:

  • Personal Training (1 on 1)
  • Couples Training (2 on 1)
  • Small Group Training I (3 - 5 on 1)
  • Small Group Training II (6 - 10 on 1)
  • Bootcamp Instruction (Supervised Training for 1 - 10 on 1)
  • 15 (HIIT I), 30 (HIIT II), 45 (HIIT III) and 60 (Standard) minute sessions
  • Normal and Specialized (Kettlebells, etc) Training 
  • Remote (Online), In Studio, and On Site Training
  • Food/preparation workshops
  • Nutrition and food preparation products*
  • Seminars and Lectures
  • Shopping Tours and Services
  • Nutrition Counselling*
  • CPR and SFA Instruction*
  • Documentary Screenings

VeganTrainer Studio Needs & What You Get

VeganTrainer Studio funding would be allocated as such:

  • $6,000 Secure studio
  • $2,000 to upgrade the space (paint, mirrors, etc)
  • $1,000 Vitamix/Blendtec quiet blender/food processor
  • $1,000 Kitchen goodies
  • $400 NatureMills composter
  • $1,000 TRX suspension trainers 
  • $1,000 Kettlebells
  • $2,000 for the most amazing gym mats
  • $1,500 Exercise rail system
  • $500 Resistance bands
  • $250 Skipping ropes
  • $500 Skulpt - body composition and muscle quality analyzer
  • $1,000 VIPRs
  • $1,000 heart rate monitors
  • $850 Misc.

VeganTrainer Studio's unique perks provide contributors with deals and savings that reflect on our appreciation for their collaboration. These perks are either small perks that range from single sessions to bigger perks that reflect to month or year long equivalent support. There are even perks for non-local (regional, national or international supporters) since VeganTrainer Studio provides services virtually via Skype and soon via other virtual platform - AnyMeeting. VeganTrainer Studio's collaborators will also receive individualized recognition from the bottom of our hearts on our website, and for the larger donors, you will receive a small plaque with your name on it in our studio. Much <3 and thanks again!

If VeganTrainer Studio does not manage to get the proposed $20,000 in funding, the money raised will be allocated toward either the studio and upgrading it ($6,000 - $8,000) and/or toward the purchasing training equipment ($8,750). And lastly the kitchen equipment ($2,400). We will also do social events in the Community (vegan and non-vegan) to help raise awareness and funds for our project. We look forward for meeting the aim that we have set in mind. Ideally VeganTrainer Studio would love to raise $20,000+ with the support of the community. This journey will not be made alone since another world is not only possible, it is a must - and we must all work together to make it happen.

If we exceed the funding goal we will put the monies toward developing programs, developing out of studio services and the purchase of more high quality leading edge gym and kitchen equipment to service the community better. We are also open to the idea of upgrading the space for something larger if we have the funds or finding something more central. Beneath is a breakdown of additional funding if we can exceed the goals and their particular designated purchases. Please, refer to the original breakdown a couple of paragraphs above. Below is the additional breakdown:

$25,000 - ALL of the above + $1,000 more kitchen goodies, $500 Kettlebells, $500 TRXs, $250 SKULPT analyzer, $750 TRX wall anchors and pull up bars, $1,000 More awesome mats, $500 Office laptop and $500 Office equipment

$30,000 - ALL of the above + $2,500 AV upgrade, $2,500 (in 5 x $500) trainer packages (allow us to do more training out of individual homes and other locations for corporate/institutional clients. 

$35,000 - ALL of the above + $1,800 BOSUs, $500 heart rate monitors, $250 resistance bands, $50 skipping ropes, $1,000 exercise rail system, $500 Vitamix/Blendtec, $400 UrbanMills Composter, and $500 VIPRs, 

$40,000 - All of the above plus $5,000 for CPR Dummies + Defibrilator

$50,000 - All of the above plus an expansion in space to a 1,000 - 3,000 sq ft facility


The Impact

VeganTrainer Studio is a valuable to the community, Toronto and the World in a few different ways: Canadians are among the sickest people in the world with leading causes of death connected to their poor lifestyles - based on leading sedentary lives and poor nutrition bordering malnutrition caused often caused by excess calories and insufficient nutrition. The following lifestyle diseases are claiming an unnecessary, and nearly preventable toll on Canadian's health (in no particular order) obesity, heart disease, stroke, diabetes, cancer, and kidney disease.  These diseases are often connected to acidic diets, that lack nutrients and that overly focused on animal products with excessive animal protein and animal fat and processed foods and sugars.

Healthy eating may be best achieved with a plant-based diet, which we define as a regimen that encourages whole, plant-based foods and discourages meats, dairy products, and eggs as well as all refined and processed foods. - Kaiser Permanente Journal, 2013.

This journal article goes on to say that research shows "that plant-based diets are cost-effective, low-risk interventions that may lower body mass index, blood pressure, HbA1C, and cholesterol levels. They may also reduce the number of medications needed to treat chronic diseases and lower ischemic heart disease mortality rates. Physicians should consider recommending a plant-based diet to ALL their patients, especially those patients with high blood pressure, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, or obesity." The journal article notes that "perhaps out of all the diets out there that have been used to treat chronic illnesses, the best but perhaps least common may be those that are plant based… Despite the strong body of evidence favoring plant-based diets, including studies showing a willingness of the general public to embrace them, many physicians are not stressing the importance of plant-based diets as a first-line treatment for chronic illnesses. This could be because of a lack of awareness of these diets or a lack of patient education resources." This is where VeganTrainer Studio steps in to partner up as an educator, facilitator, and centre for empowerment from a holistic approach to help Canadians regain their health in conjunction with their health care provider(s).

In the US, the Department of Agriculture responsible for dietary guidelines notes that, "...If the Committee actually discussed this research, it would be unable to justify its recommendation to eat meat, as the research would show that meat increases the risks of chronic diseases, contrary to the purposes of the Guidelines. Thus, by simply ignoring that research, the Committee is able to reach a conclusion that would otherwise look improper." In Canada, most of the work is centred around the Canadian Food Guide that is a bit more proactive than the US version, although it is really close in its acceptance of the consumption of meat, dairy and eggs.  

Unfortunately, the conflict of interest exists between the organization(s) that is/are supposed to promote health and the ones that promote food industries. The latter are often that are often lobbied by the marketing boards that represent each industry - and push their product into the food policy of the government, as well as, often receive large subsidies from government making their food more readily available at a lower cost than market value. This forces the pushing of its level consumption at the detriment of the health of the general population. You can even see this now with the new studies that conclude that eating eggs is like smoking, and that milk does not do the body good. This is great marketing, but bad science!

VeganTrainer Studio as noted will provide personal to group nutritional training, counseling and education workshops around food preparation, juicing and cooking. VeganTrainer Studio will also offer other services around food including Shopping Tours, Meal Planning* and Shopping Services.  Dietary help is key to helping us avoid become the statistical norm that large numbers of Canadians are used to hearing about. VeganTrainer Studio's motto of Optimal Nutrition represents a desire to break away from the chance of becoming a lifestyle based statistic into becoming an empowered actor in ones own life. The choice to live life healthfully is in one's hands and it begins with what one eats.

VeganTrainer Studio seeks to provide the best in Personal, Partner, and Small Group Training including Bootcamps in Toronto. With our focus on functional/body weight workouts we seek to optimize your every day performance where it counts -- in your everyday life. Whether you are a beginner, intermediate or a weekend warrior, there is a space for you at VeganTrainer Studio to help you push yourself beyond what you are used to not only to perform better by carrying your own weight, but to be at your best through our focus on Optimal Training. Through the use of other functional movement/dynamic based implements such as TRX suspension trainers, Kettlebells, and VIPR or BOSU we hope to push you further once you have achieved mastery over your own weight. Training will be provided in either 1) Personal basis and 2) Supervised basis. The former is what we have come to know as 'Personal Training' and the latter is more like bootcamp instruction or an alternative for those who already have a program from another Certified and Insured Personal Trainer but need assistance and support without being as meticulous as Personal Training.

VeganTrainer Studio realizes that the every journey begins with a single step. Just as a business begins with a single idea. Many hours have gone into this project and many more will go into it into the future. Your support is greatly appreciated at making this multipurpose space a reality. VeganTrainer Studio will be delivering high quality services and products to assist you not just to regain your health, but to optimize it. At VeganTrainer Studio we want you to partake with us on this journey. Together we can bring a better lifestyle outlook forth for many Torontonians at affordable rates thanks to the magic of group training.

VeganTrainer Studio is our pilot project on Indiegogo. We are proud to be part of this amazing community of individuals that support through their own version of micro-lending to fund ideas that are worthwhile. We have committed ourselves to work 12 hours a day since we believe that we cannot do it without you, as much as we believe that you probably will not do it with us. VeganTrainer Studio has taken the leadership to stand out from the rest and is here to support the downtown core becoming healthier and more active because we do not want to be part of the lifestyle statistics. We truly believe that people do not want to be unhealthy or inactive, but that people need to find something that suits their character, their outlook on life, schedule and their ethics. We are here for you. We recognize that our bodies have the ability to heal - given the proper nutrition, and proper movement.

How Else Can You Can Help?

We recognize that some of you may not be able at this time to contribute financially although you agree wholeheartedly with VeganTrainer Studio's purpose and mission. We have not forgotten that your contribution is as important if not more important than money. We remind you that without you we cannot build a better world and that it not only takes money to make things happen, but awesome inspiring and amazing people like you. So, you are wondering how you as a single person can help? Well, pay it forward. Send this to at least 3 other people and ask them to do the same and to keep it going for as long as they can. 

We request that you take the time of day when you can during the next 40 days to tell your friends, family and loved ones about VeganTrainer Studio. Even tell those people that are not your friends, like co-workers you may not be too close with, who may benefit, bosses whose companies could use corporate wellness programs, or just a stranger on the street with whom you strike a conversation whether it be around eating clean eating or needing more physical activity in your life. We at VeganTrainer Studio need to make lots of buzzzzzzzz since this is the first space like this of its kind in Toronto, and probably Canada.

VeganTrainer Studio was inspired by the work of numerous other vegans out there. Many of them are doctors, activists, and other professionals and their work is relentless primarily for the animals, but secondarily for the planet and lastly for our own existence as a species including our health. We at VeganTrainer Studio ask you to get out there and get the word out and spread the word as noted earlier. Feel free to use your social media, your telephones, emails, slow mail, or any of the Indiegogo share tools! Once again, we thank you! We look forward to offering you our services in the near future and helping you become a person that thrives to help us make this a better world for the animals, the planet and our health.

Namaste!
story_txt:
VeganTrainer Studio
My name is C. E. Flores. I have been vegan for 9+ years, a Certified Personal Trainer (PTS) during the last 8 years, and Certified Nutrition and Wellness Specialist (NWS and soon to be certified in Nutrition and Weight Loss, NWL) and Certified Kettebells Specialist (KBTS) both during the last 5-6 years. I come from a Wholefoods Plant-Based approach at dealing with nutrition. I also come from a Bodyweight/Functional paradigm when it comes to training. Both of these are optimal; the former is an optimal way to eat and the latter is an optimal way to train. The result of bringing both of these together is your Optimal Health. VeganTrainer Studio will be located near the downtown core of the city in a 750 - 1,000+ sq ft accessible studio, accessible via private and public transit with plenty of street and paid parking.The campaign to raise $20,000 for the VeganTrainer Studio allows for the creation of our petite boutique (multipurpose) studio/training space, the equipping of our kitchen studio and training studio and the offering of our in studio, on site and online remote access classes/workshops. The nutrition and/or training studio spaces will allow for training to be either personal (1 on 1), partner (2 on 1), or small groups (of 3 up to 5 on 1) and possibly up to 10 on 1, depending on how much support we get. The creation of VeganTrainer Studio is of import not just to me as this is part of my contribution to the planet, but to the health and wellness of Torontonians, the  Earth's future, and the animals whose lives it impacts the most - since each person that goes vegan 'saves' thousands of other animals lives in their lifetime - the impact is exponential. VeganTrainer Studio serves as a role model of sustainable, compassionate and holistic living that can be modeled, and scaled.VeganTrainer Studio will also rent out the training studio when it is not in use since it is a multipurpose facility that seeks to help foster not just the sense of community, but provide many with a 100% vegan space that is affordable, naturally lit, and pre-wired for multimedia. Whether the users are yoga instructors, Registered Massage Therapists, or Vegan business minded people/entrepreneurs - the studio will be fore hire and remain vegan. VeganTrainer Studio hopes to serve the Vegan community in Toronto and beyond as a venue for meetings, events such as workshops, and other educational events on site, and online. VeganTrainer Studio will be equipped with a large projection screen, projector, vintage audiophile equipment, whiteboards, and other high tech gadgets and software making organizing/communication and electronic billing easier. VeganTrainer Studio in an inclusive, Anti-Oppressive, LGTBQ* and Womyn Positive safe space and Anti-Speciesist space focused on developing and fostering positive space for all our clients, their extended families and all other human and non-human animals in their lives. While most gyms facilities are too large, too impersonal and too focused on 
areas that do not optimize their clients health and wellness results VeganTrainer Studio is the direct opposite. VeganTrainer Studio prides itself on optimizing results for our clientele through a holistic lifestyle approach. Often gym facilities will also charge twice; once for 'membership' and the second time for personal 
training. VeganTrainer Studio seeks to make the entire experience 
different by providing personal to small group, in an intimate environment 
bringing integrated nutrition and training together in a single 
community focused place - at a single price. No need to buy 50 sessions in 
order to receive discount pricing either. VeganTrainer Studio will be that 
place where your name is known, where you are always glad that you went,
 and know that you will be seen with the greatest of attention.Contributors will help the secure the 750 - 1,000+ sq. ft studio space in our prime downtown/centrally adjacent location. Contributors will also help to equip the studios (kitchen and training) with kitchen pots and pans, Vitamix/Blendtec blender, and other kitchen equipment including juicers. The training studio will be equipped with bodyweight and functional implements including TRXs, Kettlebells, VIPRs, and other sports and fitness equipment. Contributors will help VeganTrainer Studio to get fully set up and operational within the next 100 day period. As well, any extra contributions will assist in the development and operations of the office such as with purchases of other assessment equipment, updated hardware/software or with upgrading the space with office equipment.  VeganTrainer Studio will also be offering CPR/SFA and AED courses out of the studio in 2015 apart from its core work around health and wellness lifestyle programming.We offer:
Personal Training (1 on 1)
Couples Training (2 on 1)
Small Group Training I (3 - 5 on 1)
Small Group Training II (6 - 10 on 1)
Bootcamp Instruction (Supervised Training for 1 - 10 on 1)
15 (HIIT I), 30 (HIIT II), 45 (HIIT III) and 60 (Standard) minute sessions
Normal and Specialized (Kettlebells, etc) Training 
Remote (Online), In Studio, and On Site Training
Food/preparation workshops
Nutrition and food preparation products*
Seminars and Lectures
Shopping Tours and Services
Nutrition Counselling*
CPR and SFA Instruction*
Documentary Screenings
VeganTrainer Studio Needs & What You GetVeganTrainer Studio funding would be allocated as such:
$6,000 Secure studio
$2,000 to upgrade the space (paint, mirrors, etc)
$1,000 Vitamix/Blendtec quiet blender/food processor
$1,000 Kitchen goodies
$400 NatureMills composter

$1,000 TRX suspension trainers 
$1,000 Kettlebells 

$2,000 for the most amazing gym mats 
$1,500 Exercise rail system

$500 Resistance bands
$250 Skipping ropes
$500 Skulpt - body composition and muscle quality analyzer
$1,000 VIPRs

$1,000 heart rate monitors


$850 Misc.

VeganTrainer Studio's unique perks provide contributors with deals and savings that reflect on our appreciation for their collaboration. These perks are either small perks that range from single sessions to bigger perks that reflect to month or year long equivalent support. There are even perks for non-local (regional, national or international supporters) since VeganTrainer Studio provides services virtually via Skype and soon via other virtual platform - AnyMeeting. VeganTrainer Studio's collaborators will also receive individualized recognition from the bottom of our hearts on our website, and for the larger donors, you will receive a small plaque with your name on it in our studio. Much <3 and thanks again!If VeganTrainer Studio does not manage to get the proposed $20,000 in funding, the money raised will be allocated toward either the studio and upgrading it ($6,000 - $8,000) and/or toward the purchasing training equipment ($8,750). And lastly the kitchen equipment ($2,400). We will also do social events in the Community (vegan and non-vegan) to help raise awareness and funds for our project. We look forward for meeting the aim that we have set in mind. Ideally VeganTrainer Studio would love to raise $20,000+ with the support of the community. This journey will not be made alone since another world is not only possible, it is a must - and we must all work together to make it happen.If we exceed the funding goal we will put the monies toward developing programs, developing out of studio services and the purchase of more high quality leading edge gym and kitchen equipment to service the community better.
