story:
HELP ADRIENNE CLAIM HER FIRST                     NATIONAL TITLE!

                   

Hi, my name is Adrienne Ford. I am the mother of twins, Austin and Aidan, a boxer and a full-time sports television professional. As the 2015, 154 lb. NY Daily News Golden Gloves Champion, I have earned a spot on the USA Boxing Metropolitan Association Team to represent New York at this year’s National Golden Gloves in Ft. Lauderdale, FL! I wasn't sure that I would be able to compete at Nationals until just now! It was not easy arranging a full week of care for Austin and Aidan while I compete, but thanks to family and some amazing friends we've worked it out! 

USA Boxing Metro will cover some costs, but I still need your help to achieve my goal! I need to cover costs for my trainer Lee Shabaka's travel, hotel and training expenses. 

Working towards this goal has been a roller coaster. It's very difficult to manage a household, work full time and pursue my goals as an athlete. There are a lot of ups and downs as I struggle to find "balance", which for me looks more like a ping pong ball bouncing from one thing to the next than a balanced scale. I do my best to honor my family life, work and boxing as they are all important to me. 

I not only represent female boxers, when I step into the ring I represent all women, mothers, career women, people who struggle with their weight, those who feel like they are in over their heads and those who struggle with depression and a  fear of failure. I represent everyone who bites off more than they can chew, yet do it anyway. Parenting, working and boxing are not easy to balance, but my success in the ring thus far is proof that it is worth the effort.

MY JOURNEY...

In 2002, at the age of 21, my coach Lee Shabaka, introduced me to his boxing and kickboxing club, Team Freeform. He built me up as a boxer from scratch, pushed me to reach my full potential and trained several national and international champions during his career. After my first year of training, I fought my first fight in the 2003 NY Golden Gloves. I lost a close decision to the current NATIONAL CHAMPION, but I was proud of my performance, and Lee was sure that I had the makings of a champion.

My Setback

But life got in the way.  In 2003 I took an eight year layoff! Ouch! During this time I was focused mostly on my career and family and began to struggle with weight gain.  In 2008 I had my amazing twin boys, Austin and Aidan. For the next two and a half years I only had time for them and work. Nursing twins in itself is a full time job!  I just didn’t have the time to care for myself and I continued my struggle with weight gain. In 2011, after I stopped nursing my boys, I was at my heaviest, 211 lbs.! 

                 

My Comeback

Unchained, I immediately went back to Lee and Team Freeform just to get control over my weight. I never planned on competing again. Eight months after being back in the gym, Lee convinced me that I needed to fight in a club show at 165 lbs. That’s right, I shed 46 lbs. over eight months. After the show, I had the bug in me, the desire to achieve a dream that I’ve been thinking about since my first match in 2003.  Over the past three years I have competed with the best female boxers in NY across two divisions. I am the 2012, 152 lb., 2013, 141 lb. NY Tournament Champion and the 2015, 154lb. NY Daily News National Champion! I have worked hard and consistently over the last few years to be the best in New York across two weight divisions.

                 


Another bump in the road...

In 2014 I separated from my husband. I pushed myself hard throughout that year determined not to allow the separation to disrupt my success in and out of the ring. I mostly kept the separation to myself. While adapting to change, I was determined not to slip back into my old habits of coping with anxiety by consuming food (Haagan Daaz ice cream is my Achilles heel) and watching inordinate amounts of television. There was a lot at stake! The first of which was the emotional well being of myself and my children, but also all that I've worked to accomplish in the ring! Collectively we were able to create a normal routine to the benefit of all.                        


Onward and upward! 

My goals as a boxer extend beyond the NY State lines. I need a National Championship! I represented NY in the 2014 National Golden Gloves at 141 lbs. and lost a very close and controversial decision to the National Champion in the quarter-finals. I will return to compete this year equipped with National experience and another New York title.                                    

I also have my family and friends who provide an immense amount of support at home as well as amazing employers and co-workers who are incredibly supportive of my boxing career. My “fans” push me to higher levels and everyone in my corner adds the spiritual and emotional support I need to succeed and I thank you.

Coming Up!

The Women’s National Golden Gloves is a one week, single elimination tournament. We will be departing July 6th and returning July 12th.

I am eager to claim a National Golden Gloves title with Lee in my corner, where he has been for every fight I’ve ever had. I will add to the Team Freeform legacy of champions! 

What We Need & What You Get

Help me raise at least $3,000.00 to achieve my goal. 

What are the funds going towards:

  • Travel expenses
  • Lodging expenses
  • Trainer expenses
  • Excess of $3,000 goes towards P.S. 212 Elementary School towards a new playground!  

What you get:

Share my Campaign! - Good Karma

  • Donate $25- A Social Media Shout Out!
  • Donate $60- An autographed photo of Adrienne, a handmade thank you card by my children and/or fellow Midtown West students and a Social Media Shout Out! 
  • Donate $75- A handmade thank you card by my children and/or fellow Midtown West students, Team Adrienne T-shirt and a Social Media Shout Out! 
  • Donate $125- An invitation to train with and/or observe Adrienne and Team Freeform during one of their workouts and sparring matches, a handmade thank you card by my children and/or fellow Midtown West students, Tshirt & an autographed photo by Adrienne herself! 

Every dollar donated beyond $3,000.00 will be donated to Midtown West - P.S. 212 Elementary School in NYC for a new playground. This school is integral in my success as a mother and boxer as home to my children 5 days a week while I am at work or in the gym. The enriched curriculum and family like community depends upon fundraising efforts of parents. It is my hope to put my goals as a boxer and mother in lockstep as I fight for my kids education in and out of the ring!

My Hope 

It is my hope to be an inspiration to my children by teaching them how to achieve their goals by leading by example. It is also my hope to motivate others to achieve their goals whatever they may be. I hope to inspire anyone who struggles with weight loss. It is also my hope that I inspire other mothers to find time for themselves, be progressive about their health and in so doing, teach their children self worth.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money to contribute but you have other ideas of how you may help make my trip more affordable, please reach out to me and let me know! 

Just having you as a fan is a great help on its own. All of the support pushes me to work hard and fight even harder.
story_txt:
HELP ADRIENNE CLAIM HER FIRST                     NATIONAL TITLE!                    Hi, my name is Adrienne Ford. I am the mother of twins, Austin and Aidan, a boxer and a full-time sports television professional. As the 2015, 154 lb. NY Daily News Golden Gloves Champion, I have earned a spot on the USA Boxing Metropolitan Association Team to represent New York at this year’s National Golden Gloves in Ft. Lauderdale, FL! I wasn't sure that I would be able to compete at Nationals until just now! It was not easy arranging a full week of care for Austin and Aidan while I compete, but thanks to family and some amazing friends we've worked it out! USA Boxing Metro will cover some costs, but I still need your help to achieve my goal! I need to cover costs for my trainer Lee Shabaka's travel, hotel and training expenses. Working towards this goal has been a roller coaster. It's very difficult to manage a household, work full time and pursue my goals as an athlete. There are a lot of ups and downs as I struggle to find "balance", which for me looks more like a ping pong ball bouncing from one thing to the next than a balanced scale. I do my best to honor my family life, work and boxing as they are all important to me. I not only represent female boxers, when I step into the ring I represent all women, mothers, career women, people who struggle with their weight, those who feel like they are in over their heads and those who struggle with depression and a  fear of failure. I represent everyone who bites off more than they can chew, yet do it anyway. Parenting, working and boxing are not easy to balance, but my success in the ring thus far is proof that it is worth the effort.MY JOURNEY...In 2002, at the age of 21, my coach Lee Shabaka, introduced me to his boxing and kickboxing club, Team Freeform. He built me up as a boxer from scratch, pushed me to reach my full potential and trained several national and international champions during his career. After my first year of training, I fought my first fight in the 2003 NY Golden Gloves. I lost a close decision to the current NATIONAL CHAMPION, but I was proud of my performance, and Lee was sure that I had the makings of a champion. My SetbackBut life got in the way.  In 2003 I took an eight year layoff! Ouch! During this time I was focused mostly on my career and family and began to struggle with weight gain.  In 2008 I had my amazing twin boys, Austin and Aidan. For the next two and a half years I only had time for them and work. Nursing twins in itself is a full time job!  I just didn’t have the time to care for myself and I continued my struggle with weight gain. In 2011, after I stopped nursing my boys, I was at my heaviest, 211 lbs.!                  My ComebackUnchained, I immediately went back to Lee and Team Freeform just to get control over my weight. I never planned on competing again. Eight months after being back in the gym, Lee convinced me that I needed to fight in a club show at 165 lbs. That’s right, I shed 46 lbs. over eight months. After the show, I had the bug in me, the desire to achieve a dream that I’ve been thinking about since my first match in 2003.  Over the past three years I have competed with the best female boxers in NY across two divisions. I am the 2012, 152 lb., 2013, 141 lb. NY Tournament Champion and the 2015, 154lb. NY Daily News National Champion! I have worked hard and consistently over the last few years to be the best in New York across two weight divisions.                   Another bump in the road...In 2014 I separated from my husband. I pushed myself hard throughout that year determined not to allow the separation to disrupt my success in and out of the ring. I mostly kept the separation to myself. While adapting to change, I was determined not to slip back into my old habits of coping with anxiety by consuming food (Haagan Daaz ice cream is my Achilles heel) and watching inordinate amounts of television. There was a lot at stake! The first of which was the emotional well being of myself and my children, but also all that I've worked to accomplish in the ring! Collectively we were able to create a normal routine to the benefit of all.                        Onward and upward! My goals as a boxer extend beyond the NY State lines. I need a National Championship! I represented NY in the 2014 National Golden Gloves at 141 lbs. and lost a very close and controversial decision to the National Champion in the quarter-finals. I will return to compete this year equipped with National experience and another New York title.                                    I also have my family and friends who provide an immense amount of support at home as well as amazing employers and co-workers who are incredibly supportive of my boxing career. My “fans” push me to higher levels and everyone in my corner adds the spiritual and emotional support I need to succeed and I thank you.Coming Up!The Women’s National Golden Gloves is a one week, single elimination tournament. We will be departing July 6th and returning July 12th.I am eager to claim a National Golden Gloves title with Lee in my corner, where he has been for every fight I’ve ever had. I will add to the Team Freeform legacy of champions! What We Need & What You GetHelp me raise at least $3,000.00 to achieve my goal. What are the funds going towards:
Travel expenses
Lodging expenses
Trainer expenses
Excess of $3,000 goes towards P.S. 212 Elementary School towards a new playground!  
What you get:Share my Campaign! - Good Karma
Donate $25- A Social Media Shout Out!
Donate $60- An autographed photo of Adrienne, a handmade thank you card by my children and/or fellow Midtown West students and a Social Media Shout Out! 
Donate $75- A handmade thank you card by my children and/or fellow Midtown West students, Team Adrienne T-shirt and a Social Media Shout Out! 
Donate $125- An invitation to train with and/or observe Adrienne and Team Freeform during one of their workouts and sparring matches, a handmade thank you card by my children and/or fellow Midtown West students, Tshirt & an autographed photo by Adrienne herself! 
Every dollar donated beyond $3,000.00 will be donated to Midtown West - P.S. 212 Elementary School in NYC for a new playground. This school is integral in my success as a mother and boxer as home to my children 5 days a week while I am at work or in the gym. The enriched curriculum and family like community depends upon fundraising efforts of parents. It is my hope to put my goals as a boxer and mother in lockstep as I fight for my kids education in and out of the ring!
My Hope It is my hope to be an inspiration to my children by teaching them how to achieve their goals by leading by example. It is also my hope to motivate others to achieve their goals whatever they may be. I hope to inspire anyone who struggles with weight loss. It is also my hope that I inspire other mothers to find time for themselves, be progressive about their health and in so doing, teach their children self worth. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you don't have money to contribute but you have other ideas of how you may help make my trip more affordable, please reach out to me and let me know! Just having you as a fan is a great help on its own. All of the support pushes me to work hard and fight even harder.

story:
Mudra is gearing up to launch in early August! Holy moly, that's coming right up! We invite you to be an instrumental part of building this modern, upbeat yoga center. Please help us by donating and engaging in this campaign! 


The Mission:

Mudra is a haven where busy folks actively unwind and rejuvenate through inspired yoga practice.


The Low Down:

Mudra will provide a hip, retreat-like ambience where students can engage with yoga in a fun, supportive, non-competitive and inclusive environment. Mudra will remain forward thinking and professional in regards to marketing, technology use, and service approach. In recognition of the busy people who will likely be drawn to this studio, Mudra will focus on products and services that cater to hectic lifestyles. As an example, classes offered will be limited to an hour long so that folks can get a great workout and get on to the other important practices in their lives.

The Owner, Heather Nelson, is a Yoga Alliance Registered Yoga Teacher and long-time yoga practitioner.  While a full-time professional and parent, Heather formulated a vision for Mudra as a yoga studio that would allow busy people the quality space to decompress and reenergize. 

So much of society demands façades that can make a person feel inauthentic or drained. Mudra is dedicated to creating an authentic experience that meets clients where they are and supports individual growth without the grueling expectations that can exist in other areas of their lives.


Mudra will be a vibrant and welcoming space that will allow all of you with hectic lives to take time for yourselves, yet still give you the time to move on to your other important life practices – be those family, school, work or play. 

Contributions to this campaign will be used for the ongoing, ecofriendly renovation of the studio space. Funding has already been secured and saved for starting up the business, purchasing materials and equipment, hiring teachers, leasing the space, planning implementation; the list goes on and on… However, there are always unforeseen costs and one of these lies in the ongoing hip and ecofriendly renovation to the space. I am asking for your help in raising $6,500 - $7,500 for completing renovations.  funds will ensure that Mudra starts off on a solid foundation and becomes a sustainable, community serving business.  


What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will go straight into funding ecofriendly renovations including the installation of a LED lighting system and recycled content ceiling panels, low VOC and recycled materials, and quality fixtures.

In return for your generous donation, Mudra has created perk packages that include sincere gratitude, stickers, yoga passes, Mudra tanks and tees, yoga mats and invites to the grand opening fiesta! I will also personally practice a vinyasa for every donation made while thinking about the generosity of each of you who give (for a yoga practitioner, this is an equivalent to"dancing a jig" in celebration). We'll contact you when items are available at the studio and ready for pick up - if you are out of town, let's talk. 

*Racerback will be in solid tri-blend, not burn-out.

The Impact

The creation of Mudra is paramount!  Eugene, like the rest of the world, is full of exhausted and over-taxed folks who have a challenging time fitting in healthy activity. Mudra will welcome the weary of our hectic society and make it easier to fit in an inspired, health boosting, fun yoga practice that leaves them feeling balanced, strong and revitalized. The studio will accomplish this in many ways, including having:

  • a well-organized, clean, welcoming establishment,
  • high quality, skilled and sincere instructors,
  • on-line registration,
  • hour long classes,
  • classes that work around typical school and work schedules,
  • fun and thoughtful experiences!

In addition to the services provided to the community, Mudra is dedicated to supporting businesses and agencies that give back and that find solutions to issues facing our world. Mudra chooses to do business with vendors who source their products sustainably whenever possible. The studio will also donate and partner with agencies with amazing missions - including A Family for Every Child - which is an organization that actively assists one of our most vulnerable populations, foster children.

Community Network

Businesses and professionals who have been instrumental in the development of Mudra include: 

  • Mark Miksis, Architect extraordinaire - who has aided enormously in the selection and design of the studio space; 
  • Casey Crisler-Davis of Sola Design who created the awesome logo, logo wear and branding and is an amazing friend!;  
  • Kory Northrop who got my website up and running with a speed and ease that made me feel like I was dreaming;
  • The Green Store from which we purchased the amazing and beautiful rapidly renewable, VOC & formaldehyde-free bamboo flooring, recycled content underlayment, and through whom we will purchase maintenance supplies in the future.
  • the wonderfully relaxing and inspired Gervais Salon & Day Spa whose manager and owner have been wonderful mentors and partners; 
  • Tom Clark with Divine Light Alters who was one of my first yoga instructors, gives great support and is a master wood worker: 
  • BRING who gives us inspiration on recycling and with whom we will soon be certified under their sustainable RE:think Business program;
  • Threadbare Print House who will be making the supreme logo wear.
  • TC Curtis and his crew at The Industrial Company for all of their skilled work on renovations!; and 
  • the LCC Small Business Development Center whose classes and advisers were instrumental in providing resources, information and reassurance as I launched into the development of Mudra.

Yoga props and equipment will be purchased from Manduka which strives to develop the highest quality yoga products more sustainably. Kira Grace clothing will be sold at Mudra. Kira Grace manufactures amazing quality yoga wear right here in the US! They are a woman-owned business and give back through the Off the Mat, Into the World campaign. 

Then there are the host of yoga instructors, friends and family that have been great personal inspirations, supporters and have listened to countless hours of planning and given their helpful advice.  You know who you are and I am so grateful! (especially Ethan Nelson; without whom I would never have been able to take this leap! and Stella; who gives me daily inspiration.)


Risks & Challenges

Yoga studios are not known to be huge money makers. Risks and challenges center around attracting and retaining clients. Mudra will always strive to create the best yoga experience for our clients - from customer service to instruction to access to changing areas. The little details are as important to us as the big ones! When you donate through this campaign, it reduces the risk that this small business may face in the first months of startup.

It takes a village.  Each of the supporters of Mudra, like you, are instrumental in making the studio a success. Networking with friends, family and colleagues is what made Mudra a reality and I will forever hold my community near and dear for their ongoing support!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word on this campaign and on Mudra in general!

  • Share this campaign page as widely as you are able. 
  • Like our Facebook Page and share it with your networks as well. 
  • Mention Mudra to anyone and everyone. 
  • Come do yoga with us when we open! A lot. 
  • Find out more about Mudra on our webpage: www.eugenemudra.com and talk about the cool things you learn there to those you love!
  • Spread the word and the excitement! This place is going to be an amazing yoga haven! Make it yours.
